title: Systems Research Engineer, Machine Learning Systems
description: Role As a Systems Research Engineer specialized in Machine Learning Systems, you will play a crucial role in researching and building the next generation AI platform at Together. Working closely with the modeling, algorithm, and engineering teams, you will design large-scale distributed training systems and a low-latency/high-throughput inference engine that serves a diverse, rapidly growing user base. Your research skills will be vital in staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning systems, ensuring that our AI infrastructure remains at the forefront of innovation. Requirements Strong background in machine learning systems, such as distributed learning and efficient inference for large language models and diffusion models Knowledge of ML/AI applications and models, especially foundation models such as large language models and diffusion models, how they are constructed and how they are used Knowledge of system performance profiling and optimization tools for ML systems Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Bachelor's, Master's, or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent practical experience Responsibilities Optimize and fine-tune existing training and inference platform to achieve better performance and scalability Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate cutting edge research ideas into existing software systems Develop your own ideas of optimizing the training and inference platforms and push the frontier of machine learning systems research Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning systems techniques and apply many of them to the Together platform About Together AI Together AI is a research-driven artificial intelligence company. We believe open and transparent AI systems will drive innovation and create the best outcomes for society, and together we are on a mission to significantly lower the cost of modern AI systems by co-designing software, hardware, algorithms, and models. We have contributed to leading open-source research, models, and datasets to advance the frontier of AI, and our team has been behind technological advancement such as FlashAttention, Hyena, FlexGen, and RedPajama. We invite you to join a passionate group of researchers in our journey in building the next generation AI infrastructure. Compensation We offer competitive compensation, startup equity, health insurance, and other benefits, as well as flexibility in terms of remote work. The US base salary range for this full-time position is: $160,000 - $230,000 + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by location, level and role. Individual compensation will be determined by experience, skills, and job-related knowledge. Equal Opportunity Together AI is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. Please see our privacy policy at https://www.together.ai/privacy

title: Sr. AI/ML Engineer
description: Job Description Quilr is a start up in stealth mode based out of Austin. We are aiming to solve a problem in the Cybersecurity space that has been untouched till now. The founder has a 12 year history in Cybersecurity and has exited a company for $1B+. We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team to build a core engine of the product. The Senior Data Scientist will work closely with fellow developers to build the product. We are looking for someone who is very knowledgeable and a fast learner. Has to be very driven, enthusiastic and wants to be part of building something big. This will be a very high demanding role with very aggressive timelines, long work hours and complex problem statements. If this doesn't excite you and rather scares you, this isn't the role for you. Responsibilities: Designing AI/ML systems. Researching and setting up ML algorithmsand tools. Selecting appropriate data sets. Picking appropriate data representation methods. Identifying differences in data distribution that affect model performance. Verifying data quality. Transforming and converting data science prototypes. Performing statistical analysis. Running machine learning tests. Using results to improve models. Training and retraining systems when needed. Extending machine learning libraries. Developing ML apps according to use case requirements. Staying up to date on new trends and technologies in ML and AI. Decide,Deploy,Train, tune and Scale AI/ ML models focused on solving particular use cases. Designing and build data pipelines to feed data to train model and manage them. Research AI techniques used in Similar problem statements by other organizations. Understand the space of cybersecurity. Required Experience: Advanced math and statistics skills in subjects such as linear algebra, calculus and Bayesian statistics. An advanced degree in computer science, math, statistics or related fields. 7+ Years of experience in machine learning, neural networks, deep learning or related fields. Strong analytical, problem-solving, communication and teamwork skills. Software engineeringskills. Experience in data science. Experience with coding and programming languages, including Python, Java, C++, C, Rand JavaScript. Experience working with ML frameworks. Experience working with ML libraries and packages, such as the Natural Language Toolkit. An understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture. Knowledge of computer architecture. Knowledge and fluency in cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) ands Azure. Experience with Python for developing machine learning pipelines using scikit-learn or R. Experience in or can Implement/Develop/Tune/Train - Relational AI/Graph AI models, LLM models, NLP/NLU, Behavioral AI, Computer Vision etc. This is very young start up, with big dreams. If you think you are up for it feel free to apply. Company Description This is a very young startup in Stealth mode looking to build a transformative product in the cybersecurity space. Will not stop at anything. Very hardworking and innovative culture. This is a very young startup in Stealth mode looking to build a transformative product in the cybersecurity space. Will not stop at anything. Very hardworking and innovative culture.

title: Jr. Data Analyst
description: First, a little about us: Born in 2000 as an ad agency for the video game, entertainment, and technology communities 80 teammates strong across the US, LATAM, and European markets Our employee turnover has historically been ~8% annually Ad agency partner for Bethesda Softworks, Square Enix, CD Projekt Red, Riot Forge, Capcom, Sega, and other top gaming and entertainment partners. See our work at www.liquidadvertising.com This can be a hybrid or remote position based in Michigan What's this position about? We are ALWAYS curious about what data are telling us. Every day we run dozens of digital advertising campaigns, spending millions of dollars, on behalf of our clients—some of the most successful videogame publishers in the industry. Our analytics team helps ensure that we're investing those advertising dollars in the most effective and efficient way possible. Our analytics projects and reporting vary widely in complexity, typically exploring datasets in the millions of rows. This junior position on our analytics team will show you how to create rich data stories about advertising campaigns—and the video game fans behind them. As the successful candidate, you will use your Python, SQL, and other scripting skills in wrangling data, then visualizing in Tableau to help your teammates and our clients understand the stories in the data. Requirements What do we look for? Ideally, you will be a four-year graduate of a research-heavy academic discipline with some professional analytics experience. Your technical skills will include— Strength with Python analytics routines Experience with SQL and other data-focused scripting Excel formulas and macros with an emphasis on analytical functions Developing visualizations and narratives, preferably with Tableau dashboard experience Driving projects from data ingestion to presentation (tell us about this in your application) Coding experience is not required but highly preferred Benefits The perks we offer Base salary for this role is $50,000-$59,000 per year. Actual salary offered will be based on experience, skillset, and location. Our people also enjoy remote work options, a generous annual bonus plan, fully paid premiums for comprehensive health insurance, generous paid time off plans, and 100% match on 401k savings. Our stance Liquid Advertising is committed to creating an anti-racist, anti-sexist environment. We're building an ad agency where committed and creative people from all backgrounds can do their best work. No agencies, please. This is a pretty good representation of this position's responsibilities but is not a comprehensive job description. Duties, clients, and team assignments may change as assigned. We regret we cannot consider applicants outside of the United States or those requiring visa sponsorship at this time.

title: Data Analyst - Data Governance
description: Role: Data Analyst - Data Governance Location: 2 days onsite in Auburn Hills, MI Duration: 10 months Work auth: USC/GC or EADs LinkedIn: Must have Please send only 8 + YEARS PROFILE WITH Banking and Financial experience, Must have DATA GOVERNANCE experience Top 3 Skills 5 years’ experience in data governance and/or data management 5 years’ experience serving in the role as a data steward, business analyst, or data analyst Proficiency in data profiling, statistical analysis, data analysis, data quality, and data standardization / cleansing techniques 2 or more years’ experience working on Agile project teams – use of JIRA Experience with Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake (Python, R is a plus) Job Description The Data Quality Analyst will support the definition of data quality standards, requirements, and specifications for data quality controls in the data lifecycle. They will also provide support for operational processes that measure, monitor and report on data quality levels as well as the remediation of identified data quality issues. The person will meet with various stakeholders to gather and document information, perform data analysis, and conduct assessments of business and technical processes involved in managing data. Summary The Data Analyst is a critical data governance role for enabling data integrity and ensuring data meets the criteria established by the Chief Data & Analytics Office for data management, quality, and certification. The Data Analyst will collaborate with Data Stewards, Information Architects, Data Quality Analysts and business/technical stakeholders to research and document data, metadata, and reference data to ensure it meets specific use cases and regulatory expectations. As part of the position, this person will meet with various stakeholders to gather information, facilitate meetings, conduct research, and document information. Responsibilities Data Documentation: Define data security classifications Analyze data profiles – partner with data users and stakeholders to enable an understanding of data being considered for use case Catalog data, ensuring it has a definition/description and basic metadata is available, and is associated with a regulation or policy if required Define data quality rule requirements and data standardization needs Maintain comprehensive data documentation, including data dictionaries, lineage, data flow diagrams, and source-to-target mappings Data Guidance and Use: Guide users in understanding their data, its quality, and data selection based on use case to ensure data is fit for purpose. Collaborate to identify needed data sets and critical data elements Deliver data requirements to data engineering for configuration Validate data in various environments to ensure it meets established requirements for data quality and use Work in an Agile framework for delivery of tasks within a defined project sprint Follow established data standards, procedures, and processes to ensure data meets the needs of the use case and applicable regulatory requirements. Experience 5 years’ experience in data governance and/or data management 5 years’ experience serving in the role as a data steward, business analyst, or data analyst Proficiency in data profiling, statistical analysis, data analysis, data quality, and data standardization / cleansing techniques Strong data query and analytics skills; ability to analyze data trends, identify patterns and proactively address potential data quality issues Proficient in documenting data – data catalogs, source-to-target mappings, data lineage, data flow, and procedural documentation for audit or executive review 2 or more years’ experience working on Agile project teams – use of JIRA Experience with Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake (Python, R is a plus) Skills Relationship management Facilitation Data querying Problem solving Communication across all levels – written and verbal Attention to detail with ability to align with the big picture Issue resolution Decision-making Able to synthesize information leading to recommendations of solutions Multi-tasking Influencing others Curiosity – seeking to understand and improve
summary: The Data Analyst will work within the Chief Data & Analytics Office to ensure data integrity and quality by defining data quality standards, documenting data, and collaborating with stakeholders to improve data use and understanding. The role involves working with various tools and platforms, including Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake, as well as leveraging skills in data profiling, analysis, and standardization.

title: Research Data Analyst
description: Job Summary Reporting to the Director of Research, the Research Data Analyst serves as the database expert and analyst to support data reporting throughout the department. The Research Data Analyst manages database conceptualization, builds, reporting, auditing, training, etc. research department data. The Research Data Analyst research generates research reports, administrative, financial, time-keeping and operational reports as needed and requested and supports the information technology needs of the department including system support, user training, troubleshooting, and problem resolution. The Research Data Analyst research prepares and creates reports for executive level presentation. Essential Functions Collaborates with physicians, clinical research nurses and other research staff to build, update and maintain all department level research databases used in clinical and translational research studies. Databases include externally sponsored, investigator-initiated, and federally funded studies with multi-year follow-up. Builds and maintains databases in REDCap, a HIPAA compliant and highly secure web-based application to capture data for clinical research and create databases and projects. Manage large REDCap databases. Works with clinical researchers at all levels (e.g., clinical research nurses, physicians, residents, fellows) within the clinical research community to create research quality data sets and reports using REDCap and other databases. Helps researchers understand the data available, their project specific data requirements, and meet their data reporting needs. Trains new research personnel in all aspects of database building and maintenance in a manner that streamlines data entry, processing, and analysis. Maintains training logs for individuals trained on each research study. Reviews research records and maintains data logs e.g., training logs, Post-Production Database Changes logs, and Data Rules for data entry in each database, for auditing purposes. Works closely with internal and external research monitors/auditors during the auditing process by providing data cuts for investigator-initiated studies and making corrections in the database and data collection tools based on auditor recommendations. Upholds Institutional Review Board (IRB) restrictions on data use and access to follow HIPAA and PHI rules to maintain patient privacy and confidentiality. Abstracts data for data analysis purposes and provides formal written documentation of the dataset construction process, including inclusion and exclusion criteria and key definitions of data elements. Serves as the technical expert to assist in optimization efforts to improve data science and standardization processes within REDCap. Data entry of research personnel time logs into Kronos for redistribution of hours to research studies. Maintain copies of signed time logs and PTO for auditing purposes. Run query and reimbursement reports for externally sponsored grants. Demonstrates the delivery of exceptional internal and external customer service behaviors in every aspect of the job Expert database and computer skills: Microsoft Office (Word, Excel), Outlook, REDCap, excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to work independently and assume responsibility, excellent organizational skills, ability to meet data deadlines and maintain confidentiality. Maintain data integrity within the department. Must be able to work in a team consisting of physicians, nurses, technicians, and ancillary hospital staff. Knowledge of FDA Regulations and Good Clinical Practices. How Corewell Health Cares For You Comprehensive benefits package to meet your financial, health, and work/life balance goals. Learn more here. On-demand pay program powered by Payactiv Discounts directory with deals on the things that matter to you, like restaurants, phone plans, spas, and more! Optional identity theft protection, home and auto insurance, pet insurance Traditional and Roth retirement options with service contribution and match savings Relocation assistance (OPTIONAL) Qualifications Required Required Associate's Degree 5 years of relevant experience Minimum of (5) years of experience in complex research database creation and management (hardware and software). Required Preferred Required Associate's Degree 5 years of relevant experience Minimum of (5) years of experience in complex research database creation and management (hardware and software). Required About Corewell Health As a team member at Corewell Health, you will play an essential role in delivering personalized health care to our patients, members and our communities. We are committed to cultivating and investing in YOU. Our top-notch teams are comprised of collaborators, leaders and innovators that continue to build on one shared mission statement - to improve health, instill humanity and inspire hope. Join a nationally recognized health system with an ambitious vision of continued advancement and excellence. This career site is for Non-Corewell Health team members only. Corewell Health is committed to providing a safe environment for our team members, patients, visitors, and community. summary: The Research Data Analyst is responsible for managing and analyzing research data, including building and maintaining databases, creating reports, and training research staff. They collaborate with physicians, nurses, and other research staff to ensure data accuracy and integrity. They also ensure compliance with HIPAA and IRB regulations.

title: Data Analyst - Business Intelligence
description: More Than A Job! Why do you work each day? To us, our jobs are not just something we do to make a living, it’s a way to live. We work to support our members; whether celebrating moments of joy, finding a solution to an obstacle, or offering encouragement through a time of struggle. The worth of our work isn’t measured in dollars and cents, it’s seen in our communities and felt by the people who believe in us. The data analyst will also assist the applications team with support of Oracle and SQL databases and perform light DBA activities. The data analyst role requires creativity with a high attention to detail and drive for data accuracy. If you enjoy working within an agile team this may be a great role for you. Write SQL queries Interpret data, analyze results and create parameterized reports, dashboards and visualizations Create workflows in Alteryx to prep, blend data and move data to internal and external sources Assist the applications teams with supporting Oracle and SQL server databases Create data models for storing, reporting and visualization purposes What You’ll Bring BA/BS data analytics/computer science/information or similar degree is required 2 years job related experience is preferred 2+ years Microsoft SQL and/or Oracle querying is required What You’ll Get Ability to collaborate and build a sense of togetherness that contributes to a positive work environment. Being open to change and embracing new opportunities can lead to diverse experiences and career advancement. By prioritizing member wellbeing, which leads to increase engagement, improved team dynamics, higher levels of motivation and a stronger community culture.
summary: Data Analyst responsible for data projects using tools like Alteryx, SQL Reporting Services, and Power BI. Assists applications team with Oracle and SQL databases. Requires creativity, attention to detail, and agility.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Location: Detroit, MI/Hybrid Duration: 12 months Description: Dept: Business Analytics & Cl Engagement Description Responsible for leading complex projects and independently executing analyses that support the healthcare value portfolio. Translates technical results into answers for healthcare business needs and applies a strong understanding of healthcare industry when creating those solutions. Partners effectively outside of the business team to execute work. Works closely with team members to fully understand the business question and source associated data required for a solution. Executes work efficiently, bringing forward process enhancements with a continuous improvement mindset. Top 3 Required Skills/Experience Minimum 6 years experience in Advanced Data Analytics. Proficient in advanced functions in SQL. Advanced understanding of data warehousing and data mining concepts such as: DataMart design, fact tables, dimension tables, data views within data marts/data warehouses, data models such as star schemas and snowflake schemas. Required Skills/Experience The Rest Of The Required Skills/experience. Include: Ability to recognize data patterns, quantify potential issues and identify solutions. Ability to standardize, harmonize, clean, prepare and use data for developing datasets, reporting and analysis. Ability to perform root cause analysis on external and internal processes and data to identify opportunities for improvement and answer questions Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. Conduct data gathering and analysis to understand business requirements. Provide direction for short and long-term solutions and provide the team direction to ensure understanding of business goals and direction. Provide input from a business and IT perspective. Preferred Skills/Experience Optional But Preferred Skills/experience. Include: Healthcare Experience Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, and scripting languages: Python or Scala Solid working knowledge of Microsoft tools and software (i.e., Excel, Visio, Access, PowerPoint) Display innovation in identifying, proposing, and overseeing the execution of business solutions. Written and verbal communication skills interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently, or within a team environment. Education/Certifications Include: Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business, Mathematics, Healthcare Information Technology or similar degree required. Masters Degree preferred. Works closely with clients, business analysts and team members to understand the business requirements that drive the analysis and design of quality technical solutions. These solutions must be aligned with business and IT strategies and are in compliance with the organization's architectural standards. Application Developers are involved in the full systems life cycle and therefore are responsible for designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting application software that is delivered on time and within budget. Responsibilities beyond development of software may include participation in component and data architecture design, technology planning, product evaluation, advanced testing processes and buy vs. build recommendations. Individuals also provide input to project plans related to the Application Development initiative. Application Developers have a strong knowledge of programming languages used by the organization. They have experience in systems design and have a solid understanding of development, database development, testing, and integration methodologies. Knowledge of current and emerging IT products, services and processes is required. Work Complexity Works on major projects as a project team member, sometimes as a project lead. Works on projects that may span a broad range of applications. Supports multiple applications. Expertise in multiple technical environments and possesses business knowledge that spans one or more business areas. Education/ Experience Bachelor's degree in related field preferred. 5 Years Of Application Programming And Analysis Experience Required. Has a broad level of understanding surrounding information systems and application architecture standards. Demonstrated ability to analyze and interpret complex problems or processes that span multiple business areas, identify and understand requirements, and develop alternate solutions. Experience designing, developing and testing applications using proven or emerging technologies.
summary: This job description is for an Advanced Data Analyst role in the healthcare industry. The individual will lead complex projects, analyze data to support the healthcare value portfolio, and translate technical results into answers for business needs. They will work with team members to understand business questions, source data, and develop solutions.  The role requires proficiency in SQL, data warehousing, and data mining concepts, as well as experience with big data tools like Hadoop and Spark.  Experience in healthcare and scripting languages like Python or Scala are preferred.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description: No H1B Zoom Hybrid need LinkedIn Experience 5 years experience in data and/or information asset quality management 3 years experience managing data quality monitoring and remediation processes Proficiency in data profiling, statistical analysis, data analysis, and data standardization / cleansing techniques Experience using statistical techniques to discover the root cause of data quality issues and recommend remediation options Strong SQL skills with the ability to write sophisticated queriers across large, complex data sets Ability to analyze data trends, identify patterns and proactively address potential data quality issues Proficient in documenting data quality issues and remediation plans in a clear and concise manner Experience with Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake (Python, R is a plus) Data Quality Analyst The Data Quality Analyst will support the definition of data quality standards, requirements, and specifications for data quality controls in the data lifecycle. They will also provide support for operational processes that measure, monitor and report on data quality levels as well as the remediation of identified data quality issues. The person will meet with various stakeholders to gather and document information, perform data analysis, and conduct assessments of business and technical processes involved in managing data. Responsibilities Data Quality Remediation Collaborate with internal stakeholders to gather information and document identified data quality issues. Perform root cause analysis of identified data quality issues. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support development and implementation of remediation plans to promptly resolve identified data quality issues. Data Quality Measurement, Monitoring and Reporting Processes Define and develop data quality metrics based upon data quality standards. Support the development of automated data quality reports and dashboards. In partnership with Data Stewards, monitor data quality levels and respond to alerts when data quality metrics for critical data elements are outside the acceptable data quality thresholds. Data Quality Management Framework Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify business needs and opportunities for data quality improvement, including identifying data critical to meeting business needs. Perform an assessment of the data to understand data content and relationships and comparing actual data to rules and expectation. Develop standards and templates for documenting data quality rules so they have a consistent format and meaning. Experience 5 years experience in data and/or information asset quality management 3 years experience managing data quality monitoring and remediation processes Proficiency in data profiling, statistical analysis, data analysis, and data standardization / cleansing techniques Experience using statistical techniques to discover the root cause of data quality issues and recommend remediation options Strong SQL skills with the ability to write sophisticated queriers across large, complex data sets Ability to analyze data trends, identify patterns and proactively address potential data quality issues Proficient in documenting data quality issues and remediation plans in a clear and concise manner Experience with Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake (Python, R is a plus) Skills Problem solving Issue resolution Decision-making Able to synthesize information leading to recommendations of solutions Communication across all levels – written and verbal Attention to detail with ability to align with the big picture Multi-tasking Influencing others Challenging professionally Relationship management
summary: The Data Quality Analyst will support the definition of data quality standards, requirements, and specifications for data quality controls in the data lifecycle. They will also provide support for operational processes that measure, monitor and report on data quality levels as well as the remediation of identified data quality issues. The person will meet with various stakeholders to gather and document information, perform data analysis, and conduct assessments of business and technical processes involved in managing data.

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: Create Data Governance Adoption and Implementation Plan. Recommend a framework for collecting and reporting on metrics or KPIs to measure the adoption of data policies/processes/standards and to measure the beneficial impacts of data governance. Define data quality rule requirements and data standardization needs Support the establishment, implementation, and maintenance of data governance Support activities such as establishing, standardizing, creating efficiencies across the department through shared data support services Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree 5+ years of data management, data governance, data engineering, data modeling, data strategy Demonstrated track record of domain expertise including understanding technical concepts necessary and industry trends, and possess in-depth knowledge of immediate systems worked on and some knowledge of adjacent systems Strong problem solving, written and verbal communication skills with the ability to work collaborate well with team members and business partners
summary: This position requires a data governance expert with 5+ years of experience to lead the adoption and implementation of a data governance framework. The individual will be responsible for collecting metrics, defining data quality rules and standardization needs, and supporting the establishment, implementation, and maintenance of data governance. They will also work to establish shared data support services across the department.

title: Data Analytics - Business Intelligence Analyst
description: *** This is a 100% in-office position located in the Cascade, Michigan area. You must be able to reliably commute to be considered for this position. *** Position Summary The Data Analytics - Business Intelligence Analyst facilitates internal and external reporting for Xtend and our credit union partners and extracts valuable, actionable insights from client and internal data by creating custom queries and conducting thorough analyses. This includes assisting with and executing various Xtend Marketing Data Analytics and Business Intelligence Initiatives. This position involves close collaboration with the AVP of Communications and our network partner CU*Answers’ Asterisk Intelligence team to maintain, improve, and sell existing and new Xtend services to credit unions. The Business Intelligence Analyst works to maintain and support data-driven decisions throughout the credit union industry, proportioning a data driven culture in order to transform the way credit union organizations operate, forecast, communicate and deliver. Essential Job Functions Extract raw data from CU*BASE; perform daily tasks associated with monthly and recurring responsibilities; complete monthly processing for services involving running queries, downloading information, creating reports, and conducting in-depth analyses to provide actionable recommendations for internal staff and credit union clients. Provide weekly and monthly reporting updates; handle monthly and quarterly reporting for both recurring and one-time services; assist internal departments with reporting needs; create databases and provide insights for various purposes. Analyze existing data analytics practices to isolate areas ripe for improvement or enhancement. Serve as a client-facing liaison between Credit Union Professionals, Credit Union Data, and Analytical tool offerings. Drive marketing and sales efforts for the Data Analytics business under the guidance of the AVP of Communications. Participates in client education programs with an emphasis on the utility of data, analytical product offerings, and industry trends in data usage. Maintain a professional network and rapport for future new product releases, ala carte projects, and consulting engagements. Assist in analyzing Xtend’s Corporate data, identifying opportunities and threats, supporting management with trends and forecasts, and offering data insight as delegated by management. Provide analytical services to benefit our credit union clients and the industry by establishing best practices, education, consulting, Ala Carte Services, and recurring analytical services. Assist in coordinating client education on CU*BASE (CU*Answers’ proprietary credit union software) data analytics specific to marketing and sales with special attention paid to relevant dashboards. Contribute to the development and improvement of current toolset of products; consult credit union clients on tool products. Deliver, speak to, and educate credit union clients on project results, service reports, and large-scale analysis via Web, Video, or otherwise. Facilitate, schedule, and engage in sales calls and day-to-day onboarding activities for credit unions; contribute to service launches and onboardings. Maintain client communications via Outlook email, client service portal Zendesk, and escalate communications and questions to the AVP of Communications as needed. Maintain department quality control of folders and shared data by performing regular internal and CU*BASE file audits. Work closely with other Xtend Departments for internal projects and custom query needs including but not limited to pulling information for Annual Leadership Conference and providing data insights for various purposes. Set and meet annual goals for your professional and personal growth that align with the annual Business Plan goals. Meet deadlines for both internal department projects and client service requests and launch calendars. Other duties as assigned by management. Job Qualifications Two-year degree in a business-related field or equivalent work experience is required. Extensive knowledge of credit union operations, regulations and procedures, accounting, and balancing functions is preferred. Superior research and analytical skills to track and predict trends are required. Strong communication skills to deliver software support to clients with varying personality styles is required. Ability to use discretion when dealing with sensitive or confidential data is required. Must be able to collaborate effectively with executives, creative teams, research and development, and product development teams. Excellent negotiation, problem solving, and analytical skills are required. Proficient in standard office software applications, especially Microsoft Excel (MS Office) is required. Classroom training experience and expertise are preferred. Must be willing to take calculated risks and manage expectations of both internal development teams and potential and existing customers. WORK ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES Xtend operates in a professional office building setting. Some job assignments at Xtend are primarily conducted within the office building(s) while others have moderate to extensive travel responsibilities as described in the Job Functions and/or Job Qualifications section(s) above. Xtend is committed to working with its employees to reasonably accommodate them with the physical aspects of the position. Communication and Contact: The employee communicates effectively both verbally and in writing with superiors, colleagues, and individuals inside and outside the company. Relationships with Others: The employee works effectively and relates well with others Including superiors, colleagues, and individuals inside and outside the company. The employee exhibits a professional manner in dealing with others and works to maintain constructive working relationships. Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to sit, talk, hear, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer and telephone. This position involves long periods of time focused on a computer screen. The employee must be able to see within normal vision range. The individual must have manual dexterity to operate a keyboard and mouse. Visual color discrimination (the ability to match or detect differences between colors, including shades of color and brightness) is required for creating and reviewing branded documents. NOTICE This job description is not intended to be, nor should be construed as a contract for employment. Xtend makes no guarantee of permanent employment. This job description is to be used as a guideline to give the employee an understanding of what Xtend has defined this position to be. Xtend will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental disabilities of qualified applicants unless to do so would cause an undue hardship. Disabled individuals who feel accommodation is needed to perform their job, or the job for which they have applied, must notify Xtend in writing of the need for reasonable accommodation within 180 days after the date the individual knew or reasonably should have known that an accommodation was needed. Xtend, thereafter, will make all reasonable accommodations unless to do so would pose an undue hardship. Xtend is willing to accommodate disabilities to the extent a financial service organization can without impacting financial control or member service. Xtend is an Equal Opportunity Employer. About CU* Answers: CU*Answers offers a wide array of career opportunities ranging from software development to customer service roles. With our employee development initiatives, we focus on our employees finding a career, not just a job. CU*Answers has a proven track record of developing staff members and promoting from within. If you are ready to join a team built on the principles embedded throughout the credit union industry, check out our career opportunities today!
summary: The Data Analytics - Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for creating reports and extracting actionable insights from client and internal data. They collaborate with the AVP of Communications and CU*Answers' Asterisk Intelligence team to maintain, improve, and sell Xtend services to credit unions. This role requires strong analytical and communication skills, and proficiency in MS Office, particularly Excel.

title: BI/Data Analyst V
description: Position Title: BI/Data Analyst Requisition Number: V Team: IT Reports to: Director of IT Visioneering Story- A powerful team with a strong work ethic. Visioneering was founded in 1953 as a premier tooling supplier to the automotive industry. As the company grew both in size and capability newer markets were entered and serviced. In 1998 Visioneering transformed into a full-service design and build company, primarily servicing the aerospace community. Visioneering prides itself as being an industry leader in design, manufacturing and customer service. In 2015, Visioneering invested in the aerospace community's future by building a new state of the art facility. This facility coupled with our work forces expertise, allows Visioneering to provide its customers with the most advanced manufacturing methods to ensure unsurpassed quality, on time delivery and customer satisfaction. More information? Check out our quick video: Company Video - Visioneering (vistool.com) Equal Opportunity Employer Visioneering is an equal employment opportunity employer, offering equal employment opportunities to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, marital status and any other characteristic protected by law. Character of Position As a BI/Data Analyst , you will be a key team member in helping Visioneering gain insight into core business applications by creating custom reports using various reporting and BI tools. This position will have also have a significant voice in the selection and implementation of new technologies to improve financial and operational reporting capabilities, perform integrations with on-premises and cloud based business systems, and be part of a larger team focused on upgrading and maintaining the current ERP environment. title: Data Analyst (Hybrid)
description: Come work for the largest equipment dealer in North America! Are you a hardworking individual that thrives in a fast-paced environment and looking to take your career to the next level? If so, then come join our award-winning team! We provide our employees with the following tools and resources to be successful: Training Tuition assistance Employee stock purchase plan Outstanding benefits package (BCBS PPO, Delta Dental and EyeMed Vision, plus much more!) 401(k) with match Competitive wages Paid time off 10 paid holidays Work schedule: M-F, day shift Responsibilities Alta Equipment Company is seeking a full-time Data Analyst at our Livonia, MI corporate headquarters. In this role, your primary focus will be on utilizing SQL for data extraction and manipulation and creating insightful Power BI dashboards to visualize data trends and performance metrics. Responsibilities of this position consist of, but are not limited to: Data Extraction & Manipulation: Use SQL to query and manage data from various databases, ensuring data accuracy and integrity. Dashboard Creation: Develop, design, and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards to provide actionable insights and support business objectives. Data Analysis: Conduct detailed data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Reporting: Generate regular and ad-hoc reports to support various departments and stakeholders. Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Data Quality Assurance: Ensure data quality and consistency by performing regular data audits and implementing validation processes. Documentation: Maintain thorough documentation of data sources, methodologies, and processes Qualifications Position Requirements: Must be eligible to work in the US for any employer without visa sponsorship now or in the future. title: Logistics Data Analyst (Freight)
description: Base Pay Range: $56,800.00 - $96,600.00 Annually Primary Location: USA-MI-Ann Arbor-KLA KLA’s total rewards package for employees may also include participation in performance incentive programs and eligibility for additional benefits identified below. Interns are eligible for some of the benefits identified below. Our pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed above reflects the minimum and maximum pay for this position in the primary location identified in this posting. Actual pay depends on several factors, including location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education level or training. If applicable, your recruiter can share more about the specific pay range for your preferred location during the hiring process. Company Overview KLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop, smartphone, wearable device, voice-controlled gadget, flexible screen, VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration, research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and we invest 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world’s leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow’s electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us. Job Description/Preferred Qualifications We are seeking a highly motivated Freight Data Analyst to join our multifaceted Business Operations and Digital Solutions team, supporting KLA logistics. The Freight Data Analyst will play a meaningful role in optimizing our freight operations by leveraging data-driven insights. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work at the intersection of transportation, analytics, and technology. Responsibilities: Analyze freight data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement in operational efficiency and cost reduction. Develop and maintain reporting tools and dashboards to supervise key performance indicators (KPIs) such as freight spend, carrier performance, transit times, and shipment accuracy. Collaborate with cross-functional teams including logistics operations, procurement, and finance to interpret data, address challenges, and drive strategic decision-making. Support root cause analysis on freight discrepancies, delays, and other issues to propose corrective actions and process improvements. Use statistical methods and predictive modeling to forecast freight volumes, capacity needs, and pricing trends. Perform ad-hoc analysis and data mining to support business initiatives and projects related to freight management, including RFQs. Stay current with industry trends, standard processes, and technologies in freight analytics and logistics. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with Power BI Minimum Qualifications Master's Level Degree and 0 years related work experience; Bachelor's Level Degree and related work experience of 2 years The company offers a total rewards package that is competitive and comprehensive including but not limited to the following: medical, dental, vision, life, and other voluntary benefits, 401(K) including company matching, employee stock purchase program (ESPP), student debt assistance, tuition reimbursement program, development and career growth opportunities and programs, financial planning benefits, wellness benefits including an employee assistance program (EAP), paid time off and paid company holidays, and family care and bonding leave. KLA is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other status protected by applicable law. We will ensure that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us at talent.acquisition@kla.com or at +1-408-352-2808 to request accommodation.
summary: KLA, a global leader in semiconductor manufacturing technology, seeks a Freight Data Analyst to join their Business Operations and Digital Solutions team. The role involves analyzing freight data, developing reporting tools, collaborating with cross-functional teams, performing root cause analysis, using predictive modeling, and staying up-to-date with industry trends.  The ideal candidate has experience with Power BI. The position offers a competitive total rewards package including benefits like health insurance, 401(k), employee stock purchase program, tuition reimbursement, and more.

title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst II
description: Position Summary: This position is responsible for the governance, extracting, normalization, reporting and analytics of healthcare data. This work will include data manipulation, validation and cleansing. Aggregates disparate data from internal and external systems in various formats and develops meaningful reports to assist leadership in the monitoring and achievement of performance objectives. Designs and develops data visualization solutions to communicate results to key decision makers. Diving into large, and complex health care data to produce innovative analysis of historical patterns and insights around the integrity of the source data and data processes Essential Functions and Responsibilities: Manages the importing, exporting and mining of large healthcare data Aggregates disparate clinical and financial data in various formats. Construct data queries, or refresh data queries for staff to retrieve pertinent clinical or administrative data Resolve discrepancies with data and instill stakeholder confidence in reporting accuracy Develops reporting for data governance including trends and statistical analysis of data quality and integrity Recommends workflow processes and procedures to monitor timely and accurate receipt and transfer of data Collaborates with stakeholders to gather business needs , establish scope of projects, manage project timelines, and meet deadlines Develops data preparation and validation routines to support data mining. Collaborates to define and create appropriate key performance indicators Creates reports and dashboards for stakeholders Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects Continually enhances knowledge of healthcare data and information technology Coordinates and oversees special projects as identified and assigned Other duties as assigned or when necessary to maintain efficient operations of the department and the McLaren Health Care as a whole. Qualifications: Required: Bachelor’s degree in data science, computer science, engineering, health informatics technology or related field Three years’ experience in data analytics with data mining or masters plus one year experience OR Master’s in data science or analytics One (1) year of healthcare experience with data mining, data analysis and reporting. Additional Information Schedule: Full-time Requisition ID: 24004221 Daily Work Times: Standard Business Hours Hours Per Pay Period: 80 On Call: No Weekends: No
summary: This role involves governing, extracting, normalizing, reporting, and analyzing healthcare data. Responsibilities include data manipulation, validation, cleansing, aggregation from various internal and external systems, developing reports to monitor performance, designing data visualization solutions, and conducting innovative analysis of historical patterns and data integrity.

title: Power Platform & Data Analytics Intern
description: Position Power Platform & Data Analytics Intern Location Auburn Hills, MI About Us PHINIA: Advancing sustainability today, powering carbon-free tomorrow At PHINIA, we create premium fuel systems, electrical systems and aftermarket parts for internal combustion engine (ICE) vehicles and industrial applications. We make sure our products are clean, efficient and high-value, because we know the actions we take today will have a profound impact on the world tomorrow. Our goal? The cleanest ICE technology: carbon-free combustion. Always, PHINIA puts quality first, continuing our legacy with over a century of rich expertise and technological innovation. The name PHINIA has roots related to “bright” and “future,” representing our confidence and commitment to bettering the world. Our Culture We believe health and safety of our employees are a top priority, we care about our local communities and the global environment. PHINIA promotes and nurtures a diverse and inclusive environment, honors integrity, strives for excellence, commits to responsibility for our communities and the environment, and builds on the power of collaboration. Career Opportunities We believe in building a brighter tomorrow for our employees as well as our customers and encourage you to learn about our long history, strong culture, new technologies and future vision. We offer a strong local presence and interesting global opportunities. Join us on this shared journey toward a brighter tomorrow. Job Purpose The Power Platform & Data Analytics Intern at PHINIA will play a crucial role in enhancing our existing model-driven Power App and developing dashboards to facilitate enterprise-level IT operations reviews. This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in both Power Apps and Power BI, contributing to the optimization of our IT processes and decision-making capabilities. Key Responsibilities Enhancement of Model-Driven Power App: Work with the IT team to understand the current model-driven Power App. Develop and implement enhancements to improve functionality and user experience. Test and troubleshoot enhancements to ensure optimal performance. Dashboard Development: Design and develop Power BI dashboards that provide insights for enterprise-level IT operations reviews. Integrate data from various sources to create comprehensive and insightful dashboards. Ensure dashboards are user-friendly and meet the needs of stakeholders. Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform decision-making. Generate reports and visualizations that communicate complex data in an understandable way. Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with IT team members and other stakeholders to gather requirements and feedback. Present findings and updates to the team and management. Continuous Improvement: Stay updated with the latest features and best practices for Power Apps and Power BI. Proactively suggest improvements to existing processes and tools. What We’re Looking For Experience: Previous experience or coursework in Power Apps and Power BI. Understanding of data integration and visualization best practices. Education: Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field. Technical Expertise: Proficiency in Power Apps and Power BI. Familiarity with data analysis and visualization techniques. Basic understanding of SQL and data management. Skills and Abilities: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Attention to detail and a proactive approach to learning and development. Key Competencies Proficiency in Power Apps and Power BI Analytical thinking and data visualization Effective communication and collaboration Attention to detail and proactive problem-solving Adaptability to evolving technological environments What We Believe Product Leadership - Innovation that brings value to our customers Humility - Seeking out diverse perspectives and working collaboratively Inclusivity - Recognizing our differences make us stronger; we are bold and intentional Net-Zero - Committed to energy efficiency, waste reduction and beneficial reuse Integrity - Taking responsibility for our decisions and doing what is right Accountability - Taking ownership of our actions and for driving results Safety You will consistently hear us say Safety PHIRST! We are committed to continually improving our strong safety performance to ensure that our employees go home as safe and as healthy as when they came in, or even better! We also believe that health and safety is everyone’s responsibility, as such, PHINIA employees will know and comply with all applicable safety policies, standards, and procedures. Work is expected to be conducted in a manner that stresses the importance of preventing incidents and illnesses, including attending all required safety meetings and trainings. The hazards of each task shall be assessed, and the risk shall be managed accordingly. It is expected that all incidents, near misses, and unsafe conditions are immediately reported to the direct manager, Human Resources, or Safety Representative Equal Employment Opportunity PHINIA is an equal employment opportunity employer such that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Visa Sponsorship PHINIA does provide sponsorship for employment visa status based on business need. However, for this role, applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. No Unauthorized Referrals from Recruiters & Vendors Please note that PHINIA does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or offers from third party recruiters or staffing agencies associated with any published or unpublished employment opportunities. Any unsolicited information sent to PHINIA will be considered as unencumbered and free from any fee or charge whatsoever. Only members of our Human Resources Team have the authority to engage or authorize recruiting services, which must be agreed upon before the unsolicited resume or offer is received. Advancing sustainability today, powering carbon-free tomorrow. Join us on this shared journey to a brighter tomorrow. For more information about PHINIA, please visit www.phinia.com Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement Carefully read the PHINIA Privacy Policy before using this website. Your ability to access and use this website and apply for a job at PHINIA are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms. Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the geographical area where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms. Career Scam Disclaimer: PHINIA makes no representations or guarantees regarding employment opportunities listed on any third-party website. To protect against career scams, job applicants should take the necessary precautions when interviewing for and accepting employment positions allegedly offered by PHINIA. Applicants should never provide their national ID numbers, birth dates, credit card numbers, bank account information or other private information when communicating with prospective employers or responding to employment opportunities online. Job applicants are invited to contact PHINIA through PHINIA’s website to verify the authenticity of any employment opportunities.

title: Data Analyst, Financial Reporting & Analysis
description: Job Title: Data Analyst, Financial Reporting & Analysis Job Location: Southfield, MI What we offer: Veoneer Safety Systems is the world leader in Automotive Electronic Safety Systems. Veoneer’s scalable, best-in-class restraint control systems are mitigating the effects of a car crash. To date, we have delivered more than 1 billion devices to car manufacturers globally. Veoneer Safety Systems has an international and collaborative team of 2,700 employees in 11 countries. We empower our people and are dedicated to their professional development and growth . Veoneer Safety Systems – Saving Lives Every Day. What you'll do: Role of Data Analyst, Financial Reporting & Analysis, will report to the VP of Corporate Control. Role will support Financial Data Analysis of the Veoneer Group. Role will build reporting tools and models to support management in accurate and timely financial information. Build financial models to support reporting (EBITDA) and better understanding of financial data from ERPs and subsystems Provides analysis and metrics for Finance core processes and is responsible for knowledge of all systems to support at our field operations locations. Position will provide critical accounting and analytical support for various processes as well as provide additional support to other functional areas to achieve results. Improvements in the use of IT systems in connection with local/corporate IT Provide meaningful data to support projects and initiatives to improve productivity, simplifying processes, and improve reporting Ability to develop digital solutions Build financial models to support analysis of financial data to identify trends, variances, and potential areas for improvement Collect, validate, interpret more complex data, and leads communication of more detailed technical information Prepare data for comprehensive reports and presentations for senior management Partner with finance business partners and group finance directors in support of finance and organizational goals and objectives. Proactive involvement to drive productivity and reduce costs Provide a variety of Ad-Hoc Reports and Analysis Participate in process improvement initiatives to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of financial reporting, analysis, and planning processes What you'll bring: 5-7 years of progressive experience and responsibility in financial roles Bachelor’s degree in finance or equivalent required Highly skilled in ERP systems, Excel, PowerBi and financial modeling Finance experience in automotive industry HFM experience Positive mindset and active team player Comfort with ambiguity and strong desire to contribute to growth of the business Flexibility to contribute to operations of the business outside of one’s core responsibilities when necessary Proactive communicator and ability to work with people globally Self-motivated
summary: This role requires a Data Analyst to support the Financial Data Analysis of the Veoneer Group. You will build reporting tools and models, analyze financial data from ERPs, provide analysis and metrics for finance processes, and prepare reports and presentations for senior management.

title: Data Analyst I
description: Job Summary: The Data Analyst I provides data support for local district(s). This support includes State Reporting functionality as well as local district(s) reporting, and data interface requirements for district specific needs. Provides training to local district(s) as well as written documentation to assist end users in maintaining data quality and integrity. The Data Analyst I will work in close collaboration with the Information Systems team, requiring excellent interpersonal and communication skills to be utilized on a daily basis. Essential Duties (May Include, But Not Limited To) Provides support and problem resolution for local district(s) on data entry, modification, and maintenance. Provides coordination of data needs for shared data service districts. Estimates problem resolution times through detailed collaboration with other team members. Coordinates support for local district(s) computer software applications. Delivers a variety of application support within the local district(s) utilizing online, interactive television, and stand-up oral and visual presentation techniques. Creates and maintains comprehensive written documentation. Maintains a current knowledge of State Reporting requirements. Creates or modifies processes and procedures to enhance data quality and integrity. Informs local district(s) of data compliance procedures. Ensures data compliance within local district(s). Supports local district(s) needs utilizing a customer service request management system. Coordinates training needs of local district(s). Comfortably engages with customers in a highly professional and helpful manner. Provides regular status updates/reports to supervisor. Provides timely resolution of data and reporting related issues. Consistently models Win-Win leadership. Other Duties: Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications: Education: Minimum high school diploma/equivalent plus 60 hours of documented college or training courses required. Bachelor’s degree in information systems, business administration or related field preferred. Documented /demonstrated related work experience may be considered as part of the plus 60 hours. Experience: Documented work experience in a data support role, preferably working with State Reporting activities. Experience providing daily customer service pertaining to student data reporting and student data applications preferred. Skills/Other: Must be proficient in MS Windows, MS Outlook, MS Excel, MS Word, and Internet Browsers. Must be familiar with database management, preferably with MS Access. Must have the ability to multi-task, be detail-oriented, self-directed, and able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. Must have excellent problem-solving skills and be able to offer multiple solutions to application and operational problems and challenges. Must have excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills, including telephone communication. Ability to read and interpret complex user manuals to assist customers. Ability to deliver training to customers utilizing online, interactive television, and stand-up oral and visual presentation techniques. Ability to utilize district technology and work to maintain proficiency, as required skill sets change with technology and/or the needs of the district. Capable of working collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Works successfully as a member of a team. Ability to travel to and from the intermediate school district and the constituent school districts in the service area. Ability to work a flexible workday, work week, and work year. Punctuality and good attendance are requirements for the position. Represents the district in a professional manner at all times. Demonstrate honesty, integrity, and professionalism at all times. Must possess mental/physical ability and stamina for meeting the essential duties of the position. Ability to exercise good judgment and make decisions in accordance with board policies and established administrative guidelines. Certification Special Job Considerations: Type Of Certification Bargaining Unit: Salary Schedule: Technology and Specialist Salary Schedule Immediate Supervisor: Manager, Information Systems
summary: The Data Analyst I role involves providing data support for local school districts, including state and district reporting, data interface requirements, and training. title: Application and Data Analyst- REMOTE
description: Internet2 is a non-profit, member-driven advanced research and higher education technology community. Founded in 1996, Internet2 provides and delivers mission-critical technology services and programs. Internet2's core infrastructure components include the nation's largest and fastest network, cloud and security services that are influenced, customized, and designed to address the unique needs of technology leaders in research and education. Internet2 serves and supports U.S. and international institutions, government agencies, regional and state education networks, leading industry providers, and national research and education network partners across more than 100 countries. Internet2 services and programs support their educational, research and community service mission and enhance how individuals communicate, collaborate, and innovate. Summary Internet2 is seeking an Application and Data Analyst knowledgeable in the use of Cloud technologies to leverage organizational data for the development of business analytics. This position’s responsibilities also include the analysis, integration and management of SaaS applications and will require experience in the areas of business process analysis, data management, and system integration to support and enhance Internet2's administrative business capabilities. This position works in a collaborative team environment implementing cross divisional solutions. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience. A minimum of 5 years of IT experience Experience with implementation, configuration, and support of ERP Systems (preferably Salesforce and NetSuite) Experience with data integration technologies: Python, ELT/ETL (Informatica, AWS Glue) SQL, Procedural SQL, REST API, GraphQL Experience with Data Visualization tools (Tableau, Qlik, AWS Quicksight, Power BI) Experience in Relational Database platforms : Postgres, Oracle, MS SQLServer Strong understanding of Data Warehouse platforms: AWS Redshift Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong understanding of Data Governance, Ownership, and Stewardship in a multi-divisional organization. Ability to play a role in driving the culture of data driven decision making and its adoption across the organization. Experience in the development and implementation of standards, procedures, and guidelines to support operational and business processes. Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines and manage projects. Experience with system administration, systems security, and access control policies. Demonstrated ability to document development artifacts including flow diagrams, data models, design specification and user documentation for both technical staff and end users. Ability to communicate professionally both verbally and in writing via all media options, including video conferencing. Knowledge, skills, and abilities preferred for the job: Experience working in a higher education environment is desirable. Ability to collaborate with Data Owners and Data Consumers to achieve business goals. As a full-time employee, you will be eligible to participate in Internet2’s employee benefits program effective on your start date in accordance with the terms and conditions of each plan. The program currently includes medical, dental, life, vision and disability insurances, a health spending account program, sick time, vacation time and a tax deferred retirement plan. The salary range for this position is 70k-85k. Internet2 is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization and equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

title: Real World Data Analyst
description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Additional Location(s): US-MN-Maple Grove; US-MN-Arden Hills; US-MN-Mankato/Rochester; US-MN-Minneapolis; US-MN-Minnetonka; US-MN-Northern/Duluth; US-MN-Plymouth Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High Performance At Boston Scientific, we’ll give you the opportunity to harness all that’s within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we’ll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you’ll be supported in progressing – whatever your ambitions. Hybrid location for Maple Grove, MN preferred *** About The Role As a member of the Clinical Evidence Evaluation team, you will leverage your programming skills and expertise in claims and electronic health record (EHR) data to conduct timely and relevant analyses of real-world data sets across interventional cardiology and structural heart franchises. Your analyses will yield insights into post-market safety and performance across a diverse range of products. Additionally, you’ll contribute to broader clinical trial and business needs by assessing product utilization and target populations. Part of your role will involve exploring new claims and EHR data sources. Your Responsibilities Will Include Data analysis of medical coding and clinical real-world evidence to assess medical device product safety and performance, product utilization, and target populations. Utilizing technical expertise regarding relational database, data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques programming languages (SQL, Python, R, SAS) to assess real world data. Applying new methods for advanced analyses, create, monitor, review, and improve methods and techniques continuously. Ensuring quality and replicability (i.e., through appropriate documentation and validation) of results Collaborating with cross-functional colleagues to inform strategic activities related to clinical real-world evidence. Demonstrate analytical experience utilizing large data sets to draw conclusions about product-related assessments, with the ability to collect, organize, and analyze, significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Required Qualifications Minimum of Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in data science, public health, health economics, epidemiology, biostatistics, health care administration or related discipline Minimum 1- 2 years of experience in extracting, organizing, and analyzing data from claims databases, electronic medical records, or registries using SAS, Python, Spark and/or R Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with interventional cardiology / structural heart procedures and products Detail-oriented professional with a can-do attitude, focused on precision, accuracy, continuous learning, and skill development. Demonstrated responsiveness and sense of urgency when pursuing goals and completing tasks Demonstrated ability to set and manage priorities, manage multiple projects, and meet deadlines Prior experience with quantitative validation of phenotype definitions in RWD and the coding vocabularies (e.g., ICD, CPT) used to define variables in RWD Requisition ID: 586358 As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most – united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do – as a global business and as a global corporate citizen. So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn’t just business, it’s personal. And if you’re a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you! At Boston Scientific, we recognize that nurturing a diverse and inclusive workplace helps us be more innovative and it is important in our work of advancing science for life and improving patient health. That is why we stand for inclusion, equality, and opportunity for all. By embracing the richness of our unique backgrounds and perspectives, we create a better, more rewarding place for our employees to work and reflect the patients, customers, and communities we serve. Boston Scientific is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Boston Scientific maintains a prohibited substance free workplace. Pursuant to Va. Code 2.2-4312 (2000), Boston Scientific is providing notification that the unlawful manufacture, sale, distribution, dispensation, possession, or use of a controlled substance or marijuana is prohibited in the workplace and that violations will result in disciplinary action up to and including termination. Please be advised that certain US based positions, including without limitation field sales and service positions that call on hospitals and/or health care centers, require acceptable proof of COVID-19 vaccination status. Candidates will be notified during the interview and selection process if the role(s) for which they have applied require proof of vaccination as a condition of employment. Boston Scientific continues to evaluate its policies and protocols regarding the COVID-19 vaccine and will comply with all applicable state and federal law and healthcare credentialing requirements. As employees of the Company, you will be expected to meet the ongoing requirements for your roles, including any new requirements, should the Company’s policies or protocols change with regard to COVID-19 vaccination.
summary: Boston Scientific is seeking a Clinical Evidence Evaluation Analyst to join their team. This role involves analyzing real-world data from claims and electronic health records (EHR) to assess medical device safety, performance, utilization, and target populations. The ideal candidate will have experience in data analysis, programming languages (SQL, Python, R, SAS), and knowledge of medical coding and clinical real-world evidence. The role requires a Bachelor's or Master's degree in a related field and 1-2 years of experience in data extraction and analysis.
