title: Associate Data Analyst
description: Southeast Michigan Community Alliance (SEMCA) is recruiting talented professionals who want to contribute and make a difference in our southeast Michigan community!! SEMCA is a Michigan Works! Agency providing workforce development programs to residents in Wayne and Monroe counties, excluding the city of Detroit. SEMCA offers a competitive package to full-time employees who are eligible for benefits on the first day of hire including 12 annual holidays, 25 days accrued paid time off per year, and 6% employer match to 403(b) retirement plan! SEMCA is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization and employees with student loan debt are eligible to apply for public service loan forgiveness (PSLF). Pay Range: $20 - $23 per hour with a competitive benefit package including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 403(b) retirement plan with 6% employer match, 12 paid holidays, and 30 days of paid time off. Job Summary The Associate Data Analyst is responsible for consolidating, transforming, and modeling of data into charts, graphs, tables, and reports to be used by decision makers in developing strategies and goals. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Assists the Data Analyst with the following activities: Gather, analyze, correlate, or evaluate information from a variety of resources Condense large, often complex data into clear, concise, easy-to-understand observations Analyze large vlumes of data to look at performance, quality, and trending Prepare cmprehensive written reports, presentations, maps, or charts based on research, collection, and analysis of data Develp reports, test, and debug errors, and validate results Collaborate with decision makers by collecting, analyzing data and reporting results Consult with staff to effectively produce requested reports, analyze requirements, and convert specifications into computer code Represent SEMCA at internal and external meetings Assist in developing departmental policies to ensure compliance with State and Federal regulations Other duties as assigned Qualifications All SEMCA team members are expected to be technically competent and committed to continuous development of their skills. The following skills, knowledge and education or certifications are specifically required for this position: Associate degree in computer science or equivalent experience Experienced with Microsoft Office Suite Proficient with Microsoft Excel including VLOOKUP function, pivot tables and formulas Ability to apply analytical techniques to a wide variety of data Strong analytical, quantitative skills and problem solving skills Ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple projects, deadlines and responsibilities Flexible and adaptable to fast paced, changing environments; detail oriented and driven Proficient at translating contractor's data requests into reports Proficient with SQL Good communication skills Physical Demands Duties require sufficient mobility to work in a normal office setting and use standard office equipment including a computer, vision to read printed materials on an LCD screen and smartphone, hearing, and speech sufficient to communicate in person and over the telephone. These requirements may be accommodated for otherwise qualified individual requiring and requesting and/or needing additional accommodations.

title: Data Quality Analyst -SQL Python/R - Contract - Hybrid
description: The Data Quality Analyst will support the definition of data quality standards, requirements, and specifications for data quality controls in the data lifecycle. They will also provide support for operational processes that measure, monitor and report on data quality levels as well as the remediation of identified data quality issues. The person will meet with various stakeholders to gather and document information, perform data analysis, and conduct assessments of business and technical processes involved in managing data. Duration: 9 Months Contract W2 with competitive pay and Health Benefits Responsibilities Data Quality Remediation Collaborate with internal stakeholders to gather information and document identified data quality issues. Perform root cause analysis of identified data quality issues. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support development and implementation of remediation plans to promptly resolve identified data quality issues. Data Quality Measurement, Monitoring and Reporting Processes Define and develop data quality metrics based upon data quality standards. Support the development of automated data quality reports and dashboards. In partnership with Data Stewards, monitor data quality levels and respond to alerts when data quality metrics for critical data elements are outside the acceptable data quality thresholds. Data Quality Management Framework Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify business needs and opportunities for data quality improvement, including identifying data critical to meeting business needs. Perform an assessment of the data to understand data content and relationships and comparing actual data to rules and expectation. Develop standards and templates for documenting data quality rules so they have a consistent format and meaning. Experience 5 years experience in data and/or information asset quality management 3 years experience managing data quality monitoring and remediation processes Proficiency in data profiling, statistical analysis, data analysis, and data standardization / cleansing techniques Experience using statistical techniques to discover the root cause of data quality issues and recommend remediation options Strong SQL skills with the ability to write sophisticated queriers across large, complex data sets Ability to analyze data trends, identify patterns and proactively address potential data quality issues Proficient in documenting data quality issues and remediation plans in a clear and concise manner Experience with Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake (Python, R is a plus)
summary: Data Quality Analyst to support definition of data quality standards, requirements, and specifications, monitor and report on data quality levels, and remediate identified issues. Collaborates with stakeholders, performs data analysis, and conducts process assessments.

title: Data Quality Analyst - Data Governance
description: Job Title: Data Quality Analyst Job Location: Auburn Hills Michigan 48326 Onsite Requirements: 5 years' experience in data governance and/or data management 5 years' experience serving in the role as a data steward, business analyst, or data analyst Experience with Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake (Python, R is a plus) Job Description: The Data Analyst is a critical data governance role for enabling data integrity and ensuring data meets the criteria established by the Chief Data & Analytics Office for data management, quality, and certification. The Data Analyst will collaborate with Data Stewards, Information Architects, Data Quality Analysts and business/technical stakeholders to research and document data, metadata, and reference data to ensure it meets specific use cases and regulatory expectations. As part of the position, this person will meet with various stakeholders to gather information, facilitate meetings, conduct research, and document information. Responsibilities: Data Documentation: Define data security classifications Analyze data profiles - partner with data users and stakeholders to enable an understanding of data being considered for use case Catalog data, ensuring it has a definition/description and basic metadata is available, and is associated with a regulation or policy if required Define data quality rule requirements and data standardization needs Maintain comprehensive data documentation, including data dictionaries, lineage, data flow diagrams, and source-to-target mappings Data Guidance and Use: Guide users in understanding their data, its quality, and data selection based on use case to ensure data is fit for purpose. Collaborate to identify needed data sets and critical data elements Deliver data requirements to data engineering for configuration Validate data in various environments to ensure it meets established requirements for data quality and use Work in an Agile framework for delivery of tasks within a defined project sprint Follow established data standards, procedures, and processes to ensure data meets the needs of the use case and applicable regulatory requirements. Experience: 5 years' experience in data governance and/or data management 5 years' experience serving in the role as a data steward, business analyst, or data analyst Proficiency in data profiling, statistical analysis, data analysis, data quality, and data standardization / cleansing techniques Strong data query and analytics skills; ability to analyze data trends, identify patterns and proactively address potential data quality issues Proficient in documenting data - data catalogs, source-to-target mappings, data lineage, data flow, and procedural documentation for audit or executive review 2 or more years' experience working on Agile project teams - use of JIRA Experience with Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake (Python, R is a plus) Skills: Relationship management Facilitation Data querying Problem solving Communication across all levels - written and verbal Attention to detail with ability to align with the big picture Issue resolution Decision-making Able to synthesize information leading to recommendations of solutions Multi-tasking Influencing others Curiosity - seeking to understand and improve
summary: The Data Quality Analyst is a data governance role responsible for ensuring data integrity and compliance with established data management and quality standards. This role involves collaborating with stakeholders to document data, metadata, and reference data, define data quality rules, and guide users in understanding their data. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in data governance, data management, data profiling, statistical analysis, and data quality techniques. They should also be proficient in data querying, documenting data, working in an Agile framework, and using tools like Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake. Strong communication, problem-solving, and relationship management skills are essential.

title: Power BI Analyst
description: Job Description Title: Power BI Analyst Location: Wixom, MI (Remote is fine) Duration: 6 Months Skills: Google Analytics and Big Query or Looker Experience is must Responsibilities: JOB DESCRIPTION Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Power BI Analyst with a strong background in Google Analytics and expertise in either Looker or BigQuery. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in our data analysis and reporting efforts, helping us derive actionable insights from our data sources and presenting them in a visually compelling and understandable manner using Power BI. Responsibilities: Data Integration and Transformation: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and sources. Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources, including Google Analytics, into a structured format suitable for analysis in Power BI. Power BI Development: Develop and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights to stakeholders. Create visually appealing and interactive data visualizations to convey complex information effectively. Implement data modeling techniques, including relationships, measures, and calculated columns. Google Analytics Expertise: Utilize Google Analytics to track website and app performance, user behavior, and conversions. Generate custom reports and segments in Google Analytics to gather relevant data for analysis. If Looker: Looker/BigQuery Expertise (Choose one): Build LookML models to create a semantic layer for data exploration and visualization. Create and maintain Looker dashboards and explore data using Looker Explore. If BigQuery: Query data in BigQuery using SQL for complex data analysis. Develop and optimize BigQuery queries and workflows for data retrieval and transformation. Data Analysis And Insights: Analyze data trends, patterns, and anomalies to identify opportunities and areas for improvement. Provide actionable insights to guide decision-making processes within the organization. Collaboration: Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and other stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and consistency. Communicate findings and insights effectively to both technical and non-technical team members. Documentation: Document data sources, data transformations, and report/dashboard development processes. Maintain up-to-date documentation for data-related workflows. Quality Assurance: Perform data quality checks and validation to ensure the accuracy and reliability of reports and dashboards. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics). Proven experience as a Power BI Analyst or similar role. Strong proficiency in Power BI and data visualization best practices. Expertise in Google Analytics and its implementation. Proficiency in SQL, particularly if working with BigQuery. Experience with Looker or BigQuery, depending on the chosen specialization. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Attention to detail and the ability to work independently and as part of a team. Knowledge of data modeling and ETL processes is a plus. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in related field is required
summary: We are seeking a Power BI Analyst with experience in Google Analytics and either Looker or BigQuery. Responsibilities include data integration, Power BI development, Google Analytics expertise, data analysis, collaboration, and documentation. The ideal candidate will be proficient in Power BI, SQL, and have experience with Looker or BigQuery.

title: Health Data Analyst
description: How to Apply A cover letter is required for consideration for this position and should be attached as the first page of your resume. The cover letter should address your specific interest in the position and outline skills and experience that directly relate to this position. Summary Department Summary The University of Michigan (U-M) University Health Service (UHS), a unit of Student Life, is an AAAHC-accredited outpatient multispecialty health clinic that serves a large and diverse student body of more than 45,000 students, as well as U-M faculty and staff. UHS provides direct patient care through its primary care and specialty clinics, as well as public health, epidemiologic surveillance, health education and promotion. Job Summary The UHS Health Data Analyst will join a dynamic and collaborative team of data analysts, clinicians, epidemiologists, IT business solutions, and revenue cycle professionals. The analyst mines, analyzes, interprets, presents and visualizes clinical, public health, financial and operational data from a variety of data sources in order to improve the healthcare quality, safety and sustainability of the university. This position collaborates across campus with clinical, analytic, IT and public health staff in order to improve access, workflows, and outcomes of care and public health interventions. Responsibilities* The primary duties are data mining, coding, analysis, visualization, reporting and communication using the electronic medical record and various health databases and data warehouses as data sources. Data Management (60%) Track/log cases of infectious diseases such as COVID, flu, STIs, gastrointestinal illness, chickenpox, measles, mumps, pertussis, shingles, viral hepatitis, lyme disease; tracking tests (positive and negative results) Pull data from MiChart/HSDW. Clean and verify data to reflect appropriate format; ensure data effectively flows into the Tableau dashboard; integrate feedback/other requested components as requested Compile monthly data from different pre-existing sources and run MiChart/HSDW reports to obtain other data points for billing compliance; ensure data effectively flows into the Tableau dashboard; integrate feedback and requested adjustments as necessary following meetings where dashboard is shown in order to allow leadership to make informed decisions Respond to data inquiries from clinical and administrative managers Monitor timely and accurate receipt and transfer of data Ensure workflow integrity by securely connecting to an API (or similar process) to download test results; process, sort, and merge on a unique identifier to a registration list that includes demographic information Identify and analyze trends in data sets by processing, merging, grouping, and creating of summary statistics (Excel, SAS, R, and other data management programs) Reconcile multiple and sometimes conflicting data sources; periodically review disease dashboards and reports by matching data sources (R, SAS, SPSS, etc); manually review charts resolve data concerns and ensure accurate information and data integrity Perform basic statistical analysis Design and develop data visualization solutions to communicate results to key decision makers by determining the source of data, formatting data to meet visualization needs (Tableau, website; etc.) Other duties as assigned Reporting and Communication (30%) Prepare reports for internal and external stakeholders (e.g., reportable diseases, annual reports, clinical operations, billing optimization, quality and safety, patient satisfaction) Create and run data reports from the electronic medical record (MiChart/Epic) and other sources (e.g., Michigan Disease Surveillance System, health data warehouses) Partnership and Collaboration (10%) Collaborate with UHS managers and public health professionals to define and create appropriate key performance indicators Adopt and modify (if needed) existing data and analytic programs and workflows Liaise with partners in Environment, Health & Safety, School of Public Health, Michigan Medicine, local health departments, the Registrar, and Student Life, etc. Required Qualifications* Bachelor's degree in a related field 2 years of experience in a healthcare or public health setting where a significant component of the work was data analysis and interpretation, including working with large data sets, communicating data findings, and collaborating with an interdisciplinary team Additional Information Work schedule Shift/Hours: 40 hours per week, generally 8am-5pm. Must be flexible and able to adapt to change in a fast-moving work environment. Ability to work a flexible schedule with variable hours, potential to work some weekends. Potential opportunity to work remotely 1-2 days per week (based on operational needs). Location: University Health Service, 207 Fletcher Street, Ann Arbor 48109. Physical Requirements Ability to do computer work on a full-time basis, which may require being in a stationary position for extended periods of time and doing repetitive tasks. Selected candidates whose start date is 4/1/2024 or before 8/31/2024, will not be eligible for the university FY24-25 salary/merit plan unless otherwise notified. This role may have reporting obligations under Title IX and Clery. Authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment and applicants for this position will not be sponsored for work visas. Salary may vary depending on qualifications, experience, and education of the selected candidate. Relocation will not be offered for this position. #studentlife Application Deadline Job openings are posted for a minimum of seven calendar days. The review and selection process may begin as early as the eighth day after posting. This opening may be removed from posting boards and filled anytime after the minimum posting period has ended. U-M EEO/AA Statement The University of Michigan is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.
summary: The UHS Health Data Analyst will work with a team to mine, analyze, interpret, and visualize data from various sources to improve the quality, safety, and sustainability of healthcare at the University of Michigan. This role involves data mining, coding, analysis, visualization, reporting, and communication using the electronic medical record and other health databases.

title: IT Data Analyst
description: Role: IT Data Analyst Location: Detroit, MI (Day one onsite, Hybrid) Duration: Long term Rate: Market The main function of a Data Analyst is to coordinate changes to computer databases, test, and implement the database applying knowledge of database management systems. Top 4 Must-have Hard Skills Data visualization & data analysis Extracting, processing and visualizing data Familiarity with power BI Processing SQL Job Responsibilities Work with senior management, technical and client teams in order to determine data requirements, business data implementation approaches, best practices for advanced data manipulation, storage and analysis strategies Write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system or direct others in coding descriptions Design, implement, automate and maintain large scale enterprise data ETL processes Modify existing databases and database management systems and/or direct programmers and analysts to make changes Test programs or databases, correct errors and make necessary modifications Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required 4+ years applicable experience required Experience with database technologies Knowledge of the ETL process Knowledge of at least one scripting language Strong written and oral communication skills Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills Demonstrated history of success Desire to be working with data and helping businesses make better data driven decisions
summary: IT Data Analyst role responsible for coordinating database changes, testing, and implementation, requiring expertise in data visualization, analysis, Power BI, and SQL. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Job Summary The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for identifying trends, analyzing data , and preparing analytical and graphical reports for executive management . This person must have strong analytical skills, understand query logic, and be effective at organizing, interpreting, and reporting data to management-level staff. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be required to create and produce daily, monthly, and ad-hoc reports, as well as have the ability to valid ate the integrity of the data. Reports and analysis may be required in Excel spreadsheets and graphs. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, mathematical, written, and verbal analysis of the data will be essential to the position, especially for communicating to the executive management team. This position may also include day-to-day communication with Finance Source customers to understand, procure , and provide data . The Business Intelligence Analyst must be able to interpret requests from outside sources and create reports as needed . Cre ate ad-hoc reports as requested . This may include extracting, manipulating and analyzing data to provide critical insight to meet the needs of business customers . Create and maintain daily, monthly, and annual reports. Identify better business practices and processes. Support the development of data driven and actionable analytical solutions . Participate in identifying and resolving issues with data, analysis, charts, and graphs. Maintain safety, security, and privacy standards throughout a ll areas of responsibility. Knowledge Good understanding of data warehousing concepts, OLTP and OLAP data models, data flows, and basic transformations. Skills Proficient in Microsoft Office products , including but not limited to : Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook , and Visio. Experi ence and strong aptitude in SQL, databases , programming languages and analytical tools . A nalytical tool knowledge using Excel/Tableau / PowerBI or other business intelligence toolsets. Strong skill in one or more of the following languages : SQL , Python , R. Must be an expert in both Excel and Access. Strong data analysis and presentation skills . Tableau experience preferred. Statistical background and Salesforce experience a plus. Abilities The ability to communicate information and ideas , both verbally and in writing , so others will understand. Outstanding customer service and communication skills. Intellectual curiosity. Ability to a nticipate problems and solutions while maintaining a long-term, big-picture view. A bility to listen to and understand information and ideas presented while asking the appropriate probing questions to better understand the situation . A bility to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense. Ability to i dentify creative solutions to address business need s based on the facts and issues presented. Highly focused in thought and behavior. Ability to thrive in dynamic, fast-paced software development environment. Proactive, detail-oriented professional. Strong analytical and technical skills. Ability to be a team player. A bility to comfortably and quickly deal with business issues . C haracterized by integrity and high professional ethics. F ocused on the results while maintaining a sense of urgency. Other Essential Requirements Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Computer Science or other related field. 2+ years of proven development experience with analytical tools like Tableau .

The analyst will create and maintain various reports, including daily, monthly, and ad-hoc reports, and ensure data integrity. The position may also involve communication with clients to understand, procure, and provide data.

title: Junior Technical WMS Analyst - Ann Arbor MI
description: Junior Technical WMS Analyst As a Junior Technical WMS Analyst at Longbow , you will assist in configuring and delivering critical business functions for Longbow clients. We are seeking a fresh technically trained individual in SQL & Oracle, preferably with a Bachelor's Degree in Computer/Software Engineering, or Related Degree. The ideal candidate has an analytical mind and is willing to learn the ins and outs of supply chain optimization. Problem-solving skills and attention to detail are essential as you will support every phase of Longbow's implementation lifecycle. Fluency in English required, while being fluent in French a big plus. This role reports to the Director of Consulting Services and can be fully hybrid in the US or Canada from one of our office locations (Montreal QC, Mississauga ON or Ann Arbor MI US). Longbow Advantage is an end-to-end warehousing strategy company that leverages real-time data to manage people, processes, and warehouses through The Rebus® Platform, and WMS consulting services purpose-built to expand and enhance warehouse technologies. We take a holistic approach to warehousing strategy, understanding that technology is only one piece in the solution process. Our warehouse experts work with customers to understand challenges and goals, developing a recommendation that’s aligned to the customer’s business objectives and supply chain initiatives. What to expect Once you join our team, you will… Provide product consulting, transfer of knowledge to client team. Assist with configuration of solutions to meet customer requirements. Assist with RF device, printer and other device configuration and support, as needed. Assist client team members through all phases of the implementation. Assist project team to manage client expectations to accomplish project success. Meet with customers and Longbow team members to consult, configure, implement and support client requirements. Assist in assessing customer business needs & design and configure appropriate solution document “as is” and “to be” processes. Develop and execute test plans and test environments, to validate functionality against design requirements, and manage customer acceptance testing as appropriate based on the WMS Solution being deployed Document testing results and reports bugs, fixes or changes required to Systems Analyst Accurately capture and report on JIRA to ensure customers are properly invoiced for delivered services Assist in the development of enhancement specifications for custom development. Assist in functional end user training. Provide go-live operations support. Guide business users on the operation of the application and the administration of business processes, reference data, etc. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business/Supply Chain/Operations/Computer/Software Engineering or related degree Expertise in JDA/Red Prairie, Blue Yonder, Highjump, SAP, Tecsys or other Supply Chain Software systems (e.g., WMS, WFM, TMS) both as functional and technical analyst is highly desirable. Experience in an operational setting or relevant discipline. Strong knowledge of SQL Server , Oracle, and other Database Technologies Experience in documenting process flows and operational procedures. Operating systems – Windows and UNIX. XML/HTML, MOCA, Python/Perl, Visual Studio/Visual basic Strong knowledge and work experience with C/C++, C# and Java programming languages Ability to work independently as well as a part of a team. Excellent problem-solving skills. Valid driver’s license. Able & willing to travel. Why Join Longbow? Supportive work environment Work/life balance Competitive Salary 4-weeks of paid vacation 6 paid sick days, 2 paid personal days per year Excellent health and dental benefits, eligible as of your first day! Group RRSP/401k Matching Work from Home Longbow Advantage is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are not able to assist with relocation or work permit applications for this role. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
summary: Longbow is seeking a Junior Technical WMS Analyst to assist in configuring and delivering critical business functions for clients. Consider joining our family – take care of your career and your community! title: Consumer Market Insights Analyst
description: Job Type Full-time Description Whisker is the maker of Litter-Robot, Feeder-Robot, and Litterbox.com. At Whisker, we believe pet parenthood can always get better. As leading innovators in pet tech and refined pet accessories, we work tirelessly to solve problems and deliver smarter insights for pet parents while enriching the lives of pets. Whether it’s a self-cleaning litter box that automates scooping, an automatic feeder that helps pets develop healthier eating habits, or a modern cat tree that delights both humans and felines, we strive to deliver better solutions for consumers while transforming pet care along the way. To us, having a pet is the best thing ever. At Whisker, life together just keeps getting better. Whisker is based in Auburn Hills, Michigan and Juneau, Wisconsin with 500+ passionate team members. This role will partner with teams across the company by supporting all research projects and studies from inception to completion. This role reports to the Consumer Markets Insights Manager. Manages and leads a community of highly engaged alpha and beta testers Owns and manages all aspects of the ongoing Net Promoter Score and Customer Satisfaction programs, from structuring the survey, responding to customers, analyzing the data, and reporting insights to stakeholders Synthesizes existing and new data sources to track and report the market size of the pet tech industry (i.e., smart litter boxes, automatic feeders, water robots) Develops and leads various new research projects to support new products, experiences, and marketing activities. Identifies and advocates for key customer needs and business opportunities to put the customer first Connects and communicates how your work impacts larger business goals Plans, develops, and executes complex research initiatives Becomes a valued go-to partner for the Customer Experience, Marketing, and Digital teams, ensuring critical decisions are rooted in insight Works cross-functionally to drive consensus and guide the team through filling knowledge gaps Will perform additional responsibilities when required What You'll Bring: BA in a related field or equivalent professional experience 3-5 years of experience as a researcher, academic researcher, or similar role A track record of high-quality research that delivered results and demonstrated the depth of your research skills, illustrated through case studies Proficient in Windows and Google tools, iMovies, Domo, R Commander, Hotjar, and SurveyMonkey is a plus Proven experience communicating and presenting complex user needs clearly A proven ability to evaluate the customer and business impact of your research decisions Comfortable with office pets (cats, dogs) Not Required but Nice To Have: Experience in the Pet Industry or a passion for pets Benefits & Purrks: Join a tenacious, inventive company that empowers team members to chart their own path, lead by grounding decisions in the “why”, and has a strong sense of empathy and openness to new perspectives. Be a part of exciting growth, work with incredible people, and create tomorrow’s pet products—plus a whole lot of extras. You will also be provided with: Premium Medical/Dental/Vision insurance Paid parental leave Whisker Parents Program 1 day "pawternity" leave for new pet adoption Pet Insurance 401K match Flexible spending accounts Company-paid short-term disability and life insurance Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Generous paid time off 14 Paid Holidays Top of the line equipment Pet-friendly office Whisker products and swag Continuing education Support On-site gym with Peloton Referral program Statement of Inclusivity: We believe different perspectives make Whisker better and strive to create a place where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive. Please ensure to regularly check your email spam folder for any communication from Whisker to avoid missing important updates regarding your application status. #onsite1
summary: The Consumer Market Insights Analyst at Whisker will be the expert on consumers and ensure their needs are prioritized. The ideal candidate will have 3-5 years of research experience, proficiency in various tools, and the ability to communicate complex user needs clearly.

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: Job Description: Processing Data and Public Records Requests: Receiving Requests: - Receive and log incoming data and public records requests from non-media parties. - Ensure requests are properly documented and tracked for timely processing. Legal Review and Redaction: - Assist in legal review of requested documents to determine necessary redactions to protect sensitive information before release as public records. - Ensure compliance with legal requirements and agency policies regarding public records disclosures. Data Retrieval and Compilation: - Coordinate with relevant departments or personnel to retrieve requested data and compile necessary documents for disclosure. - Ensure completeness and accuracy of information provided in response to requests. Response Preparation: - Prepare responses to data and public records requests in accordance with established timelines and legal requirements. - Draft correspondence and documentation ensuring clarity and completeness in responses. Communication and Follow-up: - Communicate with requesters to clarify requests, provide updates on processing status, and coordinate delivery of requested information. - Maintain records of communications and actions taken related to each request. Microsoft Purview Oversight: - Serve as the primary compliance contact for the implementation and oversight of the agency's Microsoft Purview application. Microsoft Purview is a data governance tool that helps organizations map, manage, and govern their data across various sources. - Data types to be brought under Purview oversight and management include: data/files within enterprise Microsoft 365 applications (Outlook, SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams, Exchange, etc.) and other on-premises, multicloud, and software as a service (SaaS) data. Data cover a range of public health subject matters such as: disease surveillance and reporting, environmental health (water supply, wastewater, food protection, etc.), vital records and statistics, and professional and healthcare facility licensure, just to name a few. Key Purview duties and responsibilities include: - Data Cataloging: Organizing and indexing data assets for easy discovery and understanding. - Data Classification: Applying labels and tags to data based on sensitivity and regulatory requirements. - Data Lineage: Tracking the origins, movements, and transformations of data throughout its lifecycle. - Data Insights: Providing analytical capabilities to derive insights and enhance decision-making. - Data Compliance: Ensuring data usage complies with regulatory standards and internal policies. Policy Development and Compliance: - Collaborate with the Director of Data Governance to develop and revise policies, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and guidelines related to data management and governance. - Ensure that policies align with federal and state data laws, regulations, and organizational objectives. - Monitor and interpret federal and state data protection laws, regulations (such as HIPAA), and industry standards. - Develop training materials and conduct sessions to educate agency staff on data governance policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements. - Foster a culture of compliance and data stewardship across the organization. Data Management and Systems Development: - Collaborate with the Director of Data Governance in developing and designing data management applications and systems. Aim to improve the agency's data capabilities for public health purposes. Provide general support to the agency in its projects funded under the CDC Public Health Infrastructure Grant (PHIG), specifically under Strategy A3: Data Modernization. Projects include: - Cataloging and organization of agency data resources with the ultimate goal of creating a public facing agency-wide data catalog, - Assisting with the selection and implementation of an updated process for managing external requests for data and public records - Supporting the creation and implementation of project timelines - Consistent and effective communication with agency staff supporting the projects, and maintaining focus on project goals and meeting deadlines - Assist with the collecting, organizing and leveraging large amounts of data across multiple subject matters to enable more accessible utilization and analysis of the data using data lakes, warehouses, lakehouses, catalogs, etc. Proficiency in Microsoft 365 applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams) and Adobe
summary: This position involves managing data and public records requests, ensuring compliance with legal requirements, and overseeing the agency's data governance program through the Microsoft Purview application. The role includes data cataloging, classification, lineage tracking, and compliance monitoring, as well as policy development and training. The individual will collaborate with the Director of Data Governance on data management applications and systems development, supporting projects funded by the CDC Public Health Infrastructure Grant (PHIG).

WORK ENVIRONMENT High energy and able to prioritize and multitask in fast paced and rapidly changing environment; resourcefulness and advanced problem-solving abilities required.

This position will work with Enterprise Application Architect and Enterprise Data Architect. This position will be partnering with MDOT's GIS Team, MDOT application Business leads, and MDOT Information Stewards. Experience using the ESRI Roads and Highways Database and ESRI Versioned/non-Versioned Datasets. Knowledge in Python Programming using the ArcPy and ArcGIS Python API. Demonstratable experience in building GIS integration capabilities (feature or web service-based) with applications. Knowledge and proven skills in MS SQL Server Spatial and Oracle Spatial. title: IT Security Analyst
description: IT Security Analyst 3 Job Description ID:132300 IT Security Analyst 3 Dimondale MI (Hybrid) 12+ months Face to Face Interview Note Repost of 131264. Top Skills & Years Of Experience 5+ Years' IT Security Experience Experience with vulnerability management scanning and reporting tools. Experience with trend analysis and creating dashboards using data scripting to provide metrics on the performance. Ability to work independently and efficiently. Short Job Description The Security Analyst position works as a member of the Vulnerability Management Team. The Senior Security Analyst position reviews and remediates cyber incidents and vulnerabilities found by IT level analysts to IT security specialists and managers to maintain the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of State of Michigan data. Long Job Description Technical Security Analyst performing duties related to the Vulnerability Management team. Plans, schedules, implements, and maintains scalable vulnerability scans using modern vulnerability management scanning tools for high complexity devices. While ensuring safe and timely scanning that has minimal/no impact on scan targets, provides troubleshooting of technical issues with scans. Supports vulnerability management scanning and reporting tools. Conducts internal vulnerability audits of servers, network devices, applications, and other devices. Interfaces with internal and external auditors, providing detailed information on remediation efforts. Creates integrations of vulnerability management data with other State of Michigan enterprise services. Conducts data analysis of vulnerability management data, often integrated with other data sources, to measure effectiveness of vulnerability remediation. Data analysis tasks includes large datasets, which include structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data. Interfaces with other agencies to make recommendations on how to improve the security posture and reduce the number of security related vulnerabilities. Conducts trend analysis, creates dashboards using data scripting to provide metrics on the performance of security responsibilities, controls, and creates new reports for management based on those collected metrics across multiple agencies. Escalates as appropriate. Skills: vulnerability management,vulnerability,vulnerability remediation,data analysis,it security,scanning tools,data scripting,technical security analysis,security posture,dashboards,it,incident response

title: Data Quality Analyst
description: Overview LMI is seeking a skilled Data Quality Analyst to support data management initiatives for logistics catalog data that seek to improve the structure, quality, usability, and manageability of the catalog. Successful Data Quality Analysts demonstrate successful experience with data quality and managing and resolving large amount of complex data quality issues. This position requires data analysis, problem-solving, and communication with various data stakeholders. Secret clearance eligibility is required. In this position you will be expected to go occasionally onsite in Battle Creek, MI. LMI: Innovation at the Pace of Need™ At LMI, we’re reimagining the path from insight to outcome at The New Speed of Possible™. Combining a legacy of over 60 years of federal expertise with our innovation ecosystem, we minimize time to value and accelerate mission success. We energize the brightest minds with emerging technologies to inspire creative solutioning and push the boundaries of capability. LMI advances the pace of progress, enabling our customers to thrive while adapting to evolving mission needs. Responsibilities This Data Quality Analyst will join a team supporting the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) and will play a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy and consistency of logistics catalog data, ultimately supporting catalog transformation and improved usability and manageability.­­ Responsibilities include: Rapidly navigate learning curve of complex logistics catalog data, its structure, and dependencies. Execute complex data cleansing logic and data entry tasks to improve overall data. Develop and maintain documentation of data quality processes and procedures. Identify and address data quality issues and discrepancies, working closely with data entry staff and other team members. Collaborate with IT teams to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to data quality Derive insights and analytic narratives from data and visualizations for effective storytelling and clear communication in response to data quality research questions. Apply critical and analytical thinking skills to translate complex information into understandable and impactful work products. Oversee and/or support special projects as needed. Rapidly prioritize competing requirements, understand and simplify client requirements. Communicate with various data stakeholders through written reports and oral presentations. Continuously seek opportunities to improve data quality processes and recommend solutions for more efficient data management Qualifications Required: Experience with leading and/or supporting data management or governance teams to develop management plans, business processes, and data quality plans. Experience executing complex logic for data cleansing Working knowledge of databases and SQL. At least 1–5 years of experience in the field. Superior communication skills, both oral and written. Desired DoD experience preferred with focus in logistics data or supply chain data processes Bachelor’s degree in data science, mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, engineering, or a related business or quantitative discipline. Experience working with tools, including object-oriented programming (Python, Java)
summary: LMI seeks a Data Quality Analyst to improve the structure, quality, usability, and manageability of logistics catalog data. Responsibilities include data cleansing, documentation, issue identification, collaboration with IT teams, deriving insights from data, and communicating with stakeholders. Experience with data management, data cleansing, databases, and SQL is required. DoD experience and a Bachelor's degree are preferred.

description: This is a 6 month contract to hire position working with the University of Michigan in Ann Arbor, MI. It's a hybrid role, so the hiring manager wants someone local. Minimum of 4 years information technology experience. Minimum of 2 years of experience applying security related technologies, practices, or services. Experience with fundamental Operating System and TCP/IP Networking concepts. Experience with fundamental information security concepts including Authentication, Authorization, Audit, Encryption, or Firewalls. Experience with fundamental security related practices including Risk Management, Incident Response, Vulnerability Management, Penetration Testing, IDS/IPS, System and Application Hardening, Identity and Access Management, Security Information and Event Management, Firewall management, IDS/IPS A commitment to collaboration, teamwork, and improvement. Prior federal experience is a plus. Prior experience in small- to medium-sized teams (rather than large, siloed teams) is a plus.

title: BI Developer / Analyst
description: Since 1965, Stoneridge has designed and manufactured advanced, award-winning technologies including driveline and transmission actuation systems, vision systems, emissions control systems, safety systems, and security and monitoring systems for vehicle OEMs in the commercial vehicle, automotive, off-highway and agricultural vehicle markets. Proven experience as a Power BI Developer and / or analyst Expertise in optimizing Power BI performance and troubleshooting data integration issues. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Background in data model design (e.g. semantic modeling) and data mining In-depth understanding of database management systems, data modelling, Massively Parallel Processing (MPP), ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework. Skills needed to analyze data, identify trends, advanced visualization techniques and provide insights that can help drive business decisions. Solid understanding of DevOps, DAX, SQL queries, Creating Dashboards and KPI visualizations. Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative. Manufacturing experience is preferred. Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude Familiarity with Agile Methodologies Must be able to work in a fast-paced office environment. BSc/BA in Computer Science, or relevant field Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without employer sponsorship of a VISA such as F1, OPT, and H1B status. Responsibilities Report Development: Building comprehensive Power BI reports and dashboards that succinctly summarize complex data sets, tailored to client-specific requirements. Data Modeling: Developing robust data models that support dynamic and scalable reporting solutions. Data Transformation: Connecting data sources, importing data, and transforming it for business intelligence. Visualizations: Creating visual reports, KPI scorecards, and interactive dashboards using Power BI Desktop. Accuracy and Reliability: Ensuring the accuracy and reliability of the data presented in the dashboards and reports. Collaboration: Working closely with various stakeholders, bridging the gap between technical and non-technical aspects of the business. Lead and mentor others on design and implementation of visualizations and dashboards. Troubleshoot data-related issues and maintain the Power BI infrastructure to ensure its up-to-date and running smoothly. Additional responsibilities will include collaborating with product teams, business data analysis, project management, strategy development, and administrative duties for Power Automate and SharePoint Stoneridge is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. summary: Stoneridge is seeking a Power BI Developer/Analyst to create compelling visualizations across various platforms. The ideal candidate possesses strong data analysis skills, expertise in the Microsoft Power BI Stack, and experience in data modeling and transformation. They will build comprehensive Power BI reports and dashboards, develop data models, and ensure the accuracy and reliability of data presented.  Collaboration, leadership, and problem-solving skills are essential.

title: Sr. Analytics Analyst
description: We are global, we are impacting the lives of millions every day, we are making a difference! At Amcor we are inspired to change the packaging industry and are taking on the aspirational challenge to make all our products recyclable or reusable by 2025. Through our products and global footprint, we are in a unique position to truly make a difference in the packaging space. Our products impact the lives of millions of people across the globe every day from food, beverage, pharmaceutical, medical, home- and personal-care, and other essential products. Amcor is a thriving S&P 500 organisation listed both on the NYSE (AMCR) and ASX (AMC) with US$13 billion in sales. We have a proud history dating back to the 1860’s and come a long way from a single paper mill based in Melbourne to becoming the global leading packaging company. Today, Amcor is an international organisation empowering its 50,000 employees in over 40 countries and across 250 sites. Will you be next to join our journey towards a more sustainable future? At Amcor we are always looking for talented and passionate individuals who are motivated to make a difference. Working at Amcor means you will have a unique opportunity to be a part of an organisation that is committed to providing sustainable packaging solutions. To find out more about our commitment to sustainability and about Amcor, visit www.amcor.com. Job Description Position Overview: The Commercial Sr Analytics Analyst role is responsible for supporting the North America Commercial team. Primary objectives are reporting and analyzing operating performance through Power BI dashboard development. The exposure this role provides will build a strong foundation for larger and broader responsibilities within Amcor. This role will work heavily in Power BI to develop reports and dashboards. Essential Responsibilities And Duties Serve as a valued business partner to the NA Commercial team to identify opportunities for improvement; prioritize business and information needs Establishes priorities and deadlines, assesses resources, and defines next steps. Proactive in building positive relationships among team members and other functions with which the team interacts. Ability to express thoughts and findings clearly and succinctly (both written and orally); tailors communications for different audiences; listens well and effectively contributes to discussions; makes technical points understandable. Provide the Commercial team with actionable information that drives decision-making. Identify and improve the quality, accuracy, completeness of underlying data used by Commercial (i.e., Net Sales, Margin, Open Orders, etc) leveraging tools such as Analysis, Power BI, etc. Conduct commercial analysis, process improvement, and ad hoc support in a dynamic business environment; Support efforts to effectively analyze and communicate results to key Commercial stakeholders Locate and define new process improvement opportunities Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Defining new data collection and analysis processes Develop daily/weekly/monthly tracking for the Commercial team Collaborate with IT to improve data/reporting/dashboard functionality and drive automation Work with subject matter experts to clearly scope projects and thoroughly understand the context and data available to address the problem at hand. Subject-matter expert in systems (Power BI, BusinessObjects, SAP, etc.) and master data management Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree in IT, Analytics, Finance/Accounting, or similar degree required Minimum five years of experience in developing dashboards/visualizations Experience with dimensional data modeling and data visualization Strong customer service focus Strong work ethic with ability to leverage others and work in a cross functional environment Self-initiative and commitment to excellence Effective communicator Experience developing fairly complex reports and dashboards in Power BI Strong business analytics skills experience collecting, organizing, analyzing and transforming data into insights Good understanding of relational database concepts IT systems experience and aptitude; Power BI and Excel Travel up to 10% Competencies Amcor Leadership Framework Competencies Core Competencies Customer Focus Curious Learning on the Fly Interpersonal Savvy Drive for Results 3-5 Applicable ALF Competencies Functional/Technical Skills Managing & Measuring Work Influencing Others Business Acumen Priority Setting Relationships Reports solid line to Director Operations Analytics and Finance Key networking partners: Commercial VPs/Directors/teams, FP&A, Commercial Finance, IT ADA Requirements Physical Requirements ☒Normal Vision ☐Distant Vision ☐Near Vision ☒Hearing/ Listening ☒ Sitting ☒Talking/Speaking ☒Hand/Finger Dexterity ☒ Walking ☒Standing ☐Stooping ☐Pushing/Pulling ☐Bending ☐Kneeling ☐Climbing ☐Lifting (amount 50+ pounds) ☐Carrying (amount 50+ pounds) ☐Driving- Forklift ☐Lifting (amount < 50 pounds) ☐Carrying (amount < 50 pounds) ☐Driving – Automobile/truck/van Other Physical Requirements: Click here to enter text. summary: This job posting is for a Commercial Sr Analytics Analyst role at Amcor, a global packaging company focused on sustainability. The role involves supporting the North American Commercial team through Power BI dashboard development, reporting and analyzing operating performance, and driving process improvement. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 5 years of experience in developing dashboards/visualizations, experience with dimensional data modeling, and strong business analytics skills.

title: Sr Analytics Analyst
description: Summary Position will have the option to be hybrid, after onsite training period** Reporting directly to the leadership, the Senior Data Analyst ( Data Analytics) specializes in harnessing analytics solutions to empower informed decision-making across the organization. Key responsibilities include spearheading the delivery of impactful business intelligence solutions to end users. This role involves leveraging advanced development tools to craft dynamic reports, insightful dashboards, and robust analytical solutions tailored to business specifications. This position serves as the primary support liaison for the team, offering expertise in complex assignments while championing both independent and collaborative work approaches. A core focus involves conducting comprehensive analyses of workflows, data collection processes, and software performance, ensuring alignment with MyMichigan Health's operational guidelines. Additionally, the Senior Data Analyst serves as a subject matter authority for three or more application data models, fostering a deep understanding of critical data domains. Responsibilities (45%)* Data Analysis and Reporting: Lead and execute complex data analysis projects across various clinical and administrative domains within the healthcare system. Design and develop data queries and reports using EPIC, Tableau, and other reporting and statistical software to extract actionable insights from healthcare data. Analyze trends, identify patterns, and develop data-driven recommendations to improve clinical outcomes, operational efficiency, and patient satisfaction. Create and maintain data dashboards and visualizations to effectively communicate data insights to stakeholders at all levels. Develop and implement data quality initiatives to ensure accuracy and consistency of healthcare data. (25%)* Data Management and Integration: Collaborate with IT and other departments to ensure seamless integration of data from various sources, including EPIC, administrative systems, and external data sources. Develop and maintain data models and schemas to facilitate efficient data analysis and reporting. Implement and manage data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes to ensure timely and accurate data availability. Monitor data quality and integrity and identify and resolve data discrepancies. Participate in testing reports and extracts during system or business changes, participates in product upgrades and implementations. (15%)* Communication and Collaboration: Present data insights and recommendations to leadership, clinical teams, and other stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and address data-driven opportunities for improvement. Educate and train staff on data analysis concepts and tools. Stay up-to-date on the latest trends and technologies in healthcare data analytics and apply them to improve data-driven decision making within the organization. (15%)* Additional Responsibilities: Contribute to the development and implementation of data governance policies and procedures. Participate in continuous improvement initiatives aimed at optimizing data analysis processes and tools. Stay informed on relevant healthcare regulations and compliance requirements. Other Duties And Responsibilities Provide excellent customer service to all customers while performing duties. Lead meetings, prioritize, resolve conflicts, maintain issues lists, and manage a project plan. Demonstrate strong project management and organizational skills. Communicate effectively with project leadership and subject matter experts. Continue to learn the software and increase their knowledge over time. MyMichigan Health is a technology driven organization and employees need to demonstrate competency in Microsoft Windows. Employees are required to take a Computer Skills Assessment via the learning management system upon hire. Based on the results of the assessment, an employee may be required to participate in further learning opportunities offered by MyMichigan Health. Certifications and Licensures N/A Required Education BACHELORS DEGREE Bachelor's Degree in IT, business, or healthcare field required. Master's degree in data science, analytics, or a related field preferred. Other Information Experience, Training And Skills Five or more years of experience in data analysis roles preferably within a healthcare setting. Two or more years of experience in a data analyst position or leading complex data analysis projects. Relevant professional certifications (e.g., Tableau Certified Professional, Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) for Data Analytics). Proficiency in SQL: Writing complex queries, designing database schemas, creating T-SQL/PL/SQL scripts, stored procedures, and functions. Expertise in data analysis tools: Python, R, Power BI, Tableau, Excel (advanced with formulas and macros), QlikView, SAS, or other statistical software. Exceptional communication and presentation skills: Effectively communicate data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: Identify key business questions, design and execute data analysis plans, extract actionable insights from data. Experience and competency with EPIC and Cogito applications including (Clarity, Caboodle, Chronicles, Radar, Reporting Workbench. Slicer Dicer, Analytics Catalog). Physical/Mental Requirements And Typical Working Conditions Exposure to stressful situations, including those involving public contact, as well as, trauma, grief and death. Able to wear personal protective equipment that includes latex materials or appropriate substitute if required for your position. Is able to move freely about facility with or without an assisted device and must be able to perform the functions of the job as outlined in the job description. Overall vision and hearing is necessary with or without assisted device(s). Frequently required to sit/stand/walk for long periods of time. May require frequent postural changes such as stooping, kneeling or crouching. Some exposure to blood borne pathogens and other potentially infectious material. Must follow MyMichigan Health bloodborne pathogen and TB testing as required. Ability to handle multiple tasks, get along with others, work independently, regular and predictable attendance and ability to stay awake. Overall dexterity is required including handling, reaching, grasping, fingering and feeling. May require repetition of these movements on a regular to frequent basis. Physical Demand Level: Sedentary. Must be able to occasionally (0-33% of the workday) lift or carry 0-10 lbs.
summary: This position is a hybrid role that requires onsite training, focusing on using analytics solutions to support informed decision-making within MyMichigan Health. The Senior Data Analyst will lead complex data analysis projects, develop data queries and reports, and create dashboards using tools like EPIC, Tableau, and other statistical software. This role also involves managing data integration, developing data models, and collaborating with IT and other departments.

title: Data Operations Analyst II
description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. As an Analyst II in our Data Operations and Governance team, you’ll play a critical role in ensuring the credibility and availability of Kellanova’s data assets. Collaborating cross-functionally, you’ll focus on certifying and maintaining reliable Master Data. Your attention to detail and commitment to data integrity will contribute to our company’s success. The position is open to locations in the United States with a preference for Naperville, IL or Battle Creek, MI. As the sole individual responsible for managing vendor data, you will play a crucial role in safeguarding the company’s financial stability. Collaborating with a diverse team of partners in legal, audit, and within your peer group, this position offers ample opportunities for learning and career growth. Relationship and Solution Focused – Develop and nurture relationships with both internal and external partners, engaging with various stakeholders. Address intricate challenges by conducting research, analysis, and selecting suitable solutions. We’re Looking for Someone With High school diploma and relevant work experience in Electronic Commerce or a related technical or business field Experience in the Data Governance space including internal and external audit controls Experience with SAP and OneTrust Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite Proficient in both spoken and written communication, with the capacity to explain intricate details to diverse audiences Ability to efficiently examine and interpret data What’s Next After you apply, your application will be reviewed by a real recruiter, so it may take us a few weeks to get back with you by email or phone.
