title: Application Analyst II
description: Summary The Application Analyst II operates under moderate supervision of IT Leadership to provide primary support for assigned software applications. This role involves configuring, testing, and maintaining software applications with a focus on optimizing workflows, data collection, and system integrity. The Analyst acts as a liaison between end users, third-party stakeholders, and the application implementation and support teams. Additionally, the Analyst brings subject matter expertise to enhance application modules' functionality and collaborates with diverse departments to ensure efficient system usage. They function as the primary point of contact for application support, ensuring timely issue resolution and effective communication while upholding adherence to MyMichigan Health's policies, procedures, and business operations. Primary responsibilities include conducting comprehensive analyses of workflows, system configurations, reporting specifics, and software testing. They proactively identify opportunities to optimize and enhance the application systems by independently suggesting improved workflows, increased efficiency, and enhanced user experience with consideration for best practices. Application Analyst II's have an in-depth knowledge of the application and the various modules in the areas they support. They configure, test, and maintain all system functionality to meet the needs of end-users. Responsibilities ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: (25%)* Uses a strong understanding of business systems and industry requirements to work with business owners and users to document requirements and workflows. Design and maintain content and key system controls (codes tables, master files, user's interfaces etc.). (25%)* Trouble shoots problems and incidents. Recommends innovative solutions. (10%)* Plans, executes, and documents supporting evidence of application testing. (15%)* Collects information regarding potential system enhancement needs and analyzes new functionality in releases to determine how it should be used. (15%)* Analyzes application capabilities to optimize its use within workflows. (5%)* Assists in cross training team members and users. (5%)* Participates in additional projects including software updates and changes. Other Duties And Responsibilities Exhibit a commitment to exceptional customer service while providing Go-Live or Daily end user support and training of Applications. Using an in-depth knowledge of the application systems analysts continually configure, test, and maintain system functionality to meet the needs of end-users in their areas of support. Holds responsibility to complete complex build and configuration tasks and resolves advanced issues as they arise with minimal support from Senior Analyst and Vendors. Maintain accurate documentation of system configurations, changes, and support activities. Creates knowledge-based support articles to clearly document resolutions and uses these documents to educate others on resolutions. Supports multiple applications, including design, build, testing, training, and troubleshooting with minimal guidance. Performs build tasks following best practices with the minimal support. Manage medium-size requests from inception to completion with minimal support. Manage plans and timelines, coordinate resources within IT, and ensure that requests are delivered within scope and time. Coordinate and lead discussions with multidisciplinary groups, manage priorities, resolve conflicts, maintain a comprehensive issues list, and maintain project tasks. Effectively communicates statuses with leadership and subject matter experts. Communicates all application changes, enhancements, and procedures to all relevant stakeholders of impacted areas. Execute system updates and changes in accordance to IT incident and change policies and procedures. Including documentation of process, testing, and approvals. Provide guidance and support to less experienced analysts through sharing their knowledge and expertise. Participates in an on-call support rotation to address organizational urgent needs. Travel between MyMichigan and affiliated Locations may be required to support applications and go-live implementations. Embrace the technological orientation of MyMichigan Health by showcasing competency in Microsoft Windows. Upon hiring, complete a Computer Skills Assessment via the learning management system. Depending on assessment outcomes, engage in further learning opportunities provided by MyMichigan Health. Certifications and Licensures N/A Required Education Associate's degree is required Associates Degree or Bachelors in IT, business, or healthcare field with two (2) or more years of work-related experiences providing advanced application system support. Other Information Education, Experience, Training And Skills One (1) or more active Epic Certification(s)/Accreditation(s) or other relevant healthcare Certifications, demonstrating expertise in specific applications. Two (2) or more years prior work experience within Healthcare IT, with a strong understanding of clinical workflows, healthcare terminology, and industry standards. Strong analytical thinking skills to dissect complex problems, assess various options, and make informed decisions in support of applications. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, for engaging with stakeholders, team members, and end users in a clear and concise manner. Interacts positively with end users, empathizing with their needs and translating them into system enhancements. Effectively translates and communicate complex technical solutions across various groups to help drive informed decision making by stake holders. Willing and able to adapt to changing circumstances and requirements. Consistently demonstrate time management skills related to handling multiple evolving priorities, new projects, and emerging technologies. Strong attention to detail in all aspects of work, ensuring accuracy, data integrity, and compliance with standards and regulations. Consistently demonstrates calmness under stressful situations and respectfully expresses emotions to situations without adverse impacts. Prioritizes tasks based on importance and urgency aligning with the organizations mission, vision and values. Consistently demonstrates collaborative mindset with the capability to work effectively within multidisciplinary teams and build positive relationships. Actively seeks and shares information appropriately with open and accessible environment that encourages free flow of information Experience in change management principles and practices, facilitating smooth transitions during system upgrades and implementations. Physical/Mental Requirements And Typical Working Conditions Exposure to stressful situations, including those involving public contact, as well as, trauma, grief and death. Able to wear personal protective equipment that includes latex materials or appropriate substitute if required for your position. Is able to move freely about facility with or without an assisted device and must be able to perform the functions of the job as outlined in the job description. Overall vision and hearing is necessary with or without assisted device(s). Frequently required to sit/stand/walk for long periods of time. May require frequent postural changes such as stooping, kneeling or crouching. Some exposure to blood borne pathogens and other potentially infectious material. Must follow MyMichigan Health bloodborne pathogen and TB testing as required. Ability to handle multiple tasks, get along with others, work independently, regular and predictable attendance and ability to stay awake. Overall dexterity is required including handling, reaching, grasping, fingering and feeling. May require repetition of these movements on a regular to frequent basis. Physical Demand Level: Sedentary. Must be able to occasionally (0-33% of the workday) lift or carry 0-10 lbs Staff Hired to Virtual Care Team: Physical Demand Level: Medium . Must be able to occasionally (0-33% of the workday) lift or carry 20-50lbs., frequently (34-66% of the workday) lift 20lbs. and/or Walk/Stand/Push/Pull of Arm/Leg controls and constantly (67-100% of the workday) lift 10 lbs.

title: Data Engineer
description: About HTC Global Services: Shaping careers since 1990 - our long tenured employees are a testimony of the work culture. Join our global employee base of 12,000 and help us bring human expertise to tech in order to deliver purposeful solutions that amplify value. Job Description: HTC Global Services is seeking a senior Data Engineer experienced with building data movement and data curation processes using modern toolsets including Snowflake, Python, YAML, and Azure Data Factory. This is NOT a traditional data modeling and ETL batch data processing role. This role will primarily be: Designing, coding, and testing Python scripts to deliver prescribed business outcomes. Conducting detailed data analysis in response to both trouble tickets and new development. Providing real-time technical support during U.S. business hours. The varied and non-traditional mix of technologies and processes at play will require the successful candidate to be a very fast learner and a strong experienced problem-solver. The core project involves acquiring and transforming data from various source systems and curating that data for consumption by a customer-facing portal. While this is primarily an individual contributor role, the role will also serve as an onshore coordinator for a larger offshore development team. Our client is a Pennsylvania-based transportation and logistics company. This role is primarily remote though, so candidates may reside anywhere in the United States. Be advised however that occasional travel (10-15%) may be required as the needs of the project dictate. Required People Skills: Professional, confident, and cordial demeanor. Excellent communication skills – both oral and written. Proven ability to operate in dynamic environments and still deliver quality outcomes on a timely basis. Self-motivated, proactive, efficient, and highly organized. Strong desire and proven ability to learn new things quickly. Ability to work independently, with a high level of performance, with minimal direct supervision. Ability to smoothly collaborate with client and team resources to ensure results meet the defined business needs and exceed client expectations. Experience coordinating the efforts of geographically distributed team members. Ability to travel occasionally (10-15%) as required. Required Technical Skills: 5+ years of experience implementing, enhancing, or supporting data solutions in support of downstream applications. Proven ability to write, refine, and troubleshoot highly efficient data manipulation code using Python, PySpark, and YAML. Proven experience working in technical support role – particularly for web applications and their underlying databases. Direct experience working with Snowflake databases. Ability to create and manage pipelines in Azure Data Factory. Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills – especially the ability to identify and resolve processing issues in near real time. Strong communication skills – particularly in terms of interacting with business users and teammates to quickly analyze and resolve both production issues and novel development challenges. Value Add Skills: (helpful but not required): Direct experience working in the Transportation and Logistics industry. Direct hands-on experience working with the SnowPark toolset for data movement and transformation. Direct hands-on experience working with Databricks tools and environments. Advanced programming skills in C#, PowerShell, Python, or other equivalent modern programming languages. Experience working in the Jira Agile project management toolset. Relevant certifications in the toolsets of interest. Benefits: At HTC Global Services our associates have access to a comprehensive benefits package that includes Health, Dental, Vision, Paid-Time-Off, Paid Holidays, 401K matching, Life and Accidental Death Insurance, Short- & Long-Term Disability Insurance, and a variety of other offerings. Diversity & Inclusion Our success as a company is built on practicing inclusion and embracing diversity. HTC Global Services is committed to providing a work environment free from discrimination and harassment, where all employees are treated with respect and dignity. Together we work to create and maintain an environment where everyone feels valued, included, and respected. At HTC Global Services, our differences are embraced and celebrated. HTC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce. HTC is proud to be recognized as a National Minority Supplier EEO/M/F/V/H
summary: HTC Global Services is seeking a Senior Data Engineer to design, code, and test Python scripts for data movement and curation using Snowflake, Python, YAML, and Azure Data Factory. This role involves data analysis, real-time technical support, and coordination of a larger offshore development team for a Pennsylvania-based transportation and logistics company. The ideal candidate will be a fast learner and experienced problem solver with strong technical and communication skills.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description: Your Job The Koch Capability Transformation Team within Koch Global Services is seeking a Business Systems Analyst to join our LIFT product team to implement and support data solutions for facilities capability. Our LIFT (Land, Infrastructure, Facilities, Transactions) product team provides support for leveraged applications and surrounding technology supporting our enterprise Facilities business processes and data analytics. Our Team As we continue to transform the LIFT capability, you will be responsible for driving, challenging and leading continuous improvements to enable customers to effectively utilize and gain additional value from our systems and applications. The ideal candidate for this role will need the ability to develop relationships, strong problem-solving skills to resolve and offer solutions in functional, technical, and data focused areas, and the ability to identify opportunities to advance and improve the product(s) and surrounding technologies. This candidate should also have a collaborative mindset and capability to partner with customers, consumers, vendors, and the global support team to continuously enhance and optimize the product. What You Will Do Develop in-depth knowledge of business analytics, integrations, and application needs to assist in developing and providing long term solutions. Lead end-to-end requirement development process and support the planning and execution of the data product and LIFT application roadmap/timeline. Collaborate with technical team members to resolve complex functional and technical data and application related issues. Leverage API and Data Management tools to optimize data transfers, reporting, and coordinate data validation and testing. Foster continuous improvement and drive problems solving in collaboration with business stakeholders. Develop and maintain strong working relationships with business leaders and stakeholders to internalize business strategies and optimize value. Actively listen and anticipate customer’s needs and incorporate into team strategies and priorities to drive valuable results. Partner with global product team, customers, consumers, vendors, IT teams and others to optimize data and application products and implement and enhance technology solutions. Ensure business and KGS visions and strategies are understood and being implemented within the product and communicated downstream to users. Have the courage to challenge and escalate as necessary, embrace teamwork and differing cultures and opinions, be able to work independently, be motivated, reliable, and trustworthy. Who You Are (Basic Qualifications) Desire to learn or aptitude in data development life cycle and data management principles (ETL/ELT, basic data engineering, data modeling). Experience in application management or implementing IT projects. Asking good questions to dig deep into business processes; drive to truly understand business needs and system issues. Ability to work simultaneously on multiple issues and projects without causing disruption in deliverables. Experience communicating and presenting to users, stakeholders and peers at various levels within an organization and across the globe to influence and gain alignment on objectives. What Will Put You Ahead Experience using Agile frameworks and methodologies, to manage backlog and prioritization processes. Experience with data management tools such as Databricks, SQL, Python, or Snowflake. Experience in understanding and correcting data discrepancies, identifying data anomalies, and root cause analysis. Experience with application integrations and API management. At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy. Hiring Philosophy All Koch companies value diversity of thought, perspectives, aptitudes, experiences, and backgrounds. We are Military Ready and Second Chance employers. Learn more about our hiring philosophy here. Who We Are As a Koch company, Koch Global Services (KGS) creates solutions spanning technology, human resources, finance, project management and anything else our businesses need. With locations in India, Mexico, Poland and the United States, our employees have the opportunity to make a global impact. At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company. Our Benefits Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter. Additionally, everyone has individual work and personal needs. We seek to enable the best work environment that helps you and the business work together to produce superior results. Equal Opportunities Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status. Except where prohibited by state law, some offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test. This employer uses E-Verify. Please click here for additional information. #KR-5

title: Data Governance Engineer _ 5+ years exp _ Hybrid @ Warren, MI
description: Data Governance Engineer _ 5+ years exp _ Hybrid @ Warren, MI This individual will work with other groups within to verify and gather data including but not limited to the law team, as well as the dealerships. ** Top 3 must-have hard skills Level of experience with each Stack-ranked by importance 1 Visio 2 Be able to development and understand data flow diagram 3 Be able to critique/explain a data flow diagram VERY IMPORTANT. This team is responsible for bringing dealer data. This data does not belong to OEM, so it is to be used with the agreements that OEM has with the dealers. This is for the mutual benefits for OEM and the dealers. That is what this person in this role is going to help us do. This team brings in the largest source of Data coming into OEM but they have to protect it as the dealers property. This is going to be a new role on the team except for one. This person will be working side by side with the other individual in this role. Job Responsibilities: Review new requests for dealer data, ensuring requestors complete the Dealer Data Authorization form. Ensure that business teams understand and adhere to the Dealer Data Governance Process. Assist business teams as they navigate the Dealer Data Governance Process and related process including: o Privacy Impact Assessment o External Data Transfer Policy o Application Registration (ASMS), if needed o Maintain and publish status of each request Ensure submitted DDA forms are complete and thoroughly document a request for dealer data including purpose, source of dealer data, specific data elements requested, data flows, use and all third parties. Perform annual audits on the anniversary of active Dealer Data Authorization forms. Develop data lineage reports to capture each dealer data flow from source to consumption, highlighting changes and transformation of dealer data. Document business requirements for occasions where it is necessary to acquire additional dealer data from dealer third-party service providers to meet a business need where there is dealer consent. Support the creation and maintenance of a dealer data dictionary, provide context and understanding to data elements, ensure consistency and accuracy in data interpretation. Support the documentation and implementation of data quality policies, standards, and procedures for dealer data systems. Ensure data governance practices and dealer data use adheres to federal and state regulatory requirements. Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to data governance, such as data quality metrics, compliance levels, and incident reports, and provide regular reports and updates to management on the status of data governance initiatives. Recommend solutions to improve our Dealer Data Governance posture. Knowledge and experience working with IT processes and projects, gain high-level understanding of complex IT solutions; strong technical skills. Ability to read and create a complex data flow diagram is critical to success. Demonstrated capability for problem solving, decision making, sound judgment, assertiveness. Strong meeting facilitation skills and a demonstrated ability to influence teams toward collaboration and problem solving for an optimal solution. Ability to prioritize assignments and multi-task within time constraints. Strong oral and written communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office product suite, including Visio. The following qualifications are a plus: o SQL expertise o Experience with analytic tools and databases such as Tableau, Power BI, Oracle o Experience with Watson Knowledge Catalog (WKC), Atlan, or similar data catalog tool
summary: Data Governance Engineer responsible for overseeing and managing dealer data at OEM. The role involves reviewing data requests, ensuring compliance with regulations, documenting data flows, and maintaining data quality. The ideal candidate will have strong data flow diagram skills, experience with data governance processes, and knowledge of regulatory requirements.

Demonstrate technical knowledge and communication skills with the ability to advocate for well-designed solutions. title: SHS-BUS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST INTER
description: Job Opportunity Job ID: 42770 Positions Location: Lansing, MI Job Description Purpose: The Business Intelligence Description: Positions Location: Lansing, MI Purpose Job Description The Business Intelligence Analyst works in a fast paced, changing health care environment. The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst will coordinate and actively contribute throughout the BI development life cycle from initial requirement analysis, documentation, prototyping, design, and development all the way through to implementation, quality assurance, and user acceptance. The BI Analyst will work with internal and external customers to understand their requirements and present analytical results in an easy to understand communication. The BI analyst will also partner with customers and other IT application analysts to provide technology solutions that incorporate reporting and data analytic needs within SHS applications. Essential Duties This job description is intended to cover the minimum essential duties assigned on a regular basis. Caregivers may be asked to perform additional duties as assigned by their leader. Leadership has the right to alter or modify the duties of the position. Provide data visualizations, dashboards, analysis, extracts and reporting solutions from multiple health care data sources such as Epic EMR, Lawson, and other provider and payer data. Drive BI and data analytic processes and technology improvement initiatives. Use data to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for the business. Identify effective and strategic business reporting solutions through research and analysis of data and business processes. Analyze how information systems and reporting solutions can be applied to reduce cost, increase revenue, improve efficiency, and provide higher quality data and reporting. Communicate with business users and senior leaders regarding areas of opportunity to leverage data and reporting solutions. Research, analyze and recommend health care reporting solution best practices. Create appropriate documentation for BI and data analytic solutions and data definitions. Assist in customer training sessions by providing documentation, topics, and support for complex questions. Present and communicate BI and data analytic solutions and analysis to customers of any level in the health system. Go-live elbow support of BI and DA areas. Manage ticket queue, review tickets, assure correct team is assigned to resolve, obtain additional information from customer Resolve common report\data issues, troubleshoot and document issue resolution. Execute test scripts for unit testing and integrated testing for upgrades Tier II support for warm transfers from helpdesk during peak call times Project support to analysts—tasks associated with projects to assist analyst Command center support for go-lives Small and medium optimization requests. Escalate issues to vendors Develop test scenarios for reports, dashboards, data visualizations Own sub-projects of larger projects lead by intermediate and senior analysts Lead small projects, independent contributor Knowledge sharing/transfer with other team members Complex problem solving within the reporting solutions Sparrow Health System is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status. Job Requirements Work Experience Minimum 1 years of relevant work experience or 3 years of total work experience Preferred: Previous programming, report writing, SQL, ETL, or IT related experience Healthcare related experience Education Bachelor’s degree in computer science/technology, business analytics, engineering, healthcare administration or analytic field Specialized Knowledge and Skills Demonstrable aptitude/willingness to learn: data analysis, data visualization tools, how to query data, structure and content of health care data, how to improve processes using data, report development Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to work independently and in a team environment Flexibility and adaptability Strong problem solving, analytical, logical reasoning, customer service and training skills. Professionalism and self-motivation. Candidates should have a passion for improving systems and processes and desire for real responsibility. Demonstrate an aptitude and willingness to learn and teach others. Preferred: Understanding and experience in project management Data analysis and reporting Sparrow Health System is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status. Requirements Job Family Information Technology Requirements: Shift Days Degree Type / Education Level Bachelor's Status Full-time Facility Match Any Experience Level Under 4 Years
summary: The Business Intelligence Analyst role at Sparrow Health System involves coordinating and contributing to the entire BI development lifecycle, from requirement analysis to implementation and support. The analyst will work with internal and external customers to understand their needs, analyze data, and present findings in a clear and concise manner. They will also partner with IT teams to develop reporting and data analytic solutions within SHS applications. This role requires strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, along with experience in data analysis, visualization, and query writing. The ideal candidate will have a passion for improving systems and processes and a desire for real responsibility.

title: Specialist - Data Engineer
description: Eaton’s IT team is currently seeking a Specialist – Data Engineer to join team. This position will be based at our Beachwood, Ohio, Moon TWP, PA, Houston, TX, Galesburg, MI, Raleigh, NC or Menomonee Falls, WI. The position is eligible for hybrid work setup. The expected annual salary range for this role is $105,000 - $145,000 a year. Please note the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations. What You’ll Do The Specialist IT will be responsible for providing leadership and guidance on Data Analytics projects across Eaton Enterprise programs driving direction and continuous improvement. Integration and Data Management (IDM) team comprises of experienced resources (full time employees and contractors) who work on a broad range of business-critical programs in Data and analytics domain which require data to be integrated across systems or consolidated within various enterprise data warehouses/repositories in addition to analytics and visual reporting capabilities. The candidate should have a solid grounding in IT process, excellent technical acumen, strong business process knowledge, and the curiosity and drive to consistently deliver results that leverage and improve upon existing standards and best practices. The candidate must be highly self-motivated with strong communication skills and the ability to guide others in ambiguous situations. Essential Responsibilities Work with Global teams across Value Chains in IT and business entities to address Data Analytics and visualization need of the organization aligned with Eaton's Data strategy. Must have experience in executing and delivering key IT programs. Provide oversight on the Overall Data and Analytics strategy. Demonstrable experience in technical design and development as Data Engineering and visualization expert. Creates robust and automated data pipelines using traditional and modern data integration technologies, including ETL/ELT, data replication/CDC, streaming, message-oriented data movement and API-based data acquisition leveraging cloud native toolset. Lead the technical architecture and design activities. Drives the delivery of solutions from initiation through development, validation, go-live and user adoption. Own and drive Data Quality activities. Ensure quality of work deliverables. Provides operational support and assistance for Data Integration and Analytics applications. Collaborates with Development, Support and Platform teams to deliver projects/Operational activities. Assess vendors and collaborate with broader IT team to ensure solutions align with global IT/business strategy. Coach, advise and guide Business/IT teams on best practices in deploying Data and Analytics technologies to drive productivity, growth & efficiency. Translating complex functional, technical, and business requirements into easy-to-understand user stories, detail technical design and architecture. Regularly communicates and reinforces status, prioritization, and timing back to project, program and organizational leaders of critical success measures, issues, and mitigation strategies. Qualifications Required (Basic) Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution. Minimum 6 years of data engineering or application management experience required This position requires use of information or access to hardware which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee. Legally authorized to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship now or in the future. No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidates within a 50-mile radius of the work location will be considered. Active-Duty Military Service member candidates are exempt from the geographical area limitation. Preferred Qualifications Experience on data platforms such as: Snowflake, Azure, PowerBi Experience working with Kafka preferred. Experience working on enterprise data projects (data warehouses/master data management, others) with hands-on data analysis, and profiling skills using SQL. Experience with Agile and DevOps processes. Skills Position Criteria: Strong SQL skills and advance knowledge of Power BI Strong programming skills (Java, Python, Spark). Strong understanding of Data Integration technologies. Good understanding of API-First architecture. Soft Skills Ability to lead as the subject matter expertise in the space through diagnosing, isolating, and resolving complex issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems Ability to adapt to the situation and pivot based on changing priorities Ability to identify operational issues and proactively solutions to resolve problems. Ability to drive application modernization and enablement Experience establishing & maintaining relationships with individuals at all levels in an organization. Must have strong verbal and written communication skills and drive for results. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for job applicants and employees. Our recruitment processes use balanced selection criteria and avoid unlawful discrimination against applicants on the basis of their age, colour, disability, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity, genetic information, race or racial origin, religion, sexual orientation or any other status protected or required by law. ]]>
summary: Eaton is seeking a Specialist - Data Engineer to lead Data Analytics projects across enterprise programs. The role involves designing and building robust data pipelines, leading technical architecture, ensuring data quality, and providing operational support for data integration and analytics applications.  The candidate will work with global teams across IT and business entities and collaborate with vendors to ensure solutions align with global IT/business strategy. The role also includes coaching and advising teams on best practices in deploying Data and Analytics technologies to drive productivity, growth, and efficiency.

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Engineer
description: Career Now Brands is seeking an experienced and passionate Business Intelligence Engineer to join our dynamic team. As a BI Engineer, you will be critical in leveraging data to gain insights into our lead generation and hiring trends, helping us make informed decisions and optimize our strategies. You will be a Tableau expert initially but will also be instrumental in evaluating and migrating to a new BI tool as we grow. Candidates will ensure client trust in data products through accuracy, availability, and reliability in service delivery. This position is fully on-site, located at our Royal Oak, MI office. All candidates must reside within the Metro Detroit area to be eligible for consideration. Responsibilities Design, develop, and maintain scalable and robust BI solutions using BI tools such as Tableau Reconcile and analyze data sources to identify patterns, opportunities, and potential risks associated with lead generation and hiring strategies Ensure client data is secure through row-level security and enterprise deployment techniques Collaborate with stakeholders across different departments (Marketing Ops, Sales, Call Center, Paid Media, and Campaign Ops) to understand their data needs and translate them into actionable insights Provide expertise in data modeling, data warehousing, and data management best practices Ensure best practices for BI development are followed throughout the team Mentor junior BI engineers and analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development within the team Stay up-to-date on the latest BI trends and technologies, recommending and evaluating new tools to improve our data infrastructure and capabilities Lead the migration from Tableau to a new BI tool, managing the process and ensuring a smooth transition Required Qualifications 8+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Engineer or in a similar role Expert-level proficiency in Tableau with experience creating complex and interactive dashboards Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.8+ years experience writing SQL queries and comfortable writing complex queries Experience with dbt or similar data transformation tools is a plus Familiarity with basic statistical methods (e.g., regression, statistical significance) Familiarity with data visualization best practices and design principles Excellent communication and collaboration skills, translating complex data insights for non-technical audiences Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proactive approach Experience in mentoring and guiding junior team members Preferred Qualifications Experience with cloud-based data platforms and tools (e.g., AWS) Exposure to other BI tools and technologies Experience in migrating data infrastructure and tools Experience with Python, R, or similar programming languages Company Perks Competitive salary and benefits package Opportunity to work on challenging and impactful projects Collaborative and supportive work environment Chance to learn and grow your skills in a rapidly evolving field Be part of a company that values data-driven decision-making If you are a problem solver with a strong analytical mindset and a desire to make a meaningful impact in shaping the future of data-driven excellence, apply now and be an integral part of our Career Now Brands team! To Learn More About Our Company, Please Visit Www.careernowbrands.com. Career Now Brands is an equal-opportunity employer and values diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other occupationally irrelevant criteria.
summary: Career Now Brands is seeking a Business Intelligence Engineer to join their team in Royal Oak, MI. The role involves designing, developing, and maintaining BI solutions using Tableau, analyzing data to identify trends and opportunities, ensuring data security, and collaborating with stakeholders to translate data into actionable insights. The ideal candidate will have 8+ years of experience in a similar role, expert-level proficiency in Tableau, strong SQL skills, and experience with data warehousing and ETL processes. Familiarity with dbt, statistical methods, data visualization best practices, and mentoring is also preferred.
benefits: Opportunity to work on challenging and impactful projects
Chance to learn and grow your skills in a rapidly evolving field
Be part of a company that values data-driven decision-making

title: IT Security Analyst

title: Consultant - Data Visualization-User Interface/Experience
description: Description This position is for a Consultant with a strength in data visualization, user interface/experience and data storytelling for business and IT organizations. The Consultant will work with diverse clients ranging from small and medium size enterprises to Fortune 100 firms. Working in a team environment with internal and Client stakeholders, the consultant will develop, analyze, and optimize data visualization and user interfaces. This involves coordinating data analytics, data storytelling and user interface development activities within a client's organization. Engagements are usually longer in duration, which allows for the consultant to oversee the implementation of his/her process improvement recommendations. Responsibilities The Consultant will perform the following job responsibilities in addition to others as required for each project: Manages and implements data visualization, user interface/experience and data storytelling within their assigned projects. The Consultant is the primary resource to project teams in support of all data visualization, user interface/experience and data storytelling initiatives. The Consultant will work with the project team and interact with the client for. The Consultant will oversee the implementation of data visualization, user interface/experience and data storytelling recommendations data source evaluation, data modeling, data storytelling and user interface/experience design and implementation with the client and work with other consultants to coordinate all facets of these initiatives Mentor and coach team members on the fundamentals of implementation of data visualization, user interface/experience and data storytelling. Data analytics and metrics development. Develop Key Performance Indicators for the current state, and track KPIs during and after implementation of process improvement recommendations General Consultant Qualifications Qualified candidates for Consultant Level positions will have the following qualifications: Undergraduate Degree in technical field with two years of professional experience, or Graduate Degree, or equivalent in combination of education and/or experience Strong skills in presentation, word processing, and spreadsheet applications. Demonstrated success in analysis driven problem solving Excellent verbal and written presentation skills Ability to work effectively in a high-pressure, time-sensitive environment Ability to effectively collaborate with cross functional teams and influence without authority Ability to maintain confidential and sensitive materials and information Ability to establish effective working relationships with client personnel Expertise with Microsoft Power BI data visualization platform; Microsoft Power Platform experience bonus Expertise in data analytics, data presentation, and KPI/dashboard development Expertise in user interface/user experience evaluation/design/development Travel Requirements Remote Work opportunities; with up to 25% in the office and/or travel to clients.
summary: This role involves working as a Consultant focusing on data visualization, user interface/experience (UI/UX), and data storytelling. You'll be part of a team, collaborating with clients (ranging from small businesses to Fortune 100 firms) to analyze and optimize data visualization and UI. The position offers long-term engagements where you'll guide the implementation of process improvements.

title: Security Analyst
description: Position: Security Analyst Location: Dimondale, MI (Hybrid) Duration: 12 Months (Extendable0 In Person Interview The Security Analyst position works as a member of the Vulnerability Management Team. The Senior Security Analyst position reviews and remediates cyber incidents and vulnerabilities found by IT level analysts to IT security specialists and managers to maintain the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of State of Michigan data Technical Security Analyst performing duties related to the Vulnerability Management team.  Plans, schedules, implements, and maintains scalable vulnerability scans using modern vulnerability management scanning tools for high complexity devices.  While ensuring safe and timely scanning that has minimal/no impact on scan targets, provides troubleshooting of technical issues with scans.  Supports vulnerability management scanning and reporting tools.  Conducts internal vulnerability audits of servers, network devices, applications, and other devices.  Interfaces with internal and external auditors, providing detailed information on remediation efforts.  Creates integrations of vulnerability management data with other State of Michigan enterprise services.  Conducts data analysis of vulnerability management data, often integrated with other data sources, to measure effectiveness of vulnerability remediation. Data analysis tasks includes large datasets, which include structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.  Interfaces with other agencies to make recommendations on how to improve the security posture and reduce the number of security related vulnerabilities.  Conducts trend analysis, creates dashboards using data scripting to provide metrics on the performance of security responsibilities, controls, and creates new reports for management based on those collected metrics across multiple agencies.  Escalates as appropriate. Top Skills & Years of Experience: - 5+ Years' IT Security Experience - Experience with vulnerability management scanning and reporting tools. - Experience with trend analysis and creating dashboards using data scripting to provide metrics on the performance. - Ability to work independently and efficiently.
summary: This role is a Security Analyst for the Vulnerability Management Team within the State of Michigan. Responsibilities include conducting vulnerability scans, troubleshooting technical issues, auditing internal systems, integrating vulnerability data with other enterprise services, analyzing vulnerability data to measure remediation effectiveness, recommending security posture improvements, and creating dashboards and reports for management. The position requires experience with vulnerability management scanning and reporting tools, trend analysis, data scripting, and working independently.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description: Position Summary This position will support our GlobalShop ERP for three US locations of ELMET Technologies, in Coldwater, Michigan, Euclid, Ohio and Lewiston, Maine. ELMET is a fully integrated, US-owned and operated, global leader in the manufacture of high purity molybdenum and tungsten products for the aerospace, industrial, energy and defense sectors. We have significant opportunities to further evaluate our business processes and find additional ways to automate, integrate, and optimize our ERP solution to create efficiencies, improve management visibility, enrich customer information, and improve data quality throughout the business. This role will be responsible for identifying detailed business requirements, managing projects/priorities, supporting GlobalShop operations and delivering ongoing solutions. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS And RESPONSIBILITIES. This role is integral to supporting and improving automated processes, streamlining critical business processes, data integrity, compliance, and innovative business applications Documenting the business requirements, which express what actions a solution must take and what outcome is expected. Facilitates the customer’s decision-making process and develops the functional design documents that will drive the development process for business applications. Strong analytical, problem-solving and troubleshooting skills and keen attention to detail is extremely important. Support and Administration of GlobalShop ERP platforms for all US Operations Working directly with GlobalShop experts/resources to deliver ERP services consistent with corporate direction Providing continuous uptime of ERP systems for the organization Planning, designing and executing approved configuration changes Maintaining GlobalShop Improvements roadmap and delivering new features, as well as integrated solutions Participation in ongoing ERP Steering Committee meetings Collaborates with stakeholders throughout the organization to ensure a comprehensive set of requirements, aligned to business objectives, gaining full understanding of current business processes. Demonstrates experience in the use of agile frameworks and ERP implementation methodologies. Conducting acceptance testing and training customer resources to successfully use and maintain business applications. Has industry experience and understands challenges and risks when implementing vertical applications, primarily within a Discrete Manufacturing environment. Develop and maintain positive, collaborative working relationships with other team members within the department and throughout the organization. Must be able to make presentations at meetings and train system users at all levels within the organization. Must be organized with the ability to multi-task and set priorities. Able to influence, negotiate and build consensus Perform research, schedule personal training or attend conferences to keep abreast of enterprise applications developments. Qualifications/Skills To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. At least 3 years of experience working with ERP Systems - Technical and Professional Expertise At least 3 years of experience performing in a Business Analyst capacity, including mapping and improving business processes At least 2 years of experience in Discrete Manufacturing preferred Knowledge and experience with user roles and Security in GlobalShop or equivalent ERPs Familiarity or experience with custom reports and forms development Familiarity or experience with business intelligence reporting Experience in setup and maintenance of workflow design & configurations, as well as email notification processes. GlobalShop ERP implementation, configuration and a support experience a plus Experience with GlobalSHop Dashboard Designer a plus Ability to work independently and as a member of a team Expert in user story writing, along with the necessary acceptance criteria Must be a US Citizen or Green Card Holder Ability for occasional travel Education/Experience: BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business Administration or a related field Minimum of 3 years IT experience as a Business Systems Analyst. Minimum of 2 years of experience developing and writing scenarios for business process flows Minimum of 2 years of experience developing, coordinating and delivering training to a distributed end user base. 2+ years' experience with ERP product implementation and/or support. Preferably in one or more of the following areas: Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Fixed Assets, General Ledger, Procurement, Master Planning, Quality, Project Management and/or System Administration. At least 3 years relevant experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience with modeling business process and translating requirements into a business application Experience with writing and maintaining data query language preferred Experience with SharePoint configurations and support a plus Experience with OTS business software due diligence and support a plus Experience with advanced Microsoft Excel spreadsheets, including pivot tables, database queries and formulas a plus Aerospace and Defense manufacturing industries experience a plus PHYSICAL DEMANDS and WORK ENVIRONMENT Mixed work environment between office and manufacturing production areas. Able to carry up to 35 pounds and able to work in a variety of spaces including wiring closets, and production areas with provided required PPE. The above description covers the most significant duties performed but does not exclude other occasional work assignments not mentioned, the inclusion of which would be in conformity with the level of the job. About Elmet Established in 1929, Elmet is a global manufacturer of high-performance metals and metal products. Our world-class facility produces mill, machined, and fabricated products to our customers’ most exacting specifications from Elmet-manufactured refractory metals. Elmet services the high-temperature furnace, semiconductor, medical imaging, medical device, aerospace, defense, and other markets. Elmet is ISO 9001 and AS9100 certified. For more information about Elmet, please visit us online at www.elmettechnologies.com. VETERAN/DISABLED Elmet Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, familial status, domestic violence status, or any other status protected by law. Powered by JazzHR dBgVwX1sq1
summary: This role supports the GlobalShop ERP system for three US locations of ELMET Technologies, a global manufacturer of high purity molybdenum and tungsten products. The position involves identifying business requirements, managing projects, supporting GlobalShop operations, and delivering solutions to improve efficiency, visibility, customer information, and data quality. Key responsibilities include documenting business requirements, facilitating decision-making processes, supporting GlobalShop platforms, working with GlobalShop experts, planning and executing configuration changes, participating in steering committee meetings, conducting acceptance testing, and training users. The ideal candidate will have experience with ERP systems, business analysis, discrete manufacturing, GlobalShop ERP, agile frameworks, and writing user stories.

title: Data Analytics Subject Matter Expert
description: Position Description And Responsibilities Cleary University invites candidates to apply for the contract position of Data Analytics Subject Matter Expert (SME). The academic team at Cleary University seeks a dynamic student-focused expert possessing a successful academic and professional record of championing a strong, vibrant, and relevant undergraduate educational experiences of exceptional quality. In particular, the Data Analytics SME will possess expertise and professional experience in: Data analytics techniques Applications of data analytics Databases and SQL programming Python and R programming Communication and presentation of data analyses Fulfilling Cleary University’s Mission to “provide an intimate and inclusive, student-centered business education that instills the values of The Cleary Mind™ in our community”, the Data Analytics SME works closely with leadership, faculty, and instructional design personnel to revise courses for Cleary University’s undergraduate student body, which includes traditional campus-based students, student athletes, and returning adult students across a variety of instructional modalities. Education The Data Analytics SME combines their formal education, professional knowledge, and real-world experience to guide content revision in the course design process. Working closely with academic leadership, faculty, and instructional designers, the Data Analytics SME creates and revises course elements: Course materials (e.g., textbooks, articles, videos, and online course curations). Course assignments (e.g., discussion questions, presentations, applied analyses, and culminating projects). With the assistance of an instructional designer, the Data Analytics SME will ensure Cleary students explore appropriate content and apply their knowledge to meet course-level outcomes and create weekly learning objectives branched out from the main course objectives. The Data Analytics SME will consult with leadership, faculty, and instructional designers to ensure consistency of revisions with existing Cleary programs and courses, along with key elements of Cleary’s plan for the assessment of student learning. The contract position can be remote or based in the Howell, MI, area. Review of applications will begin immediately and continue to be accepted until the contract position is filled. Expected Time Commitments And Potential Compensation The Data Analytics SME will work directly with a Cleary instructional designer throughout the term of the contract project, including the following time commitments and potential compensation: Participate in a weekly meeting with an instructional designer to discuss program and course development progress (ranging from 4 to 6 weeks per course, with each meeting of 30 to 60 minutes duration). Research, create, and revise course materials (ranging from 3 to 5 hours each week). Participate in consultation with leadership and faculty (ranging 1 to 2 hours total). Potential Compensation (depends on the SME contract specifics) includes $500 per course revision and $700 per course creation. Qualifications And Required Skills An earned master’s degree from an institutionally (i.e., regionally) accredited institution in data analytics, data science, or a closely-related discipline. A minimum of five years of current professional experience in data analytics. A minimum of one year teaching experience teaching undergraduate data analytics courses at the university/college level. Ability to use Microsoft Office, Google Docs, and other software programs for communicating, creating, and maintaining spreadsheets, reports, and presentations. Employment Classification: The Data Analytics SME will be a contract employee. Reports To: Cleary University Instructional Designer Available: July 2024 Application Instructions Visit https://cleary.edu/about-cleary/employment/ to submit an application for the position. A complete application includes a cover letter that addresses the position responsibilities, required qualifications, and required skills, and a current resume/CV. Diversity Cleary University is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. Cleary strongly believes that workforce diversity creates an environment in which its employees can thrive. Cleary understands and embraces the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. Cleary University is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Cleary encourages interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match their skills and capabilities.
summary: Cleary University is looking for a Data Analytics Subject Matter Expert (SME) to revise and create course materials for their undergraduate data analytics program. The SME will work closely with faculty and instructional designers to ensure course content is relevant and meets student learning outcomes. The position is remote or based in Howell, MI, and pays $500 per course revision and $700 per course creation.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description: Job Title: Senior Data Engineer Job Location: Dearborn, MI (Hybrid) Job Type: Full Time Job Description This position will require an individual who has a strong background with multiple database technologies, who is process oriented and has knowledge of Big Data and GCP environment Requirement Experience with GCP based Big Data deployments (Batch/Real-Time) leveraging Big Query, Google Cloud Storage, Pub-Sub, Data Fusion, Dataflow, Dataproc, Cloud functions etc. Experience with relational SQL databases Experience building and optimizing "big data" data pipelines, architectures and data sets. Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement. Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management. Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc. Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in agile mode. 10+ years of application development experience 3+ years of GCP experience 4+ years of experience with large-scale solutioning and operationalization of data warehouses and/or data lakes Interested candidates can send their updated resumes at himanee.sahu@agile-techlabs.com
summary: Senior Data Engineer needed for a hybrid role in Dearborn, MI.  The ideal candidate will have strong experience with GCP-based Big Data deployments, relational SQL databases, and building data pipelines. They will also have experience with big data tools like Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka.  The role requires 10+ years of application development experience, 3+ years of GCP experience, and 4+ years of experience with data warehouse and data lake solutions.

title: Information Technology Analyst (Departmental Analyst (Trainee) 9-12)
description: Job Description Online application must contain all detailed education and experience. It will be used as the primary source for the initial review of your application. As the Michigan Public Service Commission (MPSC) Information Technology (IT) Analyst and examines and determines the reason. The IT Analyst serves as the staff member who examines and determines the reasonableness and prudence of IT and cyber security investments that affect utility operations and correspondingly customers who rely on utility services. IT areas of analysis include the implementation of hardware and software that facilitate utility operations, customer platforms, cloud computing and cybersecurity protections that affect Michigan’s utility ratepayers. The IT Analyst is responsible for providing IT analysis to the Customer Assistance Division and the MPSC Commissioners. The IT Analyst will review rate case applications and corresponding literature addressing technical functionality of IT systems as well as assist with monitoring procedures, guidelines, and policies that are foundational to successful critical infrastructure cyber protection. The IT Analyst will also provide research and testimony on customer data privacy and energy usage data accessibility. View the full Departmental Analyst 12 position description here View the full Departmental Analyst 9-P11 position description here View the full Departmental Analyst Trainee 9-P11 position description here LARA is proud to be Michigan Veteran’s Affairs Agency (MVAA) Gold Level Veteran-Friendly Employer For more information about our department, we invite you to visit us on Facebook , Twitter and YouTube . Required Education And Experience Education for Departmental Analyst 9-12 Possession of a bachelor's degree in any major. Experience For Departmental Analyst 9-12 Departmental Analyst 9 No specific type or amount is required. Departmental Analyst 10 One year of professional experience. Departmental Analyst P11 Two years of professional experience, including one year of experience equivalent to the intermediate (10) level in state service. Departmental Analyst 12 Three years of professional experience, including one year of experience equivalent to the experienced (P11) level in state service. Education and Experience for Departmental Analyst (Departmental Trainee) 9 (FOR CLASSIFIED STATE EMPLOYEES ONLY) Education Educational level typically acquired through completion of high school. Experience Four years of experience as an advanced 9-level worker in an ECP Group One classification. OR Three years of experience as an E9, E10, or E11-level worker in an ECP Group One classification. OR Two years of experience as an experienced level worker in an ECP Group One technician or paraprofessional classification. OR Two years of experience as a first-line supervisor in an ECP Group Three classification. OR One year of experience as a second-line supervisor in an ECP Group Three classification. Paraprofessional classifications are those requiring an associate's degree or two years of college. Educational Substitution College credits may be substituted on a proportional basis (one year of college education may substitute for one quarter of the required experience) for up to one half of the required experience. Alternate Education And Experience Departmental Analyst (Departmental Trainee 9) 9 - 12 Educational level typically acquired through completion of high school and the equivalent of at least two years of full-time active-duty experience at or above the E-6 level in the uniformed services may be substituted for the education requirement. Additional Requirements And Information View the job specification at: http://www.michigan.gov/documents/DepartmentalAnalyst_12505_7.pdf Michigan Public Service Commission is proud to be an equal employment workplace that values inclusion & diversity. In an effort to minimize implicit bias, the Michigan Public Service Commission is removing/protecting applicant personal identifying information. For best results include detailed education and experience in the online application for review. Do not put “see resume” instead of listing duties under your work experience.

It offers different types of health care coverage plans that include individual and family, dental and vision, plans for employers, etc. Title: PS-Data Analyst III Work Location: Southfield MI 48076 Duration: 5 Months Job Type: Contract Work Type: Onsite Dept: Business Analytics & Cl Engagement Description Leads in the research, analysis, identification, and evaluation of data from assigned problems to evaluate existing and potential trends and issues. Investigate, review, recommend, communicate, and implement solutions which identify problems/root cause of issues. Research, compile and analyze appropriate and relevant data and make recommendations for operational improvements. Independently develop and plan, reports, papers and/or other materials in a clear and concise manner. Excellent knowledge and use of existing software packages (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc.) and Data Visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI). Strong working knowledge of data languages such SQL, Python. Ability to work independently, within a team environment and communicate effectively with employees at all levels. Work closely with customers, vendors, business analysts and application development project teams to resolve information flow and content issues. They ensure data integrity and compliance by performing data cleansing and data validations. They provide data that is congruent, synchronized, and reliable and information that is readily accessible by the user. Additional responsibilities include the identification and resolution of information flow, content issues and the transformation of business requirements into logical data models. Education/ Experience Bachelor's degree related field preferred. 7 years of IT experience with at least 5 years in quality assurance and/or data management required. Expertise with data quality tools for data profiling, cleansing and standardization. May require experience in implementing solutions and processes for master data and hierarchy synchronizations. TekWissen® Group is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity.

Responsible for managing assigned standard and ad hoc projects within the prescribed best practice framework while working closely with stakeholders. Responsible for developing and presenting insights to the business. Responsible for maintaining all assigned routine reporting. Guide decision makers through creation of well-rounded actionable insights that will drive, sustainable growth; supports strategy implementation. Champion analytic insights with business teams and build excellent strong cross-functional relationships to drive the business integration of insights. Support the best practices within analytic insights through standardization of methods, tools, and knowledge-sharing to maximize group efficiency and impact; create a data-driven culture. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, draw conclusions and recommend concise solutions. Knowledge of analytical, quantitative & statistical approaches to derive insights from large, data sets, solving complex, ambiguous business problems using business acumen. Hands-on experience with reporting, data discovery and visualization tools such as MicroStrategy, MS Power BI, Cognos, Tableau or similar. Statistical software such as R or SAS, scripting languages such as Python and SQL preferred.
