title: Senior Financial Analyst
description: Build a Bigger, Better, Bolder Future Imagine working for a company that measures its success based off the growth of its colleagues, a company that invests in its future by investing in you. Little Caesars is a company where our colleagues make an impact. Your Mission: In this role, you will ensure advanced financial and business analysis support primarily to Little Caesars Fundraising (LCF) with supplemental responsibilities supporting corporate financial planning and analysis. You will work assignments which are of the greatest difficulty and largest financial impact. Assists with managing and completing reporting processes. You may supervise more junior staff and provide guidance as necessary. How You’ll Make an Impact: Prepare forecasts and pro-forma analysis of various business initiatives to guide the operations of the company. Assist with managing and completing the sales and other business key performance indicators reporting process. Analyzes data, prepares, and communicates analytical reports which may include diverse topics such as LCF sales performance, profitability, return on investment, and other general business and financial performance information. Projects vary widely in scope, but typical projects include analysis of LCF products, operational initiatives, supply chain initiatives, price point analysis, and other general business issues. Act as a subject matter expert in critical financial systems that support and enhance effective LCF operations. Participate in the cross-functional meetings across LCF and Little Caesars, acting as a representative of the finance department. Consult with non-financial business partners, providing sound financial advice and support as requested. Collaborate with the Data Warehouse (Information Technology) team to ensure that the structure and functionality of the electronic data warehouse supports the organizations analysis needs (future state). Manage and further refine operational and financial dashboards to highlight Little Caesars Fundraising against budget and forecasts. Facilitate the flow of information to key stakeholders. Assist leadership, including CFO, VP of FP&S, and LCF Director with the preparation of various presentations. Provide data and analysis to other departments to support their business conference presentations. This position also serves as a liaison in aligning and supporting overlapping strategic priorities across LCF and Little Caesars. May be the direct supervisor of more junior analysts, clerks, coordinators, etc. Train and mentor the junior analysts. Who You Are: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Statistics, Business or a related degree. Additional experience may be considered in lieu of a degree. High aptitude for advanced data analysis. Minimum of five (5) years of experience in a role requiring in-depth experience with analytical tools, techniques, and financial reporting systems. Able to operate at a high-level of critical thinking and problem solving while working cross-functionally with other teams. Demonstrated ability to make decisions based on sound business acumen and decision-making practices. Previous experience with development and maintenance of financial and management reporting systems. Proficient in use of personal computers and accessing information in a network environment. Thorough familiarity, at an advanced level, with the use of Microsoft Excel and Power Point. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Including the ability to interact directly, sometimes with little or no oversight, with franchisees, cross-functional business partners, and management/leadership. Must be adept at preparing and delivering written communications, verbal communications, and formal presentations. Masters in Business Administration or equivalent degree is preferred. Where You’ll Work: A state-of-the-art building with a modern-day, open environment in the heart of The District Detroit. A colleague fitness center, work café and an outdoor patio with grills. Over 60 different meeting spaces to help promote a collaborative environment.
summary: This role involves advanced financial and business analysis primarily supporting Little Caesars Fundraising (LCF) with supplemental responsibilities supporting corporate financial planning and analysis. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background with experience in financial reporting systems and possess excellent communication skills to interact with stakeholders.

title: Reimbursement Analyst
description: Job Summary Gathers and analyzes financial information in accordance with the provider's negotiated contract to determine correct configuration of the claims payment system(s). Knowledge of facility and physician reimbursement methods will be combined with data analysis and business decision-making abilities to determine correct configuration. Analyst will take the lead, and serve as a liaison on problem resolution for internal and external customers. Essential Functions Highly skilled in provider and pricing set-up. Articulates Priority Health's payment models and standard reimbursement methods for all providers and products. Research issues related to problems arising from provider or pricing set up and/or procedures. Determine root cause and take necessary action to resolve. Ensure effective communication of resolution to appropriate leadership. Facilitate the timely and accurate contract implementation by completing necessary paperwork for new fee schedules, PFP groups, risk pools, PHO extensions, etc., as well as working with operational areas for non-standard contractual commitments. Ensure necessary approvals are documented to facilitate execution of standard and non-standard contract templates. Develop Priority Health's fee schedule models and standards. Research issues related to problems arising from fee schedule set up and/or procedures. Determine root cause and take necessary action to resolve. Ensure effective communication of resolution to appropriate leadership. Apply strong analytical skills and business knowledge to the investigation, analysis and recommendation of creative solutions to problems. Communicates, collaborates and acts as a consultant to internal and external customers in order to resolve medium level complexity provider issues. Performs routine audits to identify trends and factors contributing to performance of contracts. Maintain process related documentation as necessary to support results of audit, with effective communication and information exchange with internal and external customers. Monitors, develops, and improves job procedures to ensure maximum effectiveness in process and resource time spent on job tasks. Monitor government program websites for timely updates as it relates to medical billing changes, pricing changes which may include ensuring fees are loaded into appropriate fee schedules according to established procedures, etc. How Corewell Health Cares For You Comprehensive benefits package to meet your financial, health, and work/life balance goals. Learn more here. On-demand pay program powered by Payactiv Discounts directory with deals on the things that matter to you, like restaurants, phone plans, spas, and more! Optional identity theft protection, home and auto insurance, pet insurance Traditional and Roth retirement options with service contribution and match savings Qualifications Required Associate's Degree Emphasis in health care, business management (or equivalent combination of education and experience). 3 years of relevant experience Knowledge of FACETS and OnBase 3 years of relevant experience Knowledge of provider reimbursement methods and concepts (Medicare, Medicaid, Commercial) and industry standard pricing guidelines 3 years of relevant experience Experience in Microsoft applications including Word, PowerPoint, Excel Preferred 1 year of relevant experience Knowledge of UB92 or 1500 billing SQL experience EPIC or Claims experience About Corewell Health As a team member at Corewell Health, you will play an essential role in delivering personalized health care to our patients, members and our communities. We are committed to cultivating and investing in YOU. Our top-notch teams are comprised of collaborators, leaders and innovators that continue to build on one shared mission statement - to improve health, instill humanity and inspire hope. Join a nationally recognized health system with an ambitious vision of continued advancement and excellence. Primary Location SITE - Priority Health - 1239 E Beltline - Grand Rapids Department Name PH - Provider Reimbursement Employment Type Full time Shift Day (United States of America) Weekly Scheduled Hours 40 Hours of Work 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Days Worked Monday to Friday Weekend Frequency N/A CURRENT COREWELL HEALTH TEAM MEMBERS – Please apply through Find Jobs from your Workday team member account. This career site is for Non-Corewell Health team members only. Corewell Health is committed to providing a safe environment for our team members, patients, visitors, and community. Corewell Health grants equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, religion, genetic information, marital status, height, weight, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other legally protected category. summary: This role analyzes financial information to determine accurate claim payment system configurations, focusing on provider and pricing set-up. title: IT Security Analyst 3
description: Short Job Description The Security Analyst position works as a member of the Vulnerability Management Team. The Senior Security Analyst position reviews and remediates cyber incidents and vulnerabilities found by IT level analysts to IT security specialists and managers to maintain the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of State of Michigan data. Long Job Description Technical Security Analyst performing duties related to the Vulnerability Management team. Plans, schedules, implements, and maintains scalable vulnerability scans using modern vulnerability management scanning tools for high complexity devices. While ensuring safe and timely scanning that has minimal/no impact on scan targets, provides troubleshooting of technical issues with scans. Supports vulnerability management scanning and reporting tools. Conducts internal vulnerability audits of servers, network devices, applications, and other devices. Interfaces with internal and external auditors, providing detailed information on remediation efforts. Creates integrations of vulnerability management data with other State of Michigan enterprise services. Conducts data analysis of vulnerability management data, often integrated with other data sources, to measure effectiveness of vulnerability remediation. Data analysis tasks includes large datasets, which include structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data. Interfaces with other agencies to make recommendations on how to improve the security posture and reduce the number of security related vulnerabilities. Conducts trend analysis, creates dashboards using data scripting to provide metrics on the performance of security responsibilities, controls, and creates new reports for management based on those collected metrics across multiple agencies. Escalates as appropriate.
summary: The Security Analyst role involves vulnerability management, incident response, and data analysis to ensure the security of Michigan state data.

title: Sr. Data Engineer
description: Position Title Sr. Data Engineer Location Headquarters-Troy, MI Job Summary Responsible for the design, development, and execution of automated and manual data Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL), integration, and exchange processes across the enterprise. Will recommend, implement, develop and utilize innovative tools and processes to efficiently, rapidly, and securely acquire, integrate, and provision large sets of data from and to thousands of sources. Responsible for the efficient, compliant, timely, and secure acquisition, integration, provision, and exchange of the enterprise data. Job Responsibilities: Provide data integration architecture leadership across the enterprise. Develop and document technical best practices for ETL-related activities including data movement, data aggregation, data quality, and data cleansing. Work with the Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence team to design, implement, and support end-to-end data solutions across multiple platforms, environments, domains, and locations. Work with external vendors and internal business and technology staff to accurately gather and interpret requirements, specifications, and database models to determine appropriate ETL development solutions. Create, execute, and document unit test plans for ETL and data integration processes and programs. Document ETL processes, programs and solutions as per established standards. Monitor and administer automated and manual data integration and ETL jobs to verify execution and measure performance. Work with internal staff, vendors, consultants, and external partners to quickly identify and resolve data integration and ETL job issues. Assess and document the structure, quality, and compliance of data source data and coordinate with business and technology staff to identify and resolve issues. Mentor other Data Management team members in the ETL tools, programs, processes, and best practices. Ensures compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations. Completes all required compliance training. Maintains knowledge of and adhere to Flagstar’s internal compliance policies and procedures. Takes responsibility to keep up to date with changing regulations and policies. Job Requirements : Bachelor's in Computer Science, Mathematics or related field + 7 years of development experience preferred, or 10 years comparable work experience required. 7 year’s experience designing, developing, testing, and implementing Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) solutions using enterprise ETL tools or 10 years of comparable work experience reuired. 6 year’s experience developing and implementing data integration and data warehouse solutions in an Oracle 11g/12c database environment 2 year’s experience working with Business Intelligence tools (IBM Cognos is preferred) 2 year’s experience working in a Service- Oriented Architecture (SOA) environment 1 year experience in 10+ TB data environment. Expertise in Relational Database Management System, Data Mart and Data Warehouse design. Expert-level SQL and PL/SQL development skills in a multi-tier environment. Expertise in flat file formats, XML within PL/SQL, and file format conversion. Strong understanding of SDLC and Agile Methodologies. Strong understanding of model driven development. Strong understanding of ETL best practices. Proven strength in interpreting customer business needs and translating them into application and operational requirements. Strong problem-solving skills and analytic skills with proven strength in applying root cause analysis. Expertise and hands-on experience in designing and building technical solutions using best practices and applicable technologies; an ability to demonstrate strong coding skills Expertise in working with technical and business teams to extract and document data integration/exchange requirements. Ability to exhibit a strong understanding of business process. Ability to communicate verbally and in technical writing to all levels of the organization in a proactive, contextually appropriate manner. Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills at all levels Dedicated to excellence in one’s work; strong organizational skills; detail-oriented and thorough. Able to prioritize work by dividing time, attention and effort between current project workload and on-going support tasks Must be willing to work overtime, including weekends, when required.
summary: Sr. Data Engineer responsible for designing, developing, and executing ETL processes across the enterprise. Focuses on acquiring, integrating, and provisioning large datasets from various sources, ensuring efficiency, security, and compliance. Works with internal teams and external vendors to gather requirements, develop solutions, and document processes. Performs unit testing, monitors job execution, and troubleshoots issues. Mentors other Data Management team members and ensures compliance with regulations.

title: Sr Bus Intelligence Analyst
description: Job Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst Department / Company: Insight, Analytics, and Data Governance / Amway Salary Range: $91,429-$118,320 per year plus an annual bonus Location: Ada, MI (Hybrid in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays) What We’re Looking For: We are looking for an experienced Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst to find insights into our data. You will work on a broad variety of projects with a focus on Sales oriented initiatives (Account Management, Incentives, Business migration and growth). Projects may include, but are not limited to, analysis of top leader organizations, measurement impact of incentive programs, scenario modeling for annual incentive planning, leader segmentation for account management, and scorecards to support account manager digital tools. These high-profile projects will help inform the decisions that drive the company toward our goal of utilizing insights and analytics to align Amway and ABO goals, and help ABOs achieve profitable and sustainable growth. You will have the opportunity to develop relationships with leaders in several markets and the enterprise in general. You will help share best practices across markets as you analyze and identify effective programs and analytical methodologies. Required qualifications: BS degree in Mathematics, Analytical Sciences, Statistics, Business, Computer Science or a related field Minimum 6 years’ experience in a role requiring understanding of data and interpretation of trends Proven ability to utilize relational databases and data warehousing technologies Experience working with SQL and Tableau. Experience with Python, R, or Alteryx would be a plus. Quantitative analysis skills, with the ability to research and synthesize information into meaningful interpretations Skills to be successful in the role: Ability to define, develop and track key performance measures An understanding of Amway’s sales and marketing plan is a big plus Experience delivering insights for clients, reporting messages in clear ways What’s special about this team: This team is responsible for providing big data and advanced analytics to the Amway organization. This collaborative team partners across the organization with Sales, Finance, Marketing, and the Supply Chain organizations, both at Headquarters and affiliates across the globe, to analyze and provide insights that influence key decisions. In this role, you will focus your work on improving Distributor and Customer experiences across the organization. If you enjoy working together with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven insights directly to leaders, that can directly influence company-wide strategies in a meaningful way – this will be a role you will enjoy. Additionally, it will provide an opportunity to learn new tools and techniques for data analysis within a team of high-performing analysts. This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship.
summary: Amway seeks an experienced Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to analyze sales data, develop insights, and drive profitable growth. This role involves working on projects related to account management, incentives, business migration, and leader segmentation, with a focus on utilizing data to align Amway and ABO goals. The ideal candidate possesses strong analytical skills, experience with SQL and Tableau, and a deep understanding of data warehousing. They should also be comfortable working with cross-functional teams and delivering actionable insights.

Assist with RF device, printer and other device configuration and support, as needed. Assist client team members through all phases of the implementation. Assist project team to manage client expectations to accomplish project success. Meet with customers and Longbow team members to consult, configure, implement and support client requirements. Develop and execute test plans and test environments, to validate functionality against design requirements, and manage customer acceptance testing as appropriate based on the WMS Solution being deployed Document testing results and reports bugs, fixes or changes required to Systems Analyst Accurately capture and report on JIRA to ensure customers are properly invoiced for delivered services Assist in the development of enhancement specifications for custom development. Assist in functional end user training. Provide go-live operations support. Experience in an operational setting or relevant discipline. Strong knowledge of SQL Server, Oracle, and other Database Technologies Experience in documenting process flows and operational procedures. Operating systems – Windows and UNIX. XML/HTML, MOCA, Python/Perl, Visual Studio/Visual basic Strong knowledge and work experience with C/C++, C# and Java programming languages Ability to work independently as well as a part of a team. Excellent problem-solving skills. Valid driver’s license. Able & willing to travel. Why Join Longbow? Supportive work environment Work/life balance Competitive Salary 4-weeks of paid vacation 6 paid sick days, 2 paid personal days per year Excellent health and dental benefits, eligible as of your first day! Group RRSP/401k Matching Work from Home Longbow Advantage is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are not able to assist with relocation or work permit applications for this role. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst Lead - Hybrid
description: This is a hybrid role that requires some days on-site in Ann Arbor. Position Description The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst Lead works on a fast-paced, innovative team in the Business Intelligence Department to enable the use of actionable data by IHA business units. This is a highly versatile role at the intersection of people and technology, requiring the ability to explain and translate business requirements into technical specifications. BI Analysts collaborate with all areas of IHA Medical Group including administrative departments, specialty divisions and executive leaders to understand goals to deliver vital information to support data-informed decision-making. The BI Analyst’s role in data projects includes gathering requirements, working with developers to integrate and transform data, working with customers to validate results, and creating powerful interactive visualizations in the form of dashboards, reports, and presentations. The BI Analyst contributes to the process of modeling, building, validating and documenting enterprise data. Uses statistics, machine learning and other data analysis techniques to provide relevant and useful data findings. Essential Job Functions Serves as lead to implement and support major organizational business intelligence initiatives. Creates and supports complex interactive visualizations, automated reports and ad hoc analyses using tools such as PowerBI, Azure Fabric, Tableau and SSRS. Creates and maintains self-service data marts for end-users using SSAS Tabular model and assesses overall improvements and best practices for a superior user experience, focusing on decreasing technical burden on patient-facing staff, and executive leadership. Evaluates emerging technologies to determine how new capabilities can assist the organization in supporting organizational initiatives. Helps team advance on plans for use of artificial intelligence, including Natural Language Processing, ChatGPT, predictive analytics, and leveraging machine learning to find hidden insights in data. Provides essential and timely information to executive leadership and presents often to all levels at IHA. Clearly describes report specifications and maintains a catalog of easy-to-understand data definitions. Mentors teammates to learn new skills by delegating and supervising work. Proactively seeks feedback on self and team while striving to deliver solutions that exceed customer expectations. Leads efforts to transform the organization into a data-driven organization. Enables self-service analytics through implementation of tools and training of non-technical staff on use of data and reports. Ensures data structure allows full self-service analytics while minimizing accidental misuse of data. Develops and maintains role-based security of data access through self-service analytic tools to comply with data security standards. Answers analytic questions to support data-driven decision making using multiple data sources including clinical, financial, payer claims, benchmarking and other healthcare data. Creates reporting and presentations using data that can easily be interpreted by non-technical staff. Engages with organizational leadership, staff and providers to translate project data needs into BI/DW requirements, serving as both a functional and technical expert and making recommendations about data delivery methods. Design and monitor end-user reporting tools and systems, ensuring reports are accurate and up-to-date. Develops processes to automate data testing to ensure data quality. Supervises interns or temporary staff as needed. Essential Qualifications EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience. Preferred field of study in data science, computer science, healthcare administration, public health, or finance. Master’s degree preferred. CREDENTIALS/LICENSURE: N/A MINIMUM EXPERIENCE: 5+ years’ data analysis experience required; healthcare and/or financial analytics experience preferred. Position Requirements (abilities & Skills) Analytic skills and experience in presenting complex analyses to organizational leadership to drive decision making. Demonstrated expert level SQL coding skills to query and join complex data sets. Strong understanding of and ability to utilize stored procedures and SSIS packages. Experience with one or more aspects of artificial intelligence such as: advanced analytics, machine learning, predictive analytics, natural language processing, chatgpt, or augmented analytics tools. Expert level knowledge of relational or dimensional databases as used in SSAS Tabular models, Power BI data models, or equivalent market products. Understands data governance principles, master data management, role-based security, and data quality principles. Experience successfully implementing Microsoft SQL Server Data Quality Services and/or Master Data Services (or similar software) is desirable. Experience designing, developing and maintaining SQL Server tabular models to support cross-functional business reporting objectives and enable self-service analytics. Ability to serve as project lead to implement and provide solutions support to major organizational business intelligence initiatives by understanding high-level functional and technical requirements, managing development, and setting and meeting deadlines. Proficient in operating a standard desktop and Windows-based computer system, including but not limited to, information systems software, Microsoft Word and Excel (expert-level), data analytic and reporting tools, including query tools (SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Developer, Access, etc.), and interactive business intelligence products (Tableau, Power BI), intranet and computer navigation. Ability to use other software as required while performing the essential functions of the job. Excellent communication skills in both written and verbal forms. Ability to speak before groups of people, either in-person or virtually, and apply consultative skills to work effectively within assigned areas of the organization. Broad knowledge of healthcare industry, including ability to cross-walk clinical, operational, financial, claims and quality data from EHR/EMR and general ledger systems. Broad knowledge of standard medical codesets (ICD, CPT), performance measurement (quality, cost and utilization metrics), financial and billing data. Familiarity with front-end workflows and reporting from multiple Electronic Medical Record (EMR) systems, such as Epic, NextGen and Athena. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment. Ability to work effectively with various levels of organizational members and diverse populations including IHA Divisional leadership, staff, providers, patients, vendors, outside customers, hospitals and community groups. Good organizational and time management skills to effectively juggle multiple priorities and meet deadlines. Demonstrated ability to exercise sound judgement, trouble-shooting and problem-solving skills, i.e., reporting error and identifying solutions to correct issues. Ability to handle patient and organizational information in a confidential manner. Ability to drive to other office/practice sites and meeting and training locations. Successful completion of IHA competency-based program within introductory and training period.
summary: The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst Lead at IHA Medical Group is responsible for leading and supporting major business intelligence initiatives, creating and maintaining interactive visualizations and reports, and implementing self-service analytics. They will also leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning to find hidden insights in data.
hard_skills: Microsoft SQL Server Data Quality Services

title: Sr Data Engineer
description: As a family company, we serve people and communities. When you work at Meijer, you’re provided with career and community opportunities centered around leadership, personal growth and development. Consider joining our family – take care of your career and your community! Meijer Rewards Weekly pay Scheduling flexibility Paid parental leave Paid education assistance Team member discount Development programs for advancement and career growth Please review the job profile below and apply today! This position designs, develops, tests, maintains and enhances business applications as a member of an Agile development team, and works with the entire team to ensure development conforms to acceptance criteria. This position drives engagement with vendors, company customers, IT colleagues and other stakeholders to understand customer requirements and system interfaces, assess available technologies/vendor packages, and present solutions. This position will work with business product owners, developers, and quality analysts to drive value delivery and will participate in all phases of Agile software development. What You'll Be Doing (Responsibilities) Designs, codes, tests, and implements data movement, dashboarding and analytical assets; develops system documentation according to SAFe Agile principles and industry standards. Evaluates architectural options and defines overall architecture of enterprise Data Lake and Data Warehouse. Partnering with all areas of the business to gather requirements for Data and Analytics and designing solutions. Defines functional and non-functional requirements including performance monitoring, alerting and code management and ensuring alignment with technology best practices and SLAs. Determines major elements and subsystems and defines interfaces as well as architectural runway. Providing subject matter expertise and technical consulting support on either vendor or internal applications and interfaces including Azure - Data Factory, Log Analytics, Databricks, Synapse, Power BI, ADLS Gen2, Polybase and Machine Learning/AI. Mentoring and coaching other members of the agile and\or Run team. Driving engagement with ITS Security and Infrastructure teams to ensure secure development and deployment of solutions. Interfaces with the Product Manager and IT partners at the Program level and within other Release Trains to define and estimate features for agile teams. Conducting industry research, facilitates new product and vendor evaluations, and assists in vendor selection. What You Bring With You (Qualifications) Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Business Information Systems, Engineering or related discipline or equivalent work experience and technical training is required. 8+ years industry experience (business application design, development, implementation, and/or solution architecture) Understanding of architecture practices and execution for large projects / programs. Excellent written and oral communications skills. Previous experience in Power BI, Data Modeling, Data Classification and zones, data movement, Data architecture and reporting Experience building and designing data and analytics on enterprise solutions such as Azure - Data Factory, Log Analytics, Databricks, Synapse, Power BI, ADLS Gen2, Polybase and Machine Learning/AI. Databricks experience is required. In-depth understanding of computer, storage, network components including backup, monitoring and DR environment requirements Experience designing data pipelines, ingestion, storage, prep-train, model and serve using above technologies, Automating Azure Workloads, Data quality, Governance/standards, Security and legal compliance in the Azure architecture Preferred knowledge and experience on Python and API architecture in Azure Any SAFe certification or training. Experience with multiple, diverse technical configurations, technologies, and processing environments. Exceptional interpersonal skills, including teamwork, facilitation, and negotiation.
summary: Meijer is seeking a Data Architect to design, develop, test, maintain, and enhance business applications as part of an Agile development team. The ideal candidate will have experience in data movement, dashboarding, and analytical assets, as well as a strong understanding of Azure cloud technologies.

title: Departmental Analyst 12 - Administrative Assistant -Wayne - Child Welfare
description: Job Description The MDHHS mission is to provide opportunities, services, and programs that promote a healthy, safe, and stable environment for residents to be self-sufficient. We are committed to ensuring a diverse workforce and a work environment whereby all employees are treated with dignity, respect and fairness. For more information, please visit our MDHHS Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Plan . Position serves as the South Central Administrative Assistant, to the District Manager assisting in aligning, directing, implementing, and monitoring Michigan's Child Welfare reform activities in the local Child Welfare office. This position will be assisting the District Manager in the areas of child welfare, as well as provide assistance in the alignment of child welfare programs and their policies to improve client services, program outcomes, and quality, to achieve the child welfare improvement goals. The South Central Administrative Analyst will assist in the review of data and quality assurance reports in conjunction with federal requirements, as well as requirements of the Modified Settlement Agreement (MSA) that will be coordinated with internal and external stakeholders. This position also functions as the Data Analyst for the Child & Family Services South Central District office reporting to the District Manager. The South Central Administrative Analyst works congruently with the management team representing the district at administration, county, and community meetings and events. The primary objective of this position is to assist and advise the management team of the district's staffing and client needs through research and analysis by identifying barriers, providing strategies, making recommendations, and monitoring the results of the recommendations. This data reporting impacts management's decisions, initiatives, and planning. The South Central Administrative Analyst is responsible for developing and monitoring district-wide projects and corrective actions plans, providing strategic and operational planning, and performing cost analysis. These decisions have district, administration, and county-wide effects. This South Central Administrative Analyst acts as the liaison to the community and is responsible for the assessment and coordination of targeted training. Position Description Job Specification To Be Considered For This Position You Must apply for this position online via NEOGOV; click on "Apply" in the job posting for instructions on submitting your electronic application. Hard copy applications are not accepted. relevant experience and/or education referred to in supplemental questions must be documented in resume, transcript and/or application to allow for accurate screening. attach a resume identifying specific experience and dates of employment. Dates of employment should include month and year and hours per week. attach a cover letter. if applicable, attach a copy of an official transcript(s). We accept scanned copies of official transcripts. We do not accept web-based, internet, or copies of unofficial transcripts. Official transcripts provide the name of the institution, confirmation that a degree was awarded and on what date, and the registrar's signature. Failure to complete any of the above items may result in your application not being considered. See instructions for attaching files here: Instructions Required Education And Experience Education Possession of a bachelor's degree in any major. Experience Three years of professional experience, including one year of experience equivalent to the experienced (P11) level in state service. Prefer Local office experience in child welfare services. Prefer four years experience in a combination of service worker/supervisor, training consultant or children’s services program specialist. Selective Position Requirement: Possession of at least four years of child welfare experience, in Children's Protective Services, Foster Care, Adoptions and/or Licensing, gained within the last six years, including at least two and a half years of child welfare experience gained within the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services. Additional Requirements And Information IF YOU ALREADY APPLIED FOR THIS POSITION YOU DO NOT HAVE TO REAPPLY* This position is open to current Michigan Department of Health and Human Services (MDHHS) employees and MDHHS employees in lay-off status only. Y our application for any position does not guarantee you will be contacted by the Department/Agency for further consideration. Only those applicants interviewed will be notified of the results. Position Location/Remote Office: The physical location of this position is 1801 E. Canfield Detroit, MI 48207 . Based on operational needs and within established limits, remote work and alternate or hybrid work schedule requests for this position may be considered. Selected candidates who have been approved to work remotely or a hybrid schedule must complete that work within Michigan. Candidates should confirm work location and schedule at the time of interview. Responsibilities Employees will be provided computers to perform state work. Phones may also be provided for necessary communications. If working remotely, employees will be responsible for providing other components of a remote office at their own expense, including: A secure work location that allows privacy and prevents distractions. A high-speed internet connection of at least 25 Mbps download and 5 Mbps upload. Suitable lighting, furniture, and utilities. If you previously held status in this classification and departed within the last three (3) years, please contact Human Resources regarding your interest in a potential reinstatement. Reinstatement is not guaranteed or required. The use of artificial intelligence (AI) software of any kind is prohibited in all areas of the selection process; including, but not limited to, responses to application questions, and responses to interview questions or exercises. As a Condition of Employment: this position requires successful completion of a background investigation and a criminal records check. The Department of Health & Human Services reserves the right to close this posting prior to its original end date once a sufficient number of applications have been received. For information about this specific position, please email Shanitra Fluellen at FluellenS@michigan.gov . Follow us on LinkedIn for more job opportunities! MDHHSJobs #MDHHSjobs #Veteranfriendly #Careerswithpurpose # CommunityHeroes
summary: The South Central Administrative Analyst position at the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services (MDHHS) supports child welfare reform activities in the local Child Welfare office. The role involves data analysis, program alignment, strategic planning, and community liaison responsibilities. The analyst assists the District Manager in improving client services and program outcomes, ensuring compliance with federal and MSA requirements.

title: Security Analyst 3 - Vulnerability Management Team
description: For over 15 years, Trilyon has been at the forefront of providing comprehensive global workforce solutions and staffing services. Leveraging our extensive expertise across multiple domains such as Cloud technology, Salesforce, AI, Machine Learning, and Technical Writing, we consistently exceed expectations in catering to a wide range of requirements. Currently we are seeking a “ Security Analyst 3 - Vulnerability Management Team ” for one of our clients that is a leading multination corporation. Job Title: Security Analyst 3 - Vulnerability Management Team Location: Dimondale, MI (Hybird - need to be onsite 2 days a week) Duration: 12 months contract with possible extension Short Job Description IT Security Analyst 3 - Job Description The Security Analyst position works as a member of the Vulnerability Management Team. The Senior Security Analyst position reviews and remediates cyber incidents and vulnerabilities found by IT level analysts to IT security specialists and managers to maintain the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of client data. Long Job Description Technical Security Analyst performing duties related to the Vulnerability Management team. Plans, schedules, implements, and maintains scalable vulnerability scans using modern vulnerability management scanning tools for high complexity devices. While ensuring safe and timely scanning that has minimal/no impact on scan targets, provides troubleshooting of technical issues with scans. Supports vulnerability management scanning and reporting tools. Conducts internal vulnerability audits of servers, network devices, applications, and Other Devices. Interfaces with internal and external auditors, providing detailed information on remediation efforts. Creates integrations of vulnerability management data with other client enterprise services. Conducts data analysis of vulnerability management data, often integrated with other data sources, to measure effectiveness of vulnerability remediation. Data analysis tasks includes large datasets, which include structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data. Interfaces with other agencies to make recommendations on how to improve the security posture and reduce the number of security related vulnerabilities. Conducts trend analysis, creates dashboards using data scripting to provide metrics on the performance of security responsibilities, controls, and creates new reports for management based on those collected metrics across multiple agencies. Escalates as appropriate. Equal Employment Opportunity Trilyon is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to fairness and respect for all individuals. We value diversity in age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, religion, and sexual orientation, believing it drives innovation and better service. Employment decisions are made impartially, without regard to any protected characteristic under federal, state, or local law. Our diverse team drives innovation, competitiveness, and creativity, enhancing our ability to effectively serve our clients and communities. This commitment to diversity makes us stronger and more adaptable. Name: Vikranth Yadavalli Email: vikranth@trilyonservices.com Phone no: (408) 340-7846
summary: Security Analyst 3 role focused on Vulnerability Management, responsible for conducting scans, audits, remediation efforts, and data analysis for a leading multinational corporation. Requires strong technical skills, experience with vulnerability management tools, and a data-driven mindset.

title: Systems Engineer
description: OPmobility's Lighting division covers the entire lighting value chain, from components to complete headlamps, from traditional lighting to intelligent and high-performance products. The division develops interior and exterior solutions that enable greater design freedom, enhanced safety and driver assistance. Our ambition? Provide automakers with cutting-edge equipment and solutions to develop tomorrow’s clean and connected car. Responsibilities The Systems Engineer understands the needs of the automotive customers for our exterior lighting products and translates them into actionable requirements for the functional disciplines within the product development team - e.g. electrical, mechanical, software, optical, regulatory, reliability, validation, etc. The system engineer leads the requirements analysis and risk assessment (DFMEA) and confirms the final requirements are verified/validated, ensuring that the end product meets what the customer expected. Understand and document customer needs and requirements starting the quote phase and upon award of the program. Manage and negotiate customer requirements, change requests, and unwritten expectations through the project life through launch. Develop the system requirements based upon and traced to the customer requirements for mechanical, electrical, optical and software disciplines. Further develop the system requirements based on regulatory market requirements (F/CMVSS, ECE, CCC) and internal PO Lighting requirements (design guidelines, standard modules). Allocate each requirements to each affected discipline. Develop system architecture in an unambiguous, clear, and understandable way that electrical, mechanical, optical, software, regulatory and validation engineers know exactly what needs to be done to meet customer expectations. Leads and moderates cross functional technical workshops including requirements review both internally and with the customer. Develop, with the support of the customer and functional disciplines, the system level DFMEA for the product. Collaborate with functional teams to develop sub-system and component DFMEAs as needed. Identify potential critical and significant characteristics that must be document in the deign record and cascaded to manufacturing for the PFMEA. Document the requirements elicitation, allocation, analysis and traceability using DOOR NG or equivalent requirement management system. Create and maintain project documentation, such as: System requirements specification System architecture definition tailored to the specific project System test plan Other documents, as needed Collaborate with validation and test engineers to develop test procedures, analysis or test tools, execute functional and system testing Support validation test and manufacture of the project including the cascade of requirements to the manufacturing and quality teams responsible to develop in-line functional testers, EOL tester equipment or other product quality tools. Identify projects lessons learned and incorporate these lessons into baseline requirements, system architecture and DFMEA documents for use on future projects. Support creation of: Detailed discipline specific design descriptions Mechanical/Optical/Electrical and hardware/software interface specifications 8D reports Timing Plans Other documents, as needed Education Requirement(s) Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering / Software Engineering / Electrical Engineering / Computer Science or equivalent required. Master degree preferred. Experience Requirement(s) 4+ years’ experience with system engineering in the automotive industry in the areas of systems engineering, requirements analysis and/or DFMEA. Strong communication skills in visualization and verbal explanation. Strong personality in Systems Engineering techniques to proactively close knowledge gaps (structured interview, systems archeology, observation and elicitation) Willingness to engage with the development team on a regular basis to drive project progress. Willingness to work independently when needed Broad knowledge of automotive lighting products is desired: mechanical design, optical design, electronics hardware design and software integration, including knowledge of the associated vehicle architectures. Exposure to lighting regulations such as FMVSS, CMVSS, ECE and CCC. Experience in both product design and design validation. Experience in requirement management tools such as DOORS NG, Polarion or equivalent. Experience in performing system risk assessment techniques such AIAG and/or VDA FMEA and FTA. Experience with DFMEA software such as APIS IQ-RM or equivalent. Familiar with automotive Safety (ISO-26262) and Cyber Security (ISO-21434) norms Program Management / Project Management Skills High level of analytical ability where problems are unusual and difficult Recognizable empathy, with team spirit, and with high level of assertiveness. Additional Information Some travel maybe required; overtime expected including several evening meetings with global teams. Flexible working hours. As a responsible company, Plastic Omnium pays particular attention to diversity and equality within its teams and the Group commits to treat all job applications equally.
summary: Systems Engineer to lead the requirements analysis, risk assessment (DFMEA), and validation of exterior lighting products for the automotive industry. This role involves understanding customer needs, developing system requirements, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and ensuring product compliance with regulations.
hard_skills: DFMEA (Design Failure Mode and Effects Analysis)

title: Data Engineer – Web Analytics
description: Rocket Mortgage , backed by Rocket Companies® , means more opportunities for you to carve your own career path forward. From our desire to revolutionize the way people get mortgages to addressing challenges big or small with outside-the-box solutions, we’re not your typical employer. We’ll provide you with everything you need to make sure you’re successful here. Experience in modern front-end technologies like React, Angular Expertise in debugging and troubleshooting applications. title: Senior SAS Programmer
description: Role: Senior SAS Programmer Location: Okemos, MI Duration: Long term Rate: Market About Role We are looking for a Senior SAS Programmer to join our Data Insights Team. Will work to support several reporting platforms. Programmer will create Excel and PDF reports using Base SAS as described by business requirements documents and test system components as needed. Responsibilities Participates in requirements and design sessions, then develops and implements new system components or fixes to resolve system defects using business intelligence software and related tools. Reads and understands business requirements, seeks clarification to unclear requirements, follows standard change control and configuration management practices and conforms to departmental application development standards and systems life cycle. Incorporates source code reuse wherever possible. Sets up and executes component tests as well as tracks and documents system defects. Participates in software design and programming reviews. Recommends improvements to design and programming standards, procedures and guidelines. Perform other related assigned duties as necessary to complete the Primary Job Responsibilities as described above. Participates in 24-hour on-call rotation in support of the platform. Required Skills/Qualifications Bachelor's degree with coursework in computer science, information systems, engineering or related field and five years' related work experience in applications design and programming. Will accept any suitable combination of education, training, or experience. Position requires 5+ years of advanced knowledge of SAS programming and administration 3+years of relational database concepts and SQL Ability to analyze and resolve complex problems Self-Starter, ability to communicate equally with business and technical staff. summary: We are looking for a Senior SAS Programmer to join our Data Insights Team. You will be responsible for creating Excel and PDF reports using Base SAS as described by business requirements documents and testing system components as needed. You will participate in requirements and design sessions, develop and implement new system components or fixes to resolve system defects using business intelligence software and related tools. You will also read and understand business requirements, seek clarification to unclear requirements, follow standard change control and configuration management practices, and conform to departmental application development standards and systems life cycle. You will incorporate source code reuse wherever possible, set up and execute component tests as well as track and document system defects, participate in software design and programming reviews, and recommend improvements to design and programming standards, procedures, and guidelines. You will also perform other related assigned duties as necessary to complete the Primary Job Responsibilities as described above and participate in a 24-hour on-call rotation in support of the platform.

description: Location: Pontiac, MI Duration: Long Term Job Description **** Business Systems Analyst on projects across Infrastructure Services, including Networking, Server, Workstation Services, O365, VoIP Telecommunications and Service Center teams. title: Senior Data Engineer
description: Accenture Flex offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists. As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges. You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. Accenture Flex employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel. Key Responsibilities: Utilize strong SQL & Python skills to engineer sound data pipelines and conduct routine and ad hoc analysis to assess the performance of legacy products and the saliency of new features. Build reporting dashboards and visualizations to design, create and track campaign/program KPIs. Perform analyses on large data sets to understand drivers of operational efficiency. Manage end-to-end process of analytic tooling feature development, including request intake, requirements evaluation, cross-functional team alignment, feature execution, QA testing, and stakeholder communication. Consult with business analysts, technical data SMEs, and cross-functional partners to understand their reporting and data needs, serving as the point of contact for requests, inquiries, and actions. Interface with other data engineering, product, and data science teams to implement client needs and initiatives. Targeting 5 to 8 years of experience as a Data Engineer. Basic Qualifications: Minimum 3 years' experience with SQL Minimum 3 years' experience with Python Bachelor's degree. Preferred Qualifications: Any certifications in Data Engineering/Science field is a plus Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience.
