title: Business Analyst 5 || Lansing, MI Hybrid || 13 Years Experience Needed
description: Job ID: 131602 Job Title: Business Analyst 5 Location: Lansing, MI 48933 - Hybrid Duration: 1+ Years Contract Business Analyst 5, DTMB Agency Services Supporting EGLE DTMB Agency Services is in need of a senior Business Analyst 5 to provide excellent customer service supporting both project and work request needs for the Environment, Great Lakes and Energy (EGLE) Agency. This person will have the opportunity to work on a new IT solution for issuing, analyzing, and monitoring energy rebates. These IT solutions leverage current technologies and include working with EGLE subject matter experts, vendors, and the public. Key responsibilities include being the liaison between DTMB and the project stakeholders, as well as providing expert facilitation and elicitation and process modeling to help develop strategy and requirements for future enhancements and related work projects. In addition, as part of the overall support for EGLE, this person will be a critical member of the DTMB Agency Services Business Analyst team, participating in various related work requests for EGLE and contributing to the operational activities of the BA team. The ideal candidate will possess SOM DTMB process experience; strong facilitator experienced using facilitation for requirements elicitation/testing and system configuration. Customer service and being a champion to ease Agency compliance with DTMB policies and practices are key performance expectations for this person. They must be able to quickly gain a working understanding of applicable constraints and enablers and help EGLE navigate those for the success for their projects and work requests. A common day would include attendance in various standing meetings for each of the projects, as well as those that include the BA team – being able to confidently speak to current activities in each, listening to understand needs, and helping to provide input that assists in meeting the objectives of the respective meetings. In addition, related work will include ongoing analysis of original requirements/user stories in comparison to needs identified in discovery sessions and/or UAT cycles and helping to define potential changes, to include impact analysis. DTMB Agency Services and EGLE welcomes candidates that are self-directed, well organized, confident in their ability to build relationships, quick to come up to speed on new assignments, and able to be flexible and adaptable to changing needs and/or direction. Candidates must have a minimum of 12 years of general BA experience. At the discretion of the resource manager, this position may include remote work, but candidate should plan to be available to report to a Lansing, MI job location in accordance with State of Michigan return to office guidelines. Business Analyst Position General Description Facilitation of requirements elicitation meetings; experience with gap fit analysis and requirements refinement. Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Experienced with business process reengineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective. Familiar with industry standard (including Legacy, Core, and Emerging technologies), business process mapping, and reengineering. Prepares solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc. Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs. Prepare and document Functional and Technical Specifications for reporting and data warehouse work. Assist with business warehouse/intelligence support and enhancements. Develops RFPs. Assist in deployment and management of end-user reporting tools and platforms. Work with IT and business project teams to understand reporting and data warehousing requirements and propose solutions. Document and provide knowledge transfer to the rest of the Enterprise Reporting Team for all solutions Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Has knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field. Familiar with relational database concepts, and client-server concepts. Relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. Works under general supervision; typically reports to a project manager. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required. Specific Position Experience Required Minimum of 7 years conducting business process review and requirements elicitation and documentation to include process modeling Minimum of 5 years developing and/or managing user stories on Agile development project(s) Minimum of 2 years working directly with senior management in facilitating discussions to determine strategy, develop road maps and/or gain consensus to resolve opposing positions Minimum of 2 years supporting the development of or compliance to statement of work and/or other work agreements/contracts Minimum of 2 years working on projects developing/implementing IT solutions for public use Minimum of 1 year conducting analytics on program effectiveness Minimum of 1 year working on IT infrastructure projects Minimum of 1 year working with programs governed by state and/or federal regulations
summary: A Business Analyst 5 position supporting the Environment, Great Lakes and Energy (EGLE) agency. title: App Sys Anlst/Prgm Staff Spec
description: Summary The Department of Radiation Oncology seeks a talented and motivated individual to support our clinical efforts to design, implement, and maintain advanced software techniques and applications as part of the team-based workflow for the specification, planning, and delivery of response-driven, adaptive radiotherapy treatments. Mission Statement Michigan Medicine improves the health of patients, populations and communities through excellence in education, patient care, community service, research and technology development, and through leadership activities in Michigan, nationally and internationally. Our mission is guided by our Strategic Principles and has three critical components; patient care, education and research that together enhance our contribution to society. Why Join Michigan Medicine? Michigan Medicine is one of the largest health care complexes in the world and has been the site of many groundbreaking medical and technological advancements since the opening of the U-M Medical School in 1850. Michigan Medicine is comprised of over 30,000 employees and our vision is to attract, inspire, and develop outstanding people in medicine, sciences, and healthcare to become one of the world?s most distinguished academic health systems. In some way, great or small, every person here helps to advance this world-class institution. Work at Michigan Medicine and become a victor for the greater good. What Benefits can you Look Forward to? Excellent medical, dental and vision coverage effective on your very first day 2:1 Match on retirement savings Responsibilities* [60% Effort] Develop and maintain desktop and web-based applications and user interfaces to allow the safe and efficient processing of a range of numerical and image data involved in the team-based workflow for radiation therapy treatment planning and delivery. Support Michigan Medicine Radiation Oncology Department faculty and software development personnel in the design and implementation of software-based techniques for data processing, visualization and management related to planning and delivery of radiation therapy treatments. [30% Effort] Collaborate in the specification, design, development, and maintenance of advanced informatics tools as required to support UM Radiation Oncology clinical protocols. Develop and maintain workflow tools to automate data processing and communication. Develop dashboards and web pages to provide access to real-time clinical radiotherapy data. Develop interfaces to various commercial radiotherapy and enterprise-wide electronic health record systems. [10% Effort] Create and edit software requirements, design, and testing documentation. Create and edit user manuals, software installation manuals, and troubleshooting guides. Required Qualifications* This position requires a strong background and skills in all aspects of software engineering principles and end-to-end application development using modern design tools, with a minimum of 8 years of software engineering experience. The candidate must have extensive/real world experience developing client/server applications in C#.Net in Visual Studio. Extensive experience with desktop application development using various UI and database technologies is essential. Experience with WPF using C#. Must be able to work independently in developing relatively large applications from the beginning to end. Demonstrated experience developing web-based applications on the Windows platform. Demonstrated experience with test frameworks as part of the application development process. Understanding of good software design practices (e.g., unit testing, SOLID principles, clean code, refactoring). Ability to use version control, specifically GitLab for code management and integration with Visual Studio.net. Bachelor's degree in computer science or related discipline or equivalent combination of education and experience is necessary. Some progressively responsible programming experience is necessary. Desired Qualifications* The ideal candidate has a documented background in analysis, design, implementation, testing, and maintenance of clinical software applications in the field of radiotherapy, with experience developing treatment planning system tools and applications. Experience in data and image processing is preferred. The ideal candidate is skilled in usability, user interface and web design. The ideal candidate has a strong background in database design, database management, data mining, and data warehousing using Microsoft SQL and Oracle SQL is preferred. Knowledge of DICOM / DICOM standards / DICOM field mapping / 3D image systems is preferred. Desire and ability to learn new technologies and trends in software development practices. Desire and ability to learn evolving radiation oncology workflow technologies and processes. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Excellent interpersonal skills. Background Screening Michigan Medicine conducts background screening and pre-employment drug testing on job candidates upon acceptance of a contingent job offer and may use a third party administrator to conduct background screenings. Background screenings are performed in compliance with the Fair Credit Report Act. Pre-employment drug testing applies to all selected candidates, including new or additional faculty and staff appointments, as well as transfers from other U-M campuses. Application Deadline Job openings are posted for a minimum of seven calendar days. The review and selection process may begin as early as the eighth day after posting. This opening may be removed from posting boards and filled anytime after the minimum posting period has ended. U-M EEO/AA Statement The University of Michigan is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.

Strong understanding of data modeling and data visualization concepts (10+ years) Experience with SQL for data manipulation and extraction. Knowledge of Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) for creating calculations. Creating complex DAX calculations and measures to support data analysis. Familiarity with data warehouse concepts. Troubleshooting and resolving issues in Power BI reports. Strong technical writing skills. Strong Excel skills, including visual basic, Power Query, pivot tables, pivot charts, and advanced formulas.

Any and all experience may be gained concurrently. * Hybrid position requiring 3 days weekly of onsite work in Ann Arbor office * Position offered by Domino’s Pizza, Inc. Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Experience with trend analysis and creating dashboards using data scripting to provide metrics on the performance. Ability to work independently and efficiently. Full Job Description Attached - Repost of 131264. Please do not submit candidates previously reviewed by client on 131264. Will close submissions on: 7/10 at 10am EST. Full Job Description Attached IT Security Analyst 3 - Job Description Short Job Description The Security Analyst position works as a member of the Vulnerability Management Team. The Senior Security Analyst position reviews and remediates cyber incidents and vulnerabilities found by IT level analysts to IT security specialists and managers to maintain the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of State of Michigan data. Long Job Description Technical Security Analyst performing duties related to the Vulnerability Management team. Plans, schedules, implements, and maintains scalable vulnerability scans using modern vulnerability management scanning tools for high complexity devices. While ensuring safe and timely scanning that has minimal/no impact on scan targets, provides troubleshooting of technical issues with scans. Supports vulnerability management scanning and reporting tools. Conducts internal vulnerability audits of servers, network devices, applications, and other devices. Interfaces with internal and external auditors, providing detailed information on remediation efforts. Creates integrations of vulnerability management data with other State of Michigan enterprise services. Conducts data analysis of vulnerability management data, often integrated with other data sources, to measure effectiveness of vulnerability remediation. Data analysis tasks includes large datasets, which include structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data. Interfaces with other agencies to make recommendations on how to improve the security posture and reduce the number of security related vulnerabilities. Conducts trend analysis, creates dashboards using data scripting to provide metrics on the performance of security responsibilities, controls, and creates new reports for management based on those collected metrics across multiple agencies. Escalates as appropriate.
summary: The State of Michigan is seeking an experienced IT Security Analyst 3 to join their Vulnerability Management Team. title: Info Tech Programmer / Analyst P11 - ITPA 11
description: Job Description The Department of Technology, Management and Budget supports the business operations of state agencies through a variety of services, including building management and maintenance, information technology, centralized contracting and procurement, budget and financial management, space planning and leasing, construction management, motor vehicle fleet operations, and oversight of the state retirement systems. title: IBM Planning Analytics / Anaplan Specialist
description: IBM Planning Analytics/Anaplan Specialist Are you passionate about technology and interested in joining a community of collaborative colleagues who respectfully and courageously seek to challenge the status quo? If so, read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity with Deloitte's Information Technology Services (ITS). We are insatiably curious and life-long learners focused on technology and innovation. Recruiting for this role ends on July 31, 2024. Work you'll do Work with internal Technology Teams and Business users to support Government Forecasting Requirements. Understand and communicate clear knowledge of forecasting and government cost accounting. Work with custom application utilizing IBM Planning Analytics (PA) 2.0.9, SAP HANA, SQL, etc. Lead collaboration with business and technology teams to ensure alignment of business solution definition and technical architecture. Exercises judgment and makes decisions in complex situations; makes recommendations on complex issues regarding work within own technical function, project components and tasks. May make recommendations on new processes, tools and services; supports and contributes to development of new products, services or techniques. Lead requirements definitions, development sessions and design walk-through reviews with internal team and business stakeholders. Lead performance optimization activities in all applications. Design and manage a complex system testing environment. Confirm supportability of implementation plans. Execute complex build activities, integrate designs across multiple technologies and Responsible for defining and directing tasks of Specialists and development teams. Supports and troubleshoots production tickets for resolution and root cause analysis Offers technical guidance to deployment discussions and activities. Provide leadership with regular status updates and potential issues. Manage daily progress and status of deliverables on projects. Manage both internal teams and offshore vendor teams' project delivery, plans, and ensure proper staffing. Monitor compliance to standardized procedures and best practices and create new policies and processes as needed. Individuals will follow best practices and procedures as defined by their community of practice. The team Information Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte's success. ITS is the engine that helps to drive Deloitte, which serves many of the world's largest organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence. The ~2,200 professionals in ITS deliver services internally including: Cyber security Technology support Technology & Infrastructure Application development and management Relationship management group Strategy Deployment PMO Financials Communications Product Engineering Product Engineering is the internal software and applications development team responsible for delivering leading-edge technologies to Deloitte professionals. Their broad portfolio includes web and mobile productivity tools that empower our people to log expenses, enter timesheets, book travel and more, anywhere, anytime. Product Engineering enables our client service professionals through a comprehensive suite of applications across the business lines. In addition to application delivery, Product Engineering offers full-scale design services, a robust mobile portfolio, cutting-edge analytics, and innovative custom development. Qualifications Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree + 6 years of experience (or an advanced degree) in computer science, accounting, or related area Experience working with IBM Planning Analytics or Anaplan Experience with SQL, Multi-dimensional cube architecture and Data Analytics Experience in Financial Planning and Analysis tasks (Planning, Forecasting and Analysis) Awareness of architecture standards design and implementation (including strategy, user experience, performance, controls, stability, quality, innovation, and enterprise security requirements) Ability to travel 10%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve Limited immigration sponsorship may be available Preferred Qualifications: Forward Pricing Rate Proposal (FPRP) experience Experience supporting Federal Government forecast/planning business processes supporting Forward Pricing Rate Proposals and Direct Labor Bid Rate submissions to Defense Contract Audit Agency 1+ years leading technical teams Must have clear communications skills both oral and written ability to negotiate in a non-confrontational manner to deliver a clear, well-structured and concise argument to support your opinion, using facts, pro's/con's, business justifications and other persuasion methods. Must have ability to work in fast paced environment, balance priorities and juggle multiple tasks at once Must be able to work independently Must possess a strong desire and clear understanding for high customer satisfaction Must be flexible, have good energy, easy to work with and a team player Experience in Oracle stored procedure development Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent communication, presentation, influencing, and reasoning skills to earn support of business leaders, technology leaders, colleagues, and vendor representatives. Capable of building sustainable relationships with colleagues and key individuals. Creativity and ability to think outside-the-box while defining sound and practical solutions. The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $107,700 to $198,400. You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance. Information for applicants with a need for accommodation: https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/articles/join-deloitte-assistance-for-disabled-applicants.html #EA_ExpHire #EA_ITS_ExpHire

title: Systems Engineer
description: The selected candidate will focus on steering wheel electronics product development, designing and maintaining mechatronic systems integrating mechanical, electrical, and software engineering principles. What You’ll Do Analysis of customer requirement Own the product development of the steering wheel system Design and engineer electrical interfaces, HMI, capacitive interfaces, ergonomics, vehicle network communications and material compatibility in addition to other sub-system interfaces within the steering wheel system Support software and hardware development teams to ensure ECU implementation meets customer requirements Participate and contribute to software code reviews and hardware design reviews. Ensure requirements from the customer are properly negotiated and cascaded into the Autoliv product development process and ASPICE base processes. Define interface requirements between various sub-systems of the steering wheel in collaboration with other engineering departments. What Is Required Bachelor’s degree in engineering, such as Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering, or Mechanical Engineering with a minimum of 10 years applicable experience. 3-5 year experience working with systems integrating electronics and mechanics (i.e. mechatronics or electro-mechanical systems) in a product development role (i.e., design engineer, test engineer) ASPICE SYS1 through SYS5 Automotive process (industry standard) Basic capability in programming or coding mandatory Intermediate to expert capability in MS Office especially Excel mandatory Intermediate to expert capability in decomposing customer requirements into system, sub-system, software and hardware requirements What’s In It For You Attractive compensation package Flexible Options (schedule, etc) Recognition awards, company events, family events, university discount options and many more perks. Gender Pay Equality Autoliv is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Autoliv does not discriminate in any aspect of employment based on race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identify and/or expression, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Autoliv does business.
summary: This role focuses on steering wheel electronics product development. It involves designing and maintaining mechatronic systems integrating mechanical, electrical, and software engineering principles. Key responsibilities include analyzing customer requirements, owning product development, designing electrical interfaces and HMI, and supporting software/hardware teams. The ideal candidate possesses a Bachelor's degree in engineering (Computer, Electrical, Systems, Mechatronics, or Mechanical) with 10+ years of relevant experience, including mechatronics system integration and ASPICE knowledge.

title: Junior Virtualization Engineer
description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance. We are seeking an exceptional early-career IT professional to join us as a VMware Engineer on our multi-tenant Hosting team. You'll become a virtualization expert helping to manage an environment of over 6,000 hosts and over 65,000 virtual machines. Spend less time performing point-and-click tasks and join a code-first, DevOps focused team that spends their time automating and orchestrating through the creation and enhancement of scripting programs. Apply your technical prowess and problem-solving skills to develop and maintain a robust, reliable, high-performance foundation for some of the largest healthcare organizations in the country to access our world-class software. Explore all open Hosting positions here. More than just important work . Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO. Bachelor's Degree in CIS, IS, IT, or a related field Relocation to Madison, WI (reimbursed) Eligibility to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship COVID-19 vaccination Preferred experience/interest in one of the following areas VMware vSphere Scripting and automation tools such as PowerCLI, GoLang, or Python VCP, VCAP, or VCDX certifications As a member of the Hosting team at Epic, you'll be responsible for the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of Epic Hosting. Those responsibilities include: Following policies and procedures and escalating when policies or procedures are not followed Escalating potential security incidents and providing relevant information Meeting all security responsibilities defined in policies and procedures
summary: Early-career IT professional needed as a VMware Engineer to manage an environment of over 6,000 hosts and 65,000 virtual machines. This is a code-first, DevOps focused role, working with scripting programs to automate and orchestrate the environment. The ideal candidate will have experience with VMware vSphere, scripting languages such as PowerCLI, GoLang, or Python, and VCP, VCAP, or VCDX certifications.

title: Network Administrator
description: Founded in 1963 by Don Fessler & George Bowman, Fessler & Bowman, Inc. has grown from a residential flatwork & basement wall contractor to a top 100 Commercial Concrete Contractor recognized across the nation. Keeping customer satisfaction as our fundamental core value has allowed Fessler & Bowman, Inc. to prosper for nearly six decades. Our Culture & Philosophy: Fessler & Bowman is a fast-paced and culture-focused industry leader in specialty concrete and civil earthwork. When we talk about culture at F&B, it is not just a plaque hanging in our lobby. Our values are our driving force and have allowed us to build a phenomenal team delivering best in class products to our customers. Open & Constructive Take Pride in Our Product Relentless Commitment Care About Our Customers Team Success Summary: The Network Administrator manages an organization's network infrastructure and is responsible for: installing, monitoring network activity, troubleshooting, and upgrading network infrastructure, including both hardware and software components. This role will also be responsible for all company-wide communication and rollout of related updates and/or new installations. The Data Analyst will assist in the training and coaching of new and current IT team members. The descriptions below are representative of, but not limited to, the duties and responsibilities for this position. Five Key Roles of the Network Administrator Administers system security policy, including firewalls (WatchGuard, SonicWall), switches (Cisco Meraki, Zyxel), IOT devices, Group Policy, VPN, Wi-Fi, file permissions, and active directory. Diagnosing enterprise hardware and software problems using diagnostic tools, research, and problem-solving techniques. Ensuring active directory, Azure, and Intune/Entra ID integrations uptime, consistency, and efficiency. Researches, evaluates, installs, configures, and troubleshoots all hardware, software, peripherals, and equipment related to company enterprise infrastructure and network monitoring tools. Ensuring data integrity, retention and cyber security for appropriate departments including Datto, Webroot, SentinelOne, Microsoft Defender Enterprise, OneDrive and KnowBe4. Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Power BI reporting, data visualization, and analysis. Stay up to date with industry specific trends and standards and make recommendations when necessary. Installing, configuring, and maintaining computer hardware components such as CPUs, RAM, hard drives, graphics cards, docking stations, and any related components. Manage working level maintenance and problem-solving for enterprise-wide solutions. Responsible for improvement ideas from users to incorporate them into business platform solutions. Support IT communication across the company for IT rollouts and incidents, lead these efforts when it relates to network and software applications. Lead efficient company-wide project rollouts for server, applications, and hardware. Solve escalated support calls/tickets from the support ticket system and get an initial response back to the team member within SLA time. Perform routine system maintenance and software updates. Manage backup consistency and reliability. Identifying and resolving basic network connectivity issues, including problems with LAN cables, switches, and routers, security, permissions, and access. Upholding network security using 802.1X protocols and applying them as needed. Communicating and upholding the Company’s commitment to Integrity and Code of Ethics. Other relevant tasks as assigned. Education, Experience & Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or relevant field. Minimum 5 years of experience within IT and specifically network administration. Office Enterprise, M365 Admin, Windows Server, Azure/Entra ID, Intune experience required. Experience working within a large organization with multiple locations is required. Experience in the construction industry is preferred. Up-to-date knowledge of the latest IT developments. Ability to explain highly technical concepts in simple terms and ability to teach others. Knowledge of best implementation, documentation, and maintenance practices. Good research, problem-solving, and analysis skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Travel: Travel is required to and from Fessler & Bowman office locations and is anticipated at 15%. Work Environment: As the Network Administrator, you will be subject to various work environments. These environments include office and field settings. Employees must be comfortable with sitting for an extended period. Benefits: Fessler & Bowman is proud to provide eligible Team Members with the following benefits: Medical, dental and vision insurance 401k with company contributions Paid Holidays and Paid Time Off Recruitment Process: The recruitment process will include a phone screen, in-person meeting, and a pre-employment background check and drug test. Fessler & Bowman is an Equal Opportunity Employer

This role also handles company-wide communication and rollout of IT updates and installations. The Data Analyst will assist in training and coaching new and current IT team members.

title: Systems Test Engineer
description: Description Whisker is the maker of Litter-Robot, Feeder-Robot, and Litterbox.com. At Whisker, we believe pet parenthood can always get better. As leading innovators in pet tech and refined pet accessories, we work tirelessly to solve problems and deliver smarter insights for pet parents while enriching the lives of pets. Whether it’s a self-cleaning litter box that automates scooping, an automatic feeder that helps pets develop healthier eating habits, or a modern cat tree that delights both humans and felines, we strive to deliver better solutions for consumers while transforming pet care along the way. To us, having a pet is the best thing ever. At Whisker, life together just keeps getting better. Whisker is based in Auburn Hills, Michigan and Juneau, Wisconsin with 500+ passionate team members. What You’ll Do : The Systems Test Engineer will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams on defining and owning the execution of the test and validation strategies on upcoming smart connected Pet products. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: This list of duties and responsibilities is not all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities as deemed necessary. Tests, verifies and validates an ecosystem of consumer IoT pet products with electro-mechanical sub-assemblies and an array of sensor technologies. Engages with technology program leads and various SMEs in evolving the overall system architecture and platform through the implementation of robust test strategies. Collaborates with Electrical, Firmware and Mechanical engineering teams in the development of test plans for prototype builds and maintains ownership of engineering test fixtures. Collaborates with Manufacturing and CM partners on the development of production test fixtures. Defines acceptance criteria and maintains test outcome traceability between product specifications and test plan. Builds and maintains a robust and scalable test data logging and reporting platform with integrated automation features. Documents and communicates project progress, challenges, and solutions to stakeholders. Ensures compliance with all relevant safety and regulatory standards. Demonstrates a strong commitment to quality and attention to detail. Will perform additional responsibilities when required. Requirements What You’ll Bring : BS in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Engineering or other related technical field or equivalent experience 3+ years of product development experience in testing, verification and validation methodologies Experience with resolving systems integration pain points across electrical, firmware, and mechanical systems Ability to review and understand design documents such as electrical schematics, mechanical drawings, behavioral state machines and other layout/packaging files Experience in using Python, Labview and/or other frameworks for hardware test automation Familiarity with ECAD and MCAD tools such as Altium, Creo and/or Solidworks Knowledgeable in the operation of electrical and mechanical testing equipment Exposure to PLM tools and release/change management processes Comfortable with working in a cross-functional matrix style organization A high degree of initiative, self-motivation, and ability to motivate others Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with Team Members and colleagues Maintains confidentiality of proprietary information Comfortable with office pets (dogs, cats) Nice to Have! Experience with using platforms such Raspberry PI, Arduino, etc. for proof of concept testing Familiarity in C/C++ programming for Microcontrollers 3D printing and machine shop know-how Previous or current pet parent Benefits & Purrks: Join a tenacious, inventive company that empowers team members to chart their own path, lead by grounding decisions in the “why”, and has a strong sense of empathy and openness to new perspectives. Be a part of exciting growth, work with incredible people, and create tomorrow’s pet products—plus a whole lot of extras. You will also be provided with: Premium Medical/Dental/Vision insurance Paid parental leave Whisker Parents Program 1 day "pawternity" leave for new pet adoption Pet Insurance 401K match Flexible spending accounts Company-paid short-term disability and life insurance Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Generous paid time off 14 Paid Holidays Top of the line equipment Pet-friendly office Whisker products and swag Continuing education Support On-site gym with Peloton Referral program Statement of Inclusivity: We believe different perspectives make Whisker better and strive to create a place where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive. Please ensure to regularly check your email spam folder for any communication from Whisker to avoid missing important updates regarding your application status. #onsite1

The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, experience in testing methodologies, and a passion for pet products.  Responsibilities include defining and executing test strategies, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and ensuring compliance with safety standards.

title: Document Management Analyst I
description: Employment Type: Full Time, Entry-level Department: Legal Services Here at CGS, we are seeking an entry-level Document Management Analyst/ General Clerk to facilitate the case closing process and data archiving of Federal Records material. The Document Management Analyst will help in the organization of important documents and help the attorneys prepare for trial. CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities. Skills and attributes for success: Create detailed indexing of case files; Drafting procedures for accomplishing litigation support assignments; Document acquisition-related tasks; and Conducting database searches Proofreads and edits deliverable products Sometimes serves as "team leader" for a more extensive group of Document Management Technicians and clerical support staff Often works with minimal supervision. Reports to Task Supervisor, Project Supervisor or assigned staff The Document Management Analyst may also perform the following tasks but not limited to: Collate and review evidence in newly submitted claims Responsible for reviewing claim-related evidence, database management, and accurately documenting the steps per guidelines May assist with case management activities on an as-needed basis Filing, retrieving, and copying case file materials; Creating witness binders; Preparing deposition and trial exhibits; Entering data online to case files and other databases; Proofreading, editing, and correcting OCR'd text files; Retrieving and blowing back documents and digital image media; Tabbing, numbering, labeling, and assembling documents; Filling out log sheets and reporting on task progress; and Performing quality control on the work of peers in all assigned areas Ensures that formats of documents to be filed meet applicable requirements Assists attorneys and support staff as assigned Qualifications: One year of experience on major litigation support projects or undergraduate degree. Certain assignments may require experience or substantial undergraduate coursework in, for example, finance/accounting, health care, or substantial experience in the legal environment or in information technology Demonstrated ability to work independently in a team environment Requires hands-on familiarity with the Government's office and network environment, including but not limited to, data processing environments, including office automation networks, PC-based databases and other applications, internet and server-based databases and other applications, such as Oracle, Relativity or other document review platform, Trial Director, etc or similar applications/databases Should be a knowledgeable user of the Government's office and network environment, including but not limited to, word processing, spreadsheet, imaging, and hardware systems Strong document review skill set (reviewing claims, patient records, etc....) The ability to consistently deliver the highest quality work under extreme pressure will be very important Ability to obtain a Public Trust clearance Must be a United States citizen Ideally, you will also have: Experience working in a Government and/or Litigation Support environment in conjunction with basic qualifications, is preferred Automated litigation support experience, is helpful Experience working with claims Current or active clearance Our commitment Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems. For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work. Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come. We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. Health, Dental, and Vision Life Insurance 401k Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter) Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays Contact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Join our team and become part of government innovation! Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board: https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/ For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact: Email: info@cgsfederal.com

Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365, Azure AD and Defender - Implementation, Administration, Monitoring and troubleshooting. Dell Storage Solutions (Compellent) - Architect and implement solutions, Pure Storage Preferred Qualifications The ideal candidate will also have: Advanced MS Office Suite Software, MS Server/Systems Software skills Knowledge of Linux-Oversee architecture and solutions. VMware Certified Associate - Data Center Virtualization (VCA-DCV) experience designing and implementing VMWare solutions (OR) 5+ equivalent years of experience Certificate and/or Licenses: VMware Certified Associate-Data Center Virtualization (VCA-DCV) Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA) OR 1 year experience Microsoft Certified Systems Expert OR 5+ years' experience Good Understanding of Oracle PaaS configuration services Preferred to have Oracle Cloud Experience
summary: This is a Systems Engineer position based in Romulus, MI requiring 5+ years of experience with virtual environments, VMware technologies, Microsoft SCCM, Azure/365, and cloud technologies. Strong knowledge of VEEAM Backup, Dell Compellent storage, and Pure Storage is preferred. The ideal candidate will have advanced MS Office Suite skills, Linux knowledge, and VMware and Microsoft certifications.

title: Senior Systems Analyst
description: Employment Type: Full Time, Senior-level Department: Information Technology CGS is seeking a Senior Systems Analyst to join our team supporting a wide-ranging technical support initiative for a large Federal agency. CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities. Skills and attributes for success: Develop, manage, and document a workflow process to identify, archive, and delete materials according to the requisite destruction/deletion policy and in accordance with Division, Department, and NARA instruction/policy Typically reports to the Contractor IT Manager, to the Systems Manager, or to the Lead Project Manager Consult with COR, Government Case Managers, and trial attorneys as to system requirements and proposed technical approach to IT needs Based on information gathered from such consultations, determines system and project requirements Based on the definition of system requirements, design the entire system to meet those requirements On smaller projects, may perform the entire range of technical support, including program validations and testing, etc Performs systems evaluations Makes presentations of findings, recommendations, and specifications in formal reports and in oral presentations Also consults with COR regarding task orders, scheduling of work, personnel assignments, priorities and progress reporting, plans, staff, schedules, and develops cost estimates for work to be performed under task orders Reports on contract and task order progress Directs and supervises personnel assigned to perform on-task orders, ensuring conformance to work standards and ensuring that the technical design conforms to functional requirements Ensures successful completion of work, timeliness of deliverables, and quality control Prepares system/technical documentation Works under the configuration management plan Performs and supervises the technical aspects of the tasks Organizes and conducts user training sessions on systems developed Prepares training material and training manuals on systems developed Qualifications: Significant Relativity experience including the creation of ARMs (Archive/Restore/Move) Must be able to create and refine Relativity ARM workflows and standard operating procedures Must demonstrate substantial, hands-on, successful experience in actually doing the work on the systems being used, usually at least five years of such experience Requires broad knowledge of the Government's IT environments, including office automation networks, and PC and server-based databases and applications Experience in a litigation support environment is extremely helpful Excellent oral and written communication skills are required Supervisory experience is very strongly preferred The ability to lead a technical team, and to give it direction, will be very important, as will the demonstrated ability to analyze the attorneys' needs and to design and implement a whole system solution responsive to those needs Ideally, you will also have: Relativity Certified Administrator or Relativity Infrastructure Specialist certification is strongly preferred Our Commitment: Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems. For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government-contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work. Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come. We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. Health, Dental, and Vision Life Insurance 401k Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter) Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays Contact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Join our team and become part of government innovation! Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board: https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/ For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact: Email: info@cgsfederal.com
summary: CGS is seeking a Senior Systems Analyst to support a large Federal agency. They will also have broad knowledge of the Government's IT environments, including office automation networks, and PC and server-based databases and applications. Experience in a litigation support environment is helpful. This is a full-time, senior-level position that reports to the Contractor IT Manager, Systems Manager, or Lead Project Manager.

title: Identity & Access Management Service Optimization Engineer I (REMOTE)
description: Employment Type Full time Shift Day Shift Description (Sorry we cannot sponsor an H1b visa nor support a STEM OPT EAD for this role.) POSITION PURPOSE Responsible for enterprise level support, standards and best practices for identity access management (IAM) and IAM related services. These include Microsoft Azure Active Directory, Microsoft Active Directory, SailPoint IdentityNow, Certificate Services (PKI), M365 and CyberArk. The primary job responsibilities of the Multi-Platform Engineer are to participate in technical system design and deploy customer projects and activations. Deploy new technologies and implementation and configuration of systems and applications. Provide knowledge of the interactions between technologies and applications across product lines. The primary job responsibility of the Service Optimization Engineer I is to support and optimize financial, clinical, informational and infrastructure System/Platforms that provide business customers with optimally performing services. Additionally, a Service Optimization Engineer I collaborates with Product Engineering, Product Management and Enterprise Information Security to assure seamless transition of new products and designs to Service Optimization. The Service Optimization Engineer I serves as the operational subject matter expert, coordinating with other TIS Product Centric Organization teams; to support and optimize technology-based business solutions. This includes applications and infrastructure leveraging Trinity Enterprise Data Centers and Cloud resources (i.e., PaaS, IaaS and SaaS), serving as a platform specific technology support expert. Furthermore, the Service Optimization Engineer I serves in a lead and/or support role in the operation and optimization of platforms, products and applications within their respective teams as well as how those applications interface with other teams. Essential Functions Responsible for enterprise level support, standards and best practices for identity access management (IAM) and IAM related services. These include Microsoft Azure Active Directory, Microsoft Active Directory, SailPoint IdentityNow, Certificate Services (PKI), M365 and CyberArk. Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge and understanding of one or more of the following scripting languages Java, PowerShell or SailPoint Beanshell Possess working knowledge of JSON, REST and API integrations and security Knows, understands, incorporates, and demonstrates the Trinity Health Mission, Vision, and Values in behaviors, practices and decisions. Provides a high level of technical support of platform and product designs and collaborates with cross-functional team (Product Engineering, Product Management, Business Owners, etc.) to assure the successful deployment of any design or product. Monitors and analyzes the current state of platforms to assure performance is within pre-determined thresholds. Collaborates with vendors and other teams in matters of products, troubleshooting, maintenance and documentation. Proposes procedures and solutions which assure the team is functioning at the highest possible level at the lowest possible cost. Implements platform technology in conjunction with established platform strategy. Identifies, escalates, and supports process improvement initiatives to optimize efficiency, reliability, and quality of service. Participates in research and makes recommendations on products, services, protocols and standards in support of all infrastructure procurement and development efforts. Minimizes operational and capital costs through the reduction of inefficiencies in the environment. Keeps abreast of current and best practices, participates in continuing education and seminars. Performs environment capacity planning and performance monitoring on all platform hardware. Assures all hardware and software is covered by 24x7x365 maintenance contracts. Serves as first level for troubleshooting and escalation of critical issues. Provides 24x7x365 troubleshooting support for all teams. Resolves critical issues. Utilizes software and hardware tools to diagnose and resolve problems and factors affecting performance and service levels. Applies specialized technical knowledge of enterprise tools. Assures all hardware and software is performing at a fully optimized level. Participates in the development, implementation and testing of installs and upgrades to existing solutions. Participates in data migration and lifecycle projects. Participates in disaster recovery planning and exercises. Assures documentation is maintained and meets requirements. Attests to documentation maintenance annually. Accountable for the security configuration of supported solutions and makes sure they are up to date. Oversees implementation of security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation. Responsible for supporting and translating architectural designs. Performs other duties as assigned. Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State and local laws/regulations, the Trinity Health Integrity and Compliance Program and Code of Conduct as well as other policies and procedures in order to assure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical and professional behavior. [pay range $94,425.4906 - $141,638.2359] Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or a related field with five (5) years’ progressive experience, with expertise in hardware, software, application, and systems engineering within specific IT discipline (i.e., as strategic planning, solution engineering, technology engineering, network management, security management, change management, application development, middleware design, information analysis, database management, project management and operations management). An equivalent combination of education will be considered. Ability to provide technical guidance and serve as a subject matter expert to team members. Ability to serve as a mentor to less experienced team members and provide training and guidance on system functionality and software products. Comprehensive skills in technical documentation, DevOps and ITIL concepts. Knowledge of cloud platforms or software as a service application (SaaS applications). Knowledge of security concepts with hands-on experience in implementing security controls and compliance requirements. Must be comfortable operating in a collaborative, shared leadership environment. Must possess a personal presence that is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity, and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals, and values of Trinity Health. Outstanding oral and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills. Adept at multi-tasking. Ability to remain calm, helpful, and productive in all situations, including critical support situations. Physical And Mental Requirements And Working Conditions Must be able to set and organize own work priorities and adapt to them as they change frequently. Must be able to work concurrently on a variety of tasks/projects in an environment that may be stressful with individuals having diverse personalities and work styles. This position operates in a typical office environment. The area is well-lit, temperature-controlled and free from hazards. Incumbent communicates frequently, in person and over the telephone, with others in different locations working jointly on technical issues. The environment in which the incumbent will work requires the ability to concentrate, meet deadlines, work on several projects at the same period and adapt to interruptions. Must possess the ability to comply with Trinity Health policies and procedures. Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of duties so assigned. Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion Trinity Health is one of the largest not-for-profit, Catholic healthcare systems in the nation. Built on the foundation of our Mission and Core Values, we integrate diversity, equity, and inclusion in all that we do. Our colleagues have different lived experiences, customs, abilities, and talents. Together, we become our best selves. A diverse and inclusive workforce provides the most accessible and equitable care for those we serve. Trinity Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by law. 00520851
summary: Trinity Health seeks a Multi-Platform Engineer with 5+ years of experience to provide enterprise-level support for IAM services including Azure AD, Active Directory, SailPoint IdentityNow, CyberArk, and more. The role involves system design, deployment, troubleshooting, security configuration, and optimization of these platforms.

title: Systems Engineer II
description: The Level II Systems Engineer at InZernet Technologies will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the company's computer systems and networks. This individual will work closely with clients to understand their needs and provide solutions through the company's products and services. The Level II Systems Engineer will also be responsible for troubleshooting and resolving technical issues, as well as providing technical support to other team members.Key Responsibilities:Providing technical support to users, including troubleshooting and resolving issues with hardware, software, and systems.Participating in the design and implementation of systems, including choosing hardware and software solutions, configuring servers and networking equipment, and developing and testing scripts and automation tools.Monitoring and managing the performance and availability of systems, including performance tuning, capacity planning, and disaster recovery planning.Managing and maintaining documentation for systems, including technical specifications, network diagrams, and procedures.Collaborating with other teams, such as the network and security teams, to ensure that systems are secure and compliant with company policies and industry regulations.Providing guidance and mentorship to junior team members, as neededRequirements:Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field3+ years of experience in systems engineering or a related fieldExpertise in a variety of operating systems and networksStrong problem-solving and communication skillsAbility to work independently and as part of a teamBenefits:InZernet Technologies offers a competitive benefits package, which may include health insurance, retirement savings plans, paid time off, and other perks and discounts. More specific information on the benefits offered will be provided during the hiring process.
summary: Level II Systems Engineer at InZernet Technologies is responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining computer systems and networks. This role requires strong technical expertise, problem-solving, and communication skills to support clients, troubleshoot issues, and collaborate with other teams.

title: System Analyst Manager
description: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential job functions satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the primary job functions herein described. Since every duty associated with this position may not be described herein, employees may be required to perform duties not specifically spelled out in the job description, but which may be reasonably considered to be incidental in the performing of their duties just as though they were written out in this job description. GRPS MISSION : Our mission is to ensure that all students are educated, self-directed and productive members of society. SYSTEMS ANALYST MANAGER Department: Student Data Services Unit: Professional Administrative Exempt Salary: Compensation range listed is based on an average 1-15 years of experience, as determine by Human Resources Job Summary Grade 108 – Specific salary based on experience The Systems Analyst Manager is based in the Student Data Services Department. The manager is responsible for project organization and execution and will participate in design, vendor evaluation, implementation, and management of multiple projects. The manager does not supervise staff, but will provide technical direction, and will manage and coordinate the work of the analyst staff in the development and implementation of systems and problem solving. Essential Job Functions Essential functions under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) may include any of the following duties, knowledge, and skills. The list below is illustrative only and is not a comprehensive summary of all functions and duties performed by employees in this position. Regular on time and in person attendance is an essential function of this job. Other essential functions may include, but are not limited to: Perform systems analysis, database design/programming, and training. Maintain knowledge of the district’s student information system, its development and uses. Perform analysis and make recommendations in areas that require a high level of technical competency. Perform a variety of complex programming tasks, such as designing, documenting, and coding program logic. Implement principles and practices of effective project management, team building, leadership, and conflict resolution. Implement principles, methods, and techniques used in designing, developing, testing, and implementing computer hardware and software systems. Provide technical training, guidance, and resource support for end users and departmental staff. Provide application support and enhancements to existing applications. Define system requirements, priorities, and viable alternatives. Coordinate the efforts of staff to locate, assess, install, test, and maintain computer software systems. Coordinate conversions and upgrades to vendor systems. Perform as a project lead and provide leadership and coordination on projects assigned to systems analysts. Create and maintain records as directed. In addition to all accountabilities of the Systems Analyst position, assume greater leadership role, utilizing broader knowledge and high-level technical skills. Assist in developing user documentation and departmental policies and procedures that impact the use of application systems. Maintain the confidentiality of student and staff records. Provide excellent customer services. Produce extracts and submit data to State of Michigan for school funding. Including General Collections for Fall, Spring and EOY; Early Roster for determination of Free/Reduced lunch status; Student Record Maintenance (SRM); Early Childhood collection (GSRP) Fall, Spring and EOY; Teacher Student Data Link (TSDL); 3rd Grade Retention; Section 25; Request for UIC; School Infrastructure Database (SID). Produce extracts and submit data to the Federal Government for the Civil Rights Data Collection. Produce reports to identify potential data issues for state/federal reporting. Work with departments within GRPS to ensure clean data. Process third party imports into Synergy, including: UICs from State of Michigan, Direct Certification lunch status from State of Michigan, Special Ed information from KISD. Work directly with the Solutions Architect Manager of Application Development, Director of Management Information Systems and MIS Department Staff to provide technical level access, knowledge, and solutions to the SIS Database including the creation and maintenance of custom SQL Queries Lead and or assist in requirements gathering meetings with third party vendors or internal GRPS Staff at all levels of the organization (e.g., Curriculum, Health Department, ED’s, Superintendent, etc.) Attend technical staff meetings and training (recurring meetings with state vendors, national/state users conferences, etc.) and effectively deploy knowledge gained for benefit of team. Assist department staff with generating districtwide Report Cards. Develop, maintain, and support Synergy custom functionality such as Online Registration, GRPS IRIP, etc. Perform systems analysis and database design/programming. Maintain knowledge of the district’s student information system as well as its development and uses. Perform analysis and make recommendations in areas that require a high level of technical competency. Perform a variety of complex programming tasks, such as design, documenting, and coding of program logic. Implement principles, methods and techniques used in designing, developing, testing, and implementing computer, hardware, and software systems. Provide technical training, guidance, and resource support for end users and departmental staff. Support the work of the System Analyst(s). Distribute the workload of the analyst. Perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications Required Qualifications : Bachelor’s degree in computer science, systems/industrial engineering, business administration, or related field. Minimum two years’ experience in systems analysis. Preferred Qualifications Experience working directly with a K-12 student information system as a system analyst or programmer. Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Demonstrated knowledge of: Microsoft Visual Studio; SQL; SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS); and SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) Methods and techniques of developing and presenting technical documentation and training materials. Ability to exercise independent judgment in planning, organizing, and performing systems analyst tasks. Ability to communicate, motivate, and organize projects among a broad spectrum of personnel throughout the school district, frequently under deadline pressures. Excellent telephone etiquette and oral communication skills. Ability to deal with high stress situations and timelines, prioritize multiple tasks at once, work independently as well as in a team environment, and make independent decisions as needed. Americans With Disabilities (ada) Requirements The physical demands, work environment factors, and mental functions described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. ADA Accommodation Request: Assistance with the application process may be requested through the Human Resources Department at (616) 819-2022 or humanresources@grps.org . PHYSICAL DEMANDS While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand, walk, sit, use hands to finger, handle, or feel, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, talk, and hear (in a quiet or noisy environment). The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and ability to adjust/focus. WORK ENVIRONMENT The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Work is performed indoors. Mental Functions While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to compare, analyze, communicate both orally and in writing, copy, coordinate, instruct, compute, synthesize, evaluate, use interpersonal skills, compile, and negotiate. NON-DISCRIMINATION The Grand Rapids Public Schools will not discriminate against any person based on race, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, height, weight, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, pregnancy, disability, veteran, or military status.

title: Salesforce Developer
description: Job Title: Salesforce Developer Location: Lansing, MI ( Hybrid ) Duration: Long Term 40 Hrs Job In-Person Interview Description As a Salesforce Developer/Cloud Architect, you will be responsible to provide technical oversight for all new and existing SaaS implementations for the Agency Services Support team at the Department of Technology, Management, and Budget. The SaaS CRM solutions primarily involve integrations using Salesforce. Responsibilities for this position include but are not limited to: Participate in vendor's solution design sessions for client projects providing design guidance in areas such as extensions/modifications, data conversion, environment provisioning and application integration to ensure the vendor solution is efficient, cost-effective, and easily maintainable for SOM. Assist DTMB employees to work with the customer and end users to define technical requirements for new projects and any future enhancements. Assist DTMB employees to lead technical workshops and design sessions with the customer. Propose/Articulate design/architecture options with pros/cons Ensure that the technical requirements tie back to the established customer requirements and performance goals and that the technical direction is consistent with the client's long-term strategy. Fully understand the capabilities and limitations of the technical environments of the applications used by the enterprise. Review technical architecture deliverables throughout development to ensure quality and requirements traceability. Has overall technical responsibility for the technical aspects of the project environments Compile internal development guidelines/standards for the development team and ensure the team is following those standards. Provide oversight on QA efforts to ensure adherence to quality assurance standards. Ensures the proposed solutions adhere to SOM security guidelines and standards throughout the application lifecycle. Proven record of delivering business value by leveraging technology and an ability to communicate strategic technical concepts at an executive level and be a trusted voice at the decision-making table. Devise a training plan for the development team for a smooth and successful transition to Maintenance & Operations Provide training and mentorship to DTMB employees to ensure DTMB team will be successful to support the Salesforce applications after one year. Technical leadership, to include coaching and mentoring, setting best practices including integration and application development, deployment, testing (unit and systems), and iterative refinement. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Salesforce Strong knowledge and working experience on Service Cloud Participation in each phase of full Salesforce.com lifecycle implementations In-depth understanding of the capabilities and constraints of the Salesforce Strong technical foundation: advanced structured programming (APEX, Force.com, .Net, Java), relational database concepts and structures, structured system analysis and design methods, etc. Demonstrates successful implementation of Batch Apex and/or Schedule Apex development. Understands web services and other technologies that can be used to transport data in an enterprise environment and interact with Salesforce.com Ownership of all End-to-End technical aspects of a Salesforce.com program: data migrations, data quality, systems integrations, 3rd party applications, AppExchange products, and custom development Define, communicate, and manage technical change management (e.g., release) processes for all Salesforce.com related technology efforts Assess Salesforce.com architecture and provide secure, high-performance technical solutions on the Force.com platform Design and document technical architecture solutions that span multiple platforms and include integration and authentication across systems CICD/Release Management Identification of risks and issues from technical perspective. The successful candidate will be a self-motivated individual, who can work under dynamic conditions and within deadlines. Qualifications Salesforce experience Minimum 8+ years' experience leading Enterprise Salesforce implementation and administration Experience with SFDX and Salesforce Development Lifecycle Experience with SUMO Scheduler Experience with Mobile App Scanner functionality with Salesforce Azure DevOps experience Azure DevOps best practices Understanding of Azure Licensing and Costing is a plus. Minimum of two full lifecycle CRM or ERP implementations leading a technical workstream such as integration, data conversion or extension development. Exposure to data migration and/or cloud integration projects Good understanding of LCS (Life Cycle Services) Experience in other technologies such as SQL, PowerBI along with good knowledge C# and the .Net framework. Code build and deployment via Visual Studio Team Services and LifeCycle Services. MS Dynamics 365 exposure Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 is a plus but not required. Required Certifications Salesforce Certified Developer Salesforce Certified Administrator Preferred Certifications or equivalent experience Salesforce Certified System Architect Salesforce Certified Application Architect Salesforce Experience Cloud Consultant Understanding of governmental or public sector security and compliance requirements
summary: Salesforce Developer/Cloud Architect responsible for providing technical oversight for new and existing SaaS implementations at the Department of Technology, Management, and Budget (DTMB).  The role involves designing, implementing, and supporting Salesforce CRM solutions, leading technical workshops, and ensuring adherence to security guidelines.  This position requires strong technical skills, experience with Salesforce, and the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders.

title: Revenue Cycle Analyst I
description: Position Summary: The Revenue Cycle Analyst I is responsible for the review, education, maintenance, reporting and improvement of all aspects of the Revenue Cycle. This includes the monitoring of Revenue Cycle systems, development of reports and data sets, analyzing revenue, provide education, identify root causes and recommend/design improvements. The Revenue Cycle Analyst I will report directly to Process Improvement. Essential Functions and Responsibilities: Responsible for more than two (2) Analyst job assignments in the CBO Accountable for at least one Patient Financial Services Activity: Reporting/Data Extraction Analytics System Implementation/Software Administration Reporting/ Tracking Training/Education Process Improvement System Maintenance Analyze front-end delays and problems related to complete and accurate information needed for timely billing. Monitor and improve the insurance verification and point of service collection process. ENROLLMENT Leads and assists with maintaining and updating enrollment paperwork for EDI, ERA and EFT applications to support ongoing projects. Works in collaboration with CBS operations, payers and vendors to obtain supporting documentation and information required for related enrollment programs. Compile and maintain current supporting documentation and information for each facility (hospital, urgent care center, rural health clinic, etc.). Including but not limited to enrollment/payer set up, bank information, provider-based and RHC locations, contacts, etc. Prepare, maintain, and respond to payer requests for accuracy of facilities (hospitals, urgent care center, rural health facilities, etc.) Obtains, maintains, and monitors remittance and claims reports to identify gaps in enrollment processes Coordinates with credentialing and contracting teams to complete enrollments for ongoing initiatives i.e. RHC implementation Minimum : Bachelor’s degree required or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience may be acceptable One to two years related revenue cycle experience or one to two years consulting in systems or training for data analytics Proven skills in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel and Word, Window based applications, and 10 key calculator with high level of quality outcomes Preferred : Working knowledge of CPT, HCPCS, and ICD-10 One to two years’ experience in hospital financial services or patient service Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans Additional Information Schedule: Full-time Requisition ID: 24004499 Daily Work Times: 7-5:30 Hours Per Pay Period: 80 On Call: No Weekends: Yes
